empty
sonnets
by william shakespeare
empty
from fairest creatures desire increase
thereby beauty's rose might never die
but as riper should by time decease
his tender heir might bear his memory
but thou contracted thine own bright eyes
making famine where abundance lies
thy self thy foe thy sweet self too cruel
thou art now world's fresh ornament
only herald gaudy spring
within thine own bud buriest thy content
tender churl mak'st waste niggarding
pity world or else this glutton
eat world's due by grave thee
empty
dig deep trenches thy beauty's field
thy youth's proud livery so gazed now
will tattered weed small worth held
then being asked where all thy beauty lies
where all treasure thy lusty days
say within thine own deep sunken eyes
were an all eating shame thriftless praise
how much more praise deserved thy beauty's use
if thou couldst answer 'this fair child mine
proving his beauty by succession thine
this were new made when thou art old
see thy blood warm when thou feelst cold
empty
look thy glass tell face thou viewest
now time face should form another
whose fresh repair if now thou not renewest
thou dost beguile world unbless some mother
where she so fair whose uneared womb
or who he so fond will tomb
his self love stop posterity
thou art thy mother's glass she thee
calls back lovely april her prime
so thou through windows thine age shalt see
despite wrinkles this thy golden time
but if thou live remembered not
die single thine image dies thee
empty
upon thy self thy beauty's legacy
nature's bequest gives nothing but doth lend
being frank she lends those are free
then beauteous niggard why dost thou abuse
bounteous largess given thee give
profitless usurer why dost thou use
so great sum sums yet canst not live
having traffic thy self alone
thou thy self thy sweet self dost deceive
what acceptable audit canst thou leave
thy unused beauty must tombed thee
which used lives th' executor
empty
those hours gentle work did frame
lovely gaze where every eye doth dwell
will play tyrants very same
unfair which fairly doth excel
never resting time leads summer
sap checked frost lusty leaves quite gone
beauty o'er snowed bareness every where
then were not summer's distillation left
liquid prisoner pent walls glass
beauty's effect beauty were bereft
nor nor no remembrance what was
but flowers distilled though they winter meet
leese but their show their substance still lives sweet
empty
thee thy summer ere thou distilled
make sweet some vial treasure thou some place
beauty's treasure ere self killed
use not forbidden usury
which happies those pay willing loan
that's thy self breed another thee
or ten times happier ten one
ten times thy self were happier than thou art
if ten thine ten times refigured thee
leaving thee living posterity
not self willed thou art much too fair
death's conquest make worms thine heir
empty
lo orient when gracious light
lifts up his burning head each under eye
doth homage his new appearing sight
serving looks his sacred majesty
having climbed steep up heavenly hill
yet mortal looks adore his beauty still
attending his golden pilgrimage
but when from highmost pitch weary car
feeble age he reeleth from day
eyes fore duteous now converted are
from his low tract look another way
so thou thy self out going thy noon
unlooked diest unless thou get son
empty
sweets sweets war not joy delights joy
why lov'st thou which thou receiv'st not gladly
or else receiv'st pleasure thine annoy
if true concord well tuned sounds
by unions married do offend thine ear
they do but sweetly chide thee who confounds
singleness parts thou shouldst bear
mark how one string sweet husband another
strikes each each by mutual ordering
who all one one pleasing note do sing
whose speechless song being many seeming one
sings this thee 'thou single wilt prove none'
empty
fear wet widow's eye
thou consum'st thy self single life
ah if thou issueless shalt hap die
world will wail thee makeless wife
world will thy widow still weep
when every private widow well may keep
by childrens eyes her husband's shape mind
look what an unthrift world doth spend
shifts but his place still world enjoys
but beauty's waste hath world an end
kept unused user so destroys
no love toward others bosom sits
himself such murd'rous shame commits
empty
who thy self art so unprovident
grant if thou wilt thou art beloved many
but thou none lov'st most evident
thou art so possessed murd'rous hate
'gainst thy self thou stick'st not conspire
seeking beauteous roof ruinate
which repair should thy chief desire
o change thy thought may change mind
shall hate fairer lodged than gentle love
or thy self at least kind hearted prove
make thee another self love
beauty still may live thine or thee
empty
as fast as thou shalt wane so fast thou grow'st
one thine from which thou departest
fresh blood which youngly thou bestow'st
thou mayst call thine when thou from youth convertest
herein lives wisdom beauty increase
if all were minded so times should cease
threescore year would make world away
let those whom nature hath not made store
harsh featureless rude barrenly perish
look whom she best endowed she gave thee more
which bounteous gift thou shouldst bounty cherish
she carved thee her seal meant thereby
thou shouldst print more not let copy die
empty
see brave day sunk hideous night
when behold violet past prime
sable curls all silvered o'er white
when lofty trees see barren leaves
which erst from heat did canopy herd
summer's green all girded up sheaves
borne bier white bristly beard
then thy beauty do question make
thou among wastes time must go
die as fast as they see others grow
nothing 'gainst time's scythe can make defence
save breed brave him when he takes thee hence
empty
o were self but love are
no longer yours than self here live
against this coming end should prepare
sweet semblance some other give
so should beauty which hold lease
self again after self's decease
when sweet issue sweet form should bear
who lets so fair house fall decay
which husbandry honour might uphold
against stormy gusts winter's day
barren rage death's eternal cold
o none but unthrifts dear love know
had father let son say so
empty
yet methinks have astronomy
but not tell good or evil luck
plagues dearths or seasons' quality
nor can fortune brief minutes tell
pointing each his thunder rain wind
or say princes if shall go well
by oft predict heaven find
but from thine eyes knowledge derive
constant stars them read such art
if from thy self store thou wouldst convert
or else thee this prognosticate
thy end truth's beauty's doom date
empty
when consider every thing grows
holds perfection but little moment
this huge stage presenteth nought but shows
whereon stars secret influence comment
when perceive men as plants increase
vaunt their youthful sap at height decrease
wear their brave state out memory
then conceit this inconstant stay
sets most rich youth before sight
where wasteful time debateth decay
change day youth sullied night
all war time love
as he takes from engraft new
empty
make war upon this bloody tyrant time
fortify self decay
means more blessed than barren rhyme
now stand top happy hours
many maiden gardens yet unset
virtuous wish would bear living flowers
much liker than painted counterfeit
so should lines life life repair
which this time's pencil or pupil pen
can make live self eyes men
give away self keeps self still
must live drawn by own sweet skill
empty
who will believe verse time come
if were filled most high deserts
though yet heaven knows but as tomb
which hides life shows not half parts
if could write beauty eyes
age come would say this poet lies
such heavenly touches ne'er touched earthly faces
so should papers yellowed their age
scorned old men less truth than tongue
true rights termed poet's rage
stretched metre an antique song
but were some child yours alive time
should live twice rhyme
empty
thou art more lovely more temperate
rough winds do shake darling buds may
summer's lease hath all too short date
sometime too hot eye heaven shines
often his gold complexion dimmed
every fair from fair sometime declines
by chance or nature's changing course untrimmed
but thy eternal summer shall not fade
nor lose possession fair thou ow'st
when eternal lines time thou grow'st
so long as men can breathe or eyes can see
so long lives this this gives life thee
empty
devouring time blunt thou lions paws
make earth devour her own sweet brood
pluck keen teeth from fierce tiger's jaws
burn long lived phoenix her blood
make glad sorry seasons as thou fleet'st
wide world all her fading sweets
but forbid thee one most heinous crime
o carve not thy hours love's fair brow
nor draw no lines there thine antique pen
him thy course untainted do allow
beauty's pattern succeeding men
yet do thy worst old time despite thy wrong
love shall verse ever live young
empty
hast thou master mistress passion
womans gentle heart but not acquainted
shifting change as false womens fashion
an eye more bright than theirs less false rolling
gilding object whereupon gazeth
man hue all hues his controlling
which steals mens eyes womens souls amazeth
woman wert thou first created
till nature as she wrought thee fell doting
by adding one thing purpose nothing
but since she pricked thee out womens pleasure
mine thy love thy love's use their treasure
empty
so not as muse
stirred by painted beauty his verse
who heaven self ornament doth use
every fair his fair doth rehearse
making couplement proud compare
aprils first born flowers all things rare
heavens air this huge rondure hems
o let true love but truly write
then believe love as fair
as any mother's child though not so bright
as those gold candles fixed heavens air
let them say more hearsay well
will not praise purpose not sell
empty
so long as youth thou are one date
but when thee time's furrows behold
then look death days should expiate
all beauty doth cover thee
but seemly raiment heart
which thy breast doth live as thine
how can then elder than thou art
o therefore love thyself so wary
as not self but thee will
as tender nurse her babe from faring ill
presume not thy heart when mine slain
thou gav'st thine not give back again
empty
as an unperfect actor stage
who his fear put beside his part
or some fierce thing replete too much rage
whose strength's abundance weakens his own heart
so fear trust forget say
mine own love's strength seem decay
o'ercharged burthen mine own love's might
o let looks then eloquence
dumb presagers speaking breast
who plead love look recompense
more than tongue more hath more expressed
o learn read what silent love hath writ
hear eyes belongs love's fine wit
empty
thy beauty's form table heart
body frame wherein 'tis held
perspective best painter's art
through painter must see his skill
find where true image pictured lies
which bosom's shop hanging still
hath his windows glazed thine eyes
now see what good turns eyes eyes have done
mine eyes have drawn thy shape thine
delights peep gaze therein thee
yet eyes this cunning want grace their art
they draw but what they see know not heart
empty
let those who are favour their stars
public honour proud titles boast
whilst whom fortune such triumph bars
unlooked joy honour most
great princes' favourites their fair leaves spread
themselves their pride lies buried
at frown they their glory die
painful warrior famoused fight
after thousand victories once foiled
from book honour razed quite
all rest forgot which he toiled
then happy love am beloved
where may not remove nor removed
empty
thy merit hath duty strongly knit
thee send this written embassage
witness duty not show wit
duty so great which wit so poor as mine
may make seem bare wanting words show

thy souls thought all naked will bestow
till whatsoever star guides moving
points graciously fair aspect
show worthy thy sweet respect
then may dare boast how do love thee
till then not show head where thou mayst prove
empty

dear respose limbs travel tired

empty
am debarred benefit rest
when day's oppression not eased by night

empty

all losses are restored sorrows end
empty

all triumphant splendour brow

yet him this love no whit disdaineth
suns world may stain when heavens sun staineth
empty

empty

empty

come tender appliance
all bound humbleness
king thank maiden
but may not so credulous cure
when our most learned doctors leave us
congregated college have concluded
labouring art can never ransom nature
from her inaidable estate say must not
prostitute our past cure malady
empirics or dissever so
our great self our credit esteem
senseless help when help past sense deem
helena duty then shall pay pains
will no more enforce mine office
humbly entreating from royal thoughts
modest one bear back again
king cannot give thee less calld grateful
as one near death those wish him live
but what at full know thou know'st no part
knowing all peril thou no art
helena what can do can do no hurt try
since set up rest 'gainst remedy
he greatest works finisher
oft does them by weakest minister
so holy writ babes hath judgment shown
when judges have been babes great floods have flown
when miracles have by greatest been denied
oft expectation fails most oft there
where most promises oft hits
where hope coldest despair most fits
king must not hear thee fare thee well kind maid
thy pains not us'd must by thyself paid
proffers not took reap thanks their reward
helena inspired merit so by breath barr'd
not so him all things knows
but most presumption us when
help heaven count act men
dear sir endeavours give consent
heaven not make an experiment
am not an impostor proclaim
myself against level mine aim
but know think think know most sure
art not past power nor past cure
king art thou so confident within what space
helena greatest grace lending grace
ere twice horses sun shall bring
their fiery torcher his diurnal ring
ere twice murk occidental damp
moist hesperus hath quench'd his sleepy lamp
or four twenty times pilot's glass
hath told thievish minutes how they pass
what infirm from sound parts shall fly
health shall live free sickness freely die
what dar'st thou venture
helena tax impudence
strumpet's boldness divulged shame
traduc'd by odious ballads maidens name
sear'd otherwise ne worse worst extended
vilest torture let life ended
king methinks thee some blessed spirit doth speak
his powerful sound within an organ weak
what impossibility would slay
thy life dear all life can rate
worth name life thee hath estimate
youth beauty wisdom courage all
happiness prime can happy call
thou this hazard needs must intimate
skill infinite or monstrous desperate
sweet practiser thy physic will try
ministers thine own death if die
helena if break time or flinch property
well deserv'd not helping death's fee
but if help what do promise
king make thy demand
helena but will make even
king ay by sceptre hopes heaven
helena then shalt thou give thy kingly hand
what husband thy power will command
exempted from arrogance
choose from forth royal blood france
any branch or image thy state
but such one thy vassal whom know
free ask thee bestow
king here hand premises observ'd
thy will by performance shall serv'd
so make choice thy own time
thy resolv'd patient thee still rely
more should question thee more must
though more know could not more trust
unquestiond welcome undoubted blest
give some help here ho if thou proceed
as high as word deed shall match thy deed
flourish exeunt

hundred them

help mine own eyes

what she has done
but never hope know why should marry her

she had her breeding at father's charge

rather corrupt ever

can build up strange our bloods
would quite confound distinction yet stand off
differences so mighty if she
all virtuous save what thou dislik'st
poor physicians daughter thou dislik'st
virtue name but do not so
from lowest place when virtuous things proceed
place dignified by doer's deed
where great additions swells virtue none
dropsied honour good alone
property by what should go
not by title she young wise fair
these nature she's immediate heir
these breed honour honour's scorn
which challenges itself as honour's born
not sire honours thrive
when rather from our acts them derive
than our fore goers mere word's slave
debauch'd every tomb every grave

shall weigh thee beam wilt not know

act iii scene 4
enter countess steward
countess alas would take letter her
might not know she would do as she has done

barefoot plod cold ground upon
sainted vow faults have amended
write write from bloody course war
bless him at home peace whilst from far
his name zealous fervour sanctify
his taken labours bid him forgive
his despiteful juno sent him forth
from courtly friends camping foes live
where death danger dogs heels worth
he too good fair death
whom myself embrace set him free'

as letting her pass so had spoke her
could have well diverted her intents
which thus she hath prevented

if had given this at over night
she might have been o'er ta'en yet she writes
pursuit would but vain
countess what angel shall
bless this unworthy husband he cannot thrive
loves grant reprieve him from wrath
greatest justice write write rinaldo
this unworthy husband his wife
let every word weigh heavy her worth
he does weigh too light greatest grief
though little he do feel set down sharply
dispatch most convenient messenger
when haply he shall hear she gone
he will return hope may she
led hither by pure love which them both
dearest have no skill sense
make distinction provide this messenger
heart heavy mine age weak
grief would have tears sorrow bids speak exeunt

king well excus'd

crying 'that's good that's gone' our rash faults
make trivial price serious things have
not knowing them until know their grave
oft our displeasures ourselves unjust
destroy our friends after weep their dust

which most should safe going

since becomings kill when they do not

strew'd before feet

scene iv
enter octavius caesar reading letter lepidus their train
caesar may see lepidus henceforth know
not caesar's natural vice hate
our great competitor from alexandria
this news he fishes drinks wastes
lamps night revel not more manlike
than cleopatra nor queen ptolemy
more womanly than he hardly gave audience or
vouchsaf'd think he had partners shall find there
all men follow
lepidus must not think there are
evils enow darken all his goodness
his faults him seem as spots heaven
more fiery by night's blackness hereditary
rather than purchas'd what he cannot change
than what he chooses
caesar are too indulgent let's grant not
amiss tumble bed ptolemy
keep turn tippling slave
reel streets at noon stand buffet
knaves smell sweat say this becomes him
as his composure must rare indeed
whom these things cannot blemish yet must antony
no way excuse his foils when do bear
so great weight his lightness if he filld
his vacancy his voluptuousness
full surfeits dryness his bones
drums him from his sport speaks as loud
as his own state ours 'tis chid
as rate boys who being mature knowledge
pawn their experience their present pleasure
so rebel judgment
enter messenger
lepidus here's more news
messenger thy biddings have been done every hour
most noble caesar shalt thou have report
appears he belov'd those
only have fear'd caesar ports
discontents repair mens reports
give him much wrong'd
caesar should have known no less
hath been taught us from primal state
he which was wish'd until he were
ebb'd man ne'er lov'd till ne'er worth love
comes dear'd by being lack'd this common body
goes back lackeying varying tide
rot itself motion
messenger caesar bring thee word
menecrates menas famous pirates
make sea serve them which they ear wound
keels every kind many hot inroads
they make italy borders maritime
lack blood think ont flush youth revolt
no vessel can peep forth but 'tis as soon
than could his war resisted
caesar antony
leave thy lascivious wassails when thou once
was beaten from modena where thou slew'st
hirtius pansa consuls at thy heel
did famine follow whom thou fought'st against
though daintily brought up patience more
than savages could suffer thou didst drink
stale horses gilded puddle
roughest berry rudest hedge
yea stag when snow pasture sheets
barks trees thou brows'd alps
reported thou didst eat strange flesh
which some did die look all this
wounds thine honour speak now
was borne so soldier thy cheek
so much as lank'd not
lepidus 'tis pity him
drive him rome 'tis time twain
did show ourselves i' th' field end
assemble immediate council pompey
thrives our idleness
lepidus morrow caesar
shall furnish'd inform rightly
both what by sea land can able
front this present time
caesar till which encounter
lepidus farewell lord what shall know meantime
stirs abroad shall beseech sir
let partaker
caesar doubt not sir
knew bond exeunt
scene v
alexandria cleopatra's palace
enter cleopatra charmian iras mardian
cleopatra charmian
cleopatra ha ha
give drink mandragora
charmian why madam
cleopatra might sleep out this great gap time
antony away
charmian think him too much
cleopatra o 'tis treason
charmian madam trust not so
cleopatra thou eunuch mardian
cleopatra not now hear thee sing take no pleasure
aught an eunuch has 'tis well thee
being unseminar'd thy freer thoughts
may not fly forth egypt hast thou affections
mardian yes gracious madam
cleopatra indeed

but what indeed honest done
yet have fierce affections think
cleopatra o charmian
where think'st thou he now stands he or sits he
or does he walk or he his horse
o happy horse bear weight antony
do bravely horse wot'st thou whom thou mov'st
demi atlas this earth arm
burgonet men he's speaking now

enter alexas
alexas sovereign egypt hail

how goes brave mark antony
alexas last thing he did dear queen
he kiss'd last many doubled kisses
this orient pearl his speech sticks heart
cleopatra mine ear must pluck thence
alexas 'good friend' quoth he
'say firm roman great egypt sends
mend petty present will piece
her opulent throne kingdoms all east
say thou shall call her mistress' so he nodded
soberly did mount an arm gaunt steed
who neigh'd so high what would have spoke
was beastly dumb'd by him
cleopatra what was he sad or merry
alexas time o' th' year between extremes
hot cold he was nor sad nor merry
note him good charmian 'tis man but note him
he was not sad he would shine those
make their looks by his he was not merry
which seem'd tell them his remembrance lay
egypt his joy but between both
o heavenly mingle be'st thou sad or merry
violence either thee becomes
so does no man else met'st thou posts
alexas ay madam twenty several messengers

is't not trick

cleopatra dreamt there was an emperor antony
o such another sleep might see
but such another man
dolabella if might please ye
cleopatra his face was as heav'ns therein stuck
sun moon which kept their course lighted
dolabella most sovereign creature
cleopatra his legs bestrid ocean his rear'd arm
crested world his voice was propertied
as all tuned spheres friends
but when he meant quail shake orb
he was as rattling thunder his bounty
there was no winter int an autumn 'twas
grew more by reaping his delights
were dolphin they show'd his back above
walk'd crowns crownets realms islands were
as plates dropp'd from his pocket
dolabella cleopatra
cleopatra think there was or might such man
as this dreamt
dolabella gentle madam no
cleopatra lie up hearing gods
but if there nor ever were one such
it's past size drearning nature wants stuff
an antony were nature's piece 'gainst fancy
condemning shadows quite
dolabella hear good madam
loss as yourself great bear
as answering weight would might never
o'ertake pursu'd success but do feel
by rebound yours grief smites
very heart at root
cleopatra thank sir
dolabella am loath tell what would knew
cleopatra nay pray sir
dolabella though he honourable
cleopatra he'll lead then triumph

act scene
orchard oliver's house
enter orlando adam
orlando as remember adam was upon this fashion bequeathed
by will but poor thousand crowns as thou say'st
charged brother his blessing breed well there
begins sadness brother jaques he keeps at school
report speaks goldenly his profit part he keeps
home unkept call keeping gentleman
birth differs not from stalling an ox his horses are
bred better besides they are fair their feeding
they are taught their manage end riders dearly
hir'd but his brother gain nothing under him but growth
which his animals his dunghills are as much bound him
as besides this nothing he so plentifully gives
something nature gave his countenance seems take from
he lets feed his hinds bars place
education this adam grieves spirit
father which think within begins mutiny against
this servitude will no longer endure though yet know no
wise remedy how avoid
enter oliver
adam yonder comes master brother
orlando go apart adam thou shalt hear how he will shake
up adam retires
oliver now sir what make here
oliver what mar then sir

poor unworthy brother yours idleness

orlando shall keep hogs eat husks them what
prodigal portion have spent should come such penury
oliver know where are sir
orlando o sir very well here orchard
oliver know before whom sir
eldest brother gentle condition blood
should so know courtesy nations allows better
are first born but same tradition takes not
away blood were there twenty brothers betwixt us have as
much father as albeit confess coming
before nearer his reverence
oliver what boy strikes him
orlando come come elder brother are too young this
oliver wilt thou lay hands villain
boys he was father he thrice villain says such
father begot villains wert thou not brother would not
take this hand from thy throat till this other had pulld out thy
tongue saying so thou has raild thyself
adam coming forward sweet masters patient father's
remembrance at accord
oliver let go say
orlando will not till please shall hear father
charg'd his will give good education have
gentleman qualities spirit father grows strong
will no longer endure therefore allow such
exercises as may become gentleman or give poor
allottery father left by testament will go buy
fortunes

get will not long troubled shall have

such word

her father

charles they say he already forest arden many

england they say many young gentlemen flock him every day
fleet time carelessly as they did golden world

charles marry do sir came acquaint
matter am given sir secretly understand younger
brother orlando hath disposition come disguis'd against
escapes without some broken limb shall acquit him well
brother but young tender love would
loath foil him as must own honour if he come
therefore out love came hither acquaint
withal either might stay him from his intendment
or brook such disgrace well as he shall run into
thing his own search altogether against will
oliver charles thank thee thy love which thou shalt
find will most kindly requite had myself notice
dissuade him from but he resolute i'll tell thee
charles stubbornest young fellow france full
ambition an envious emulator every mans good parts secret
villainous contriver against his natural brother
therefore use thy discretion had as lief thou didst break his
neck as his finger thou wert best look to't if thou
dost him any slight disgrace or if he do not mightily grace
himself thee he will practise against thee by poison entrap
thee by some treacherous device never leave thee till he
assure thee almost tears speak there not one
so young so villainous this day living speak but brotherly
him but should anatomize him thee as he must blush
weep thou must look pale wonder
charles am heartily glad came hither if he come
morrow i'll give him his payment if ever he go alone again
i'll never wrestle prize more so god keep worship
empty
oliver farewell good charles now will stir this gamester
hates nothing more than he yet he's gentle never schoold
yet learned full noble device all sorts enchantingly
beloved indeed so much heart world
especially own people who best know him am
altogether misprised but shall not so long this wrestler
shall clear all nothing remains but kindle boy
thither which now i'll go about exit

scene iii
duke's palace
enter celia rosalind
celia why cousin why rosalind cupid have mercy
not word

throw some them at come lame reasons
lam'd reasons other mad without any

rosalind no some child's father o how full
briers this working day world
celia they are but burs cousin thrown upon thee holiday
foolery if walk not trodden paths our very petticoats
will catch them
rosalind could shake them off coat these burs are
empty
rosalind would try if could cry 'hem' have him
celia come come wrestle thy affections
rosalind o they take part better wrestler than myself
celia o good wish upon will try time despite
fall but turning these jests out service let us talk
good earnest possible such sudden should fall
into so strong liking old sir rowland's youngest son
rosalind duke father lov'd his father dearly
celia doth therefore ensue should love his son dearly
father dearly yet hate not orlando
rosalind no faith hate him not sake

enter duke frederick lords
rosalind let love him do love him because
do look here comes duke
celia his eyes full anger
frederick mistress dispatch safest haste
get from our court
frederick cousin
within these ten days if thou beest found
so near our public court as twenty miles
thou diest
rosalind do beseech grace
let knowledge fault bear
if myself hold intelligence
or have acquaintance mine own desires
if do not dream or not frantic
never so much as thought unborn
did offend highness
frederick thus do all traitors
if their purgation did consist words
they are as innocent as grace itself
let suffice thee trust thee not
rosalind yet mistrust cannot make traitor
tell whereon likelihood depends
frederick thou art thy father's daughter there's enough
so was when highness banish'd him
treason not inherited lord
or if did derive from our friends
what's father was no traitor
then good liege mistake not so much
think poverty treacherous
celia dear sovereign hear speak
frederick ay celia stay'd her sake
else had she her father rang'd along
was pleasure own remorse
was too young time value her
but now know her if she traitor
why so am still have slept together
rose at an instant learnd play'd eat together
wheresoe'er went juno's swans
still went coupled inseparable
frederick she too subtle thee her smoothness
her very silence her patience
thou art fool she robs thee thy name
thou wilt show more bright seem more virtuous
when she gone then open not thy lips
firm irrevocable doom
which have pass'd upon her she banish'd
celia pronounce sentence then liege
cannot live out her company
frederick are fool niece provide yourself
if outstay time upon mine honour
exeunt duke lords
celia o poor rosalind whither wilt thou go
wilt thou change fathers will give thee mine
charge thee not thou more griev'd than am
rosalind have more cause
celia thou hast not cousin
prithee cheerful know'st thou not duke
hath banish'd his daughter
rosalind he hath not
which teacheth thee thou am one
shall sund'red shall part sweet girl
no let father seek another heir
therefore devise how may fly
whither go what bear us
do not seek take charge upon
bear griefs yourself leave out
by this heaven now at our sorrows pale
say what thou canst i'll go along thee
celia seek uncle forest arden
rosalind alas what danger will us
maids as are travel forth so far
beauty provoketh thieves sooner than gold
celia i'll put myself poor mean attire
kind umber smirch face
do so shall pass along
never stir assailants
rosalind were not better
did suit all points man
gallant curtle axe upon thigh
boar spear hand heart
lie there what hidden womans fear there will
we'll have swashing martial outside
as many other mannish cowards have
do outface their semblances
celia what shall call thee when thou art man
rosalind i'll have no worse name than jove's own page
but what will calld
celia something hath reference state
no longer celia but aliena
rosalind but cousin what if assay'd steal
clownish fool out father's court
would he not comfort our travel
celia he'll go along o'er wide world
leave alone woo him let's away
get our jewels our wealth together
hide us from pursuit will made
after flight now go content
liberty not banishment exeunt
act ii scene
forest arden
enter duke senior amiens two or three lords foresters
duke senior now co mates brothers exile
hath not old custom made this life more sweet
than painted pomp are not these woods
here feel not penalty adam
seasons' difference as icy fang
churlish chiding winter's wind
which when bites blows upon body
even till shrink cold smile say
'this no flattery these are counsellors
feelingly persuade what am'
sweet are uses adversity
which toad ugly venomous
this our life exempt from public haunt
finds tongues trees books running brooks
sermons stones good everything
would not change
amiens happy grace
can translate stubbornness fortune
into so quiet so sweet style
duke senior come shall go kill us venison
yet irks poor dappled fools
should their own confines forked heads
have their round haunches gor'd
first lord indeed lord
melancholy jaques grieves at
kind swears do more usurp
than doth brother hath banish'd
day lord amiens myself
did steal behind him as he lay along
under an oak whose antique root peeps out
which place poor sequest'red stag
from hunter's aim had ta'en hurt
did come languish indeed lord
wretched animal heav'd forth such groans
their discharge did stretch his leathern coat
almost bursting big round tears
cours'd one another down his innocent nose
piteous chase thus hairy fool
much marked melancholy jaques
augmenting tears
duke senior but what said jaques
did he not moralize this spectacle
first lord o yes into thousand similes
first his weeping into needless stream
'poor deer' quoth he 'thou mak'st testament
as worldlings do giving thy sum more
which had too much' then being there alone
left abandoned his velvet friends
flux company' anon careless herd
full pasture jumps along by him
never stays greet him 'ay' quoth jaques
'sweep fat greasy citizens
'tis just fashion wherefore do look
upon poor broken bankrupt there'
thus most invectively he pierceth through
body country city court
yea this our life swearing
fright animals kill them up
their assignd native dwelling place
duke senior did leave him this contemplation
second lord did lord weeping commenting
upon sobbing deer
duke senior show place
love cope him these sullen fits
then he's full matter
first lord i'll bring him straight exeunt
duke's palace
enter duke frederick lords
frederick can possible no man saw them
cannot some villains court
are consent sufferance this
first lord cannot hear any did see her
ladies her attendants her chamber
saw her abed morning early
they found bed untreasur'd their mistress
grace was wont laugh also missing
hisperia princess' gentlewoman
confesses she secretly o'erheard
daughter her cousin much commend
parts graces wrestler
did but lately foil sinewy charles
she believes wherever they are gone
youth surely their company
frederick send his brother fetch gallant hither
i'll make him find him do this suddenly
let not search inquisition quail
bring again these foolish runaways exeunt
scene iii
before oliver's house
enter orlando adam meeting
orlando who's there
adam what young master o gentle master
o sweet master o memory
why are virtuous why do people love
wherefore are gentle strong valiant
why would so fond overcome
bonny prizer humorous duke
praise come too swiftly home before
know not master some kind men
their graces serve them but as enemies
no more do yours virtues gentle master
are sanctified holy traitors
envenoms him bears
orlando why what's matter
adam o unhappy youth
come not within these doors within this roof
enemy all graces lives
brother no no brother yet son
yet not son will not call him son
him was about call his father
hath heard praises this night he means
within if he fail
he will have other means cut off
overheard him his practices
this no place this house but butchery
abhor fear do not enter
orlando why whither adam wouldst thou have go
adam no matter whither so come not here
orlando what wouldst thou have go beg food
or base boist'rous sword enforce
this must do or know not what do
yet this will not do do how can
rather will subject malice
diverted blood bloody brother
adam but do not so have five hundred crowns
thrifty hire sav'd under father
which did store foster nurse
when service should old limbs lie lame
unregarded age corners thrown
yea providently caters sparrow
comfort age here gold
all this give let servant
though look old yet am strong lusty
youth never did apply
hot rebellious liquors blood
nor did not unbashful forehead woo
means weakness debility
therefore age as lusty winter
i'll do service younger man
all business necessities
orlando o good old man how well thee appears
constant service antique world
when service sweat duty not meed
thou art not fashion these times
where none will sweat but promotion
having do choke their service up
even having not so thee
cannot so much as blossom yield
lieu all thy pains husbandry
but come thy ways we'll go along together
ere have thy youthful wages spent
we'll light upon some settled low content
adam master go will follow
last gasp truth loyalty
from seventeen years till now almost four score
here lived but now live here no more
but at fourscore too late week
yet fortune cannot recompense better
than die well not master's debtor exeunt

corin way make her scorn still
silvius o corin thou knew'st how do love her

silvius no corin being old thou canst not guess
though thy youth thou wast as true lover

but if thy love were ever mine
how many actions most ridiculous
hast thou been drawn by thy fantasy
corin into thousand have forgotten
silvius o thou didst then never love so heartily

abruptly as passion now makes
thou hast not lov'd

faints succour

wish her sake more than mine own
fortunes were more able relieve her
do not shear fleeces graze
master churlish disposition
little recks find way heaven
by doing deeds hospitality
besides his cote his flocks bounds feed
are now sale at our sheepcote now

will feed but what come see
voice most welcome shall

scene vi
forest
enter orlando adam
adam dear master can go no further o die food here lie

scene vii
forest
table set out enter duke senior amiens lords outlaws
duke senior think he transform'd into beast
can nowhere find him man
first lord lord he but even now gone hence

shall have shortly discord spheres
go seek him tell him would speak him
enter jaques
first lord he saves labour by his own approach
duke senior why how now monsieur what life this
poor friends must woo company
what look merrily
jaques fool fool met fool i' th' forest
motley fool miserable world
who laid him down bask'd him sun
raild lady fortune good terms
good set terms yet motley fool
'good morrow fool' quoth 'no sir' quoth he
'call not fool till heaven hath sent fortune'
then he drew dial from his poke
looking lack lustre eye
says very wisely 'it ten o'clock
thus may see' quoth he 'how world wags
after one hour more 'twill eleven
so from hour hour ripe ripe
then from hour hour rot rot
thereby hangs tale' when did hear
motley fool thus moral time
lungs began crow chanticleer
fools should so deep contemplative
did laugh sans intermission
an hour by his dial o noble fool
duke senior what fool this
jaques o worthy fool one hath been courtier
says if ladies but young fair
they have gift know his brain
which as dry as remainder biscuit
after voyage he hath strange places cramm'd
observation which he vents
mangled forms o were fool
am ambitious motley coat
jaques only suit
provided weed better judgments
all opinion grows rank them
am wise must have liberty
withal as large charter as wind
blow whom please so fools have
they are most galled folly
they most must laugh why sir must they so
why plain as way parish church
doth very foolishly although he smart
not seem senseless bob if not
wise mans folly anatomiz'd
even by squand'ring glances fool
invest motley give leave
speak mind will through through
cleanse foul body th' infected world
if they will patiently receive medicine
duke senior fie thee can tell what thou wouldst do
duke senior most mischievous foul sin chiding sin
thou thyself hast been libertine
as sensual as brutish sting itself
all th' embossed sores headed evils
thou license free foot hast caught
wouldst thou disgorge into general world
jaques why who cries out pride
can therein tax any private party
doth not flow as hugely as sea
what woman city do name
when say city woman bears
cost princes unworthy shoulders
who can come say mean her
when such one as she such her neighbour
or what he basest function
says his bravery not cost
thinking mean him but therein suits
his folly mettle speech
tongue hath wrong'd him if do him right
then he hath wrong'd himself if he free
why then taxing wild goose flies
unclaim'd any man but who comes here
enter orlando his sword drawn
orlando forbear eat no more
jaques why have eat none yet
orlando nor shalt not till necessity serv'd
jaques what kind should this cock come
or else rude despiser good manners
civility thou seem'st so empty
orlando touch'd vein at first thorny point
bare distress hath ta'en from show
smooth civility yet arn inland bred
know some nurture but forbear say
he dies touches any this fruit
till affairs are answered
jaques an will not answer'd reason must die
more than force move us gentleness
orlando almost die food let have
duke senior sit down feed welcome our table
orlando speak so gently pardon pray
thought all things had been savage here
therefore put countenance
stern commandment but whate'er are
this desert inaccessible
under shade melancholy boughs
if ever have look'd better days
if ever been where bells have knolld church
if ever sat at any good mans feast
if ever from eyelids wip'd tear
know what 'tis pity pitied
let gentleness strong enforcement
which hope blush hide sword
duke senior true have seen better days
have holy bell been knolld church
drops sacred pity hath engend'red
therefore sit down gentleness
take upon command what help have
wanting may minist'red
orlando then but forbear food little while
whiles doe go find fawn
give food there an old poor man
who after hath many weary step
limp'd pure love till he first suffic'd
will not touch bit
duke senior go find him out
will nothing waste till return
orlando thank ye blest good comfort
empty
duke senior thou seest are not all alone unhappy
this wide universal theatre
presents more woeful pageants than scene
wherein play
all men women merely players
they have their exits their entrances
one man his time plays many parts
his acts being seven ages at first infant
mewling puking nurse's arms
then whining school boy his satchel
shining morning face creeping snail
unwillingly school then lover
sighing furnace woeful ballad
full strange oaths bearded pard
jealous honour sudden quick quarrel
seeking bubble reputation
even cannons mouth then justice
fair round belly good capon lind
eyes severe beard formal cut
full wise saws modern instances
so he plays his part sixth age shifts
into lean slipper'd pantaloon
his youthful hose well sav'd world too wide
his shrunk shank his big manly voice
turning again toward childish treble pipes
whistles his sound last scene all
ends this strange eventful history
second childishness mere oblivion
sans teeth sans eyes sans taste sans every thing
re enter orlando adam
duke senior welcome set down venerable burden
orlando thank most him
adam so had need
scarce can speak thank myself
duke senior welcome fall will not trouble
as yet question about fortunes
give us some music good cousin sing
empty
blow blow thou winter wind
thou art not so unkind
thy tooth not so keen
because thou art not seen
although thy breath rude
heigh ho sing heigh ho unto green holly
most friendship feigning most loving mere folly
then heigh ho holly
this life most jolly
freeze freeze thou bitter sky
dost not bite so nigh
though thou waters warp
thy sting not so sharp
as friend rememb'red not
heigh ho sing c
duke senior if were good sir rowland's son
as have whisper'd faithfully were
as mine eye doth his effigies witness
most truly limnd living face
truly welcome hither am duke
go cave tell good old man
thou art right welcome as thy master
support him by arm give hand
let all fortunes understand exeunt
act iii scene
palace

frederick not see him since sir sir cannot
but were not better part made mercy

seek living our territory
thy lands all things thou dost call thine
worth seizure do seize into our hands

what think against thee
never lov'd brother life

make an extent upon his house lands

enter corin touchstone
touchstone truly shepherd respect itself good
life but respect shepherd's life nought
respect solitary very well but
respect private very vile life now

not court tedious as spare life
look fits humour well but as there no more plenty
goes much against stomach hast any philosophy
thee shepherd
ease he he wants money means content
without three good friends property rain wet

empty

term then they perceive not how time moves

orlando accent something finer than could purchase
so removed dwelling

hath generally tax'd their whole sex withal

charge women

as halfpence are every one fault seeming monstrous till his

empty

then hose should ungarter'd bonnet unbanded

lie their consciences but good sooth are he
hangs verses trees wherein rosalind so admired
orlando swear thee youth by white hand rosalind

rosalind love merely madness tell deserves as
well dark house whip as madmen do reason why
they are not so punish'd cured lunacy so
ordinary whippers are love too yet profess curing
by counsel
orlando did ever cure any so
rosalind yes one this manner he was imagine his
time would being but moonish youth grieve effeminate
changeable longing liking proud fantastical apish
shallow inconstant full tears full smiles every

women are most part cattle this colour would now

weep him then spit at him drave suitor from his
mad humour love living humour madness which was
forswear full stream world live nook
upon wash liver as clean as sound sheep's heart
there shall not one spot love 't

come every day cote woo

strikes man more dead than great reckoning little room

scene v
another part forest
enter silvius phebe
silvius sweet phebe do not scorn do not phebe
say love not but say not so
bitterness common executioner

falls not axe upon humbled neck
but first begs pardon will sterner
enter rosalind celia corin at distance
phebe would not thy executioner
fly thee would not injure thee
thou tellst there murder mine eye
'tis pretty sure very probable
eyes are frailst softest things
who shut their coward gates atomies
should calld tyrants butchers murderers
now do frown thee all heart
now counterfeit swoon why now fall down
or if thou canst not o shame shame
lie not say mine eyes are murderers
now show wound mine eye hath made thee
scratch thee but pin there remains
some scar lean upon rush
cicatrice capable impressure
thy palm some moment keeps but now mine eyes
which have darted at thee hurt thee not
can do hurt
silvius o dear phebe
if ever as ever may near
meet some fresh cheek power fancy
then shall know wounds invisible
love's keen arrows make
phebe but till time
come not thou near when time comes
afflict thy mocks pity not

empty
insult exult all at once
over wretched what though have no beauty
as by faith see no more
than without candle may go dark bed
must therefore proud pitiless

think she means tangle eyes too
no faith proud mistress hope not after
'tis not inky brows black silk hair
bugle eyeballs nor cheek cream
can entame spirits worship
foolish shepherd wherefore do follow her
foggy south puffing wind rain
are thousand times properer man
than she woman 'tis such fools as

out she sees herself more proper
than any her lineaments can show her
but mistress know yourself down knees

must tell friendly ear
sell when can are not all markets

he hath bought cottage bounds
old carlot once was master
phebe think not love him though ask him
'tis but peevish boy yet he talks well
but what care words yet words do well
pretty youth not very pretty
but sure he's proud yet his pride becomes him
he'll make proper man best thing him
his complexion faster than his tongue
did make offence his eye did heal up
he not very tall yet his years he's tall
his leg but so so yet 'tis well
there was pretty redness his lip
little riper more lusty red
betwixt constant red mingled damask
there some women silvius had they mark'd him
parcels as did would have gone near
fall love him but part
love him not nor hate him not yet
have more cause hate him than love him
what had he do chide at
he said mine eyes were black hair black
now am rememb'red scornd at

i'll write him very taunting letter
thou shalt bear wilt thou silvius

matter's head heart
will bitter him passing short

what man am how why where
this handkercher was staind
celia pray tell
he left promise return again
within an hour pacing through forest
chewing food sweet bitter fancy
lo what befell he threw his eye aside
mark what object did present itself
under an oak whose boughs were moss'd age
high top bald dry antiquity
wretched ragged man o'ergrown hair
lay sleeping his back about his neck
who her head nimble threats approach'd
opening his mouth but suddenly
seeing orlando unlink'd itself
indented glides did slip away
into bush under which bush's shade
lioness udders all drawn dry
lay couching head ground catlike watch
when sleeping man should stir 'tis
royal disposition beast
this seen orlando did approach man
found was his brother his elder brother
celia o have heard him speak same brother
he did render him most unnatural
liv'd amongst men

well know he was unnatural

nature stronger than his just occasion
made him give battle lioness
who quickly fell before him which hurtling
from miserable slumber awak'd
celia are his brother
rosalind was't he rescu'd
celia was't did so oft contrive kill him

so sweetly tastes being thing am
rosalind but bloody napkin
oliver by by

brief he led gentle duke
who gave fresh array entertainment

brief recover'd him bound up his wound

tell this story might excuse
his broken promise give this napkin

comedy errors
act scene 1
hall duke's palace
enter duke ephesus aegeon merchant
aegeon proceed solinus procure fall
by doom death end woes all
duke merchant syracuse plead no more
am not partial infringe our laws
enmity discord which late
sprung from rancorous outrage duke
merchants our well dealing countrymen
who wanting guilders redeem their lives
have seald his rigorous statutes their bloods
since mortal intestine jars
'twixt thy seditious countrymen us
hath solemn synods been decreed
both by syracusians ourselves
admit no traffic our adverse towns
nay more if any born at ephesus
seen at any syracusian marts fairs
again if any syracusian born
come bay ephesus he dies
unless thousand marks levied
quit penalty ransom him
thy substance valued at highest rate
cannot amount unto hundred marks
therefore by law thou art condemnd die
aegeon yet this comfort when words are done
woes end likewise evening sun
duke well syracusian say brief cause
why thou departed'st from thy native home
aegeon heavier task could not have been impos'd
than speak griefs unspeakable
yet world may witness end
was wrought by nature not by vile offence
i'll utter what sorrow gives leave
syracuse was born wed
unto woman happy but
by had not our hap been bad
her liv'd joy our wealth increas'd
epidamnum till factor's death
great care goods at random left
drew from kind embracements spouse
from whom absence was not six months old
before herself almost at fainting under
pleasing punishment women bear
had made provision her following
soon safe arrived where was
there had she not been long but she became
which was strange one so other
as could not disdnguish'd but by names
very hour self same inn
mean woman was delivered
such burden male twins both alike
those their parents were exceeding poor
bought brought up attend sons
wife not meanly proud two such boys
made daily motions our home return
came aboard
league from epidamnum had saild
before always wind obeying deep
gave any tragic instance our harm
but longer did not retain much hope
what obscured light heavens did grant
did but convey unto our fearful minds
doubtful warrant immediate death
which though myself would gladly have embrac'd
weeping before what she saw must come
piteous plainings pretty babes
mournd fashion ignorant what fear
forc'd seek delays them
this was other means was none
sailors sought safety by our boat
left ship then sinking ripe us
wife more careful latter born
had fast'ned him unto small spare mast
him one other twins was bound
whilst had been heedful other
children thus dispos'd wife
fixing our eyes whom our care was fix'd
fast'ned ourselves at either end mast
floating straight obedient stream
was carried towards corinth as thought
at length sun gazing upon earth
dispers'd those vapours offended us
seas wax'd calm discovered
two ships from far making amain us
corinth epidaurus this
but ere they came o let say no more
gather sequel by went before
duke nay forward old man do not break off so
may pity though not pardon thee
aegeon o had gods done so had not now
worthily term'd them merciless us
were encount'red by mighty rock
which being violently borne upon
our helpful ship was splitted midst
so this unjust divorce us
fortune had left both us alike
what delight what sorrow
her part poor soul seeming as burdened
lesser weight but not lesser woe
was carried more speed before wind
by fishermen corinth as thought
at length another ship had seiz'd us
knowing whom was their hap save
gave healthful welcome their ship wreck'd guests
would have reft fishers their prey
had not their bark been very slow sail
therefore homeward did they bend their course
thus have heard sever'd from bliss
by misfortunes was life prolong'd
duke sake them thou sorrowest
do favour dilate at full
what have befalln them thee till now
aegeon youngest boy yet eldest care
at eighteen years became inquisitive
after his brother importund
his attendant so his case was
reft his brother but retaind his name
might bear him company quest him
hazarded loss whom lov'd
five summers have spent farthest greece
roaming clean through bounds asia
coasting homeward came ephesus
hopeless find yet loath leave unsought
or or any place harbours men
but here must end story life
happy were timely death
could all travels warrant they live
bear extremity dire mishap
now trust were not against our laws
against crown oath dignity
which princes would they may not disannul
soul should sue as advocate thee
but though thou art adjudged death
passed sentence may not recalld
but our honour's great disparagement
yet will favour thee what can
seek thy help by beneficial hap
try all friends thou hast ephesus
beg thou or borrow make up sum
live if no then thou art doom'd die
gaoler take him thy custody
gaoler will lord
aegeon hopeless helpless doth aegeon wend
but procrastinate his lifeless end
empty
mart
enter antipholus syracuse dromio syracuse first merchant
first merchant therefore give out are epidamnum
lest goods too soon confiscate
this very day syracusian merchant
apprehended arrival here
not being able buy out his life
according statute town
dies ere weary sun set west
antipholus syracuse go bear centaur where host
stay there dromio till come thee
within this hour will dinner time
till i'll view manners town
peruse traders gaze upon buildings
then return sleep within mine inn
long travel am stiff weary
get thee away
dromio syracuse many man would take at word
empty
antipholus syracuse trusty villain sir very oft
when am dull care melancholy
lightens humour his merry jests
what will walk about town
then go inn dine
first merchant am invited sir certain merchants
whom hope make much benefit
crave pardon soon at five o'clock
afterward consort till bed time
present business calls from now
antipholus syracuse farewell till then will go lose myself
wander up down view city
first merchant sir commend own content
exit first merchant
antipholus syracuse he commends mine own content
commends thing cannot get
world am drop water
who falling there find his fellow forth
unseen inquisitive confounds himself
so find mother brother
quest them unhappy lose myself
enter dromio ephesus
here comes almanac true date
what now how chance thou art returnd so soon
dromio ephesus returnd so soon rather approach'd too late
capon burns pig falls from spit
mistress made one upon cheek
she so hot because meat cold
meat cold because come not home
come not home because have no stomach
have no stomach having broke fast
but know what 'tis fast pray
are penitent default day
antipholus syracuse stop wind sir tell this pray
where have left money gave
pay saddler mistress' crupper
saddler had sir kept not
antipholus syracuse am not sportive humour now
tell dally not where money
being strangers here how dar'st thou trust
so great charge from thine own custody
dromio ephesus pray jest sir as sit at dinner
from mistress come post
if return shall post indeed
methinks maw mine should clock
strike home without messenger
antipholus syracuse come dromio come these jests are out season
reserve them till merrier hour than this
where gold gave charge thee
dromio ephesus sir why gave no gold
antipholus syracuse come sir knave have done foolishness
tell how thou hast dispos'd thy charge
dromio ephesus charge was but fetch from mart
mistress her sister stays
antipholus syracuse now as am christian answer
what safe place have bestow'd money
or shall break merry sconce yours
stands tricks when am undispos'd
where thousand marks thou hadst
dromio ephesus have some marks yours upon pate
some mistress' marks upon shoulders
but not thousand marks between both
perchance will not bear them patiently
antipholus syracuse thy mistress' marks what mistress slave hast thou
dromio ephesus worship's wife mistress at phoenix
she doth fast till come home dinner
prays will hie home dinner
antipholus syracuse what wilt thou flout thus unto face
being forbid there take sir knave
beats him
dromio ephesus what mean sir god's sake hold hands
empty
antipholus syracuse upon life by some device or other
villain o'erraught all money
they say this town full cozenage
as nimble jugglers deceive eye
dark working sorcerers change mind
soul killing witches deform body
disguised cheaters prating mountebanks
many such liberties sin
i'll centaur go seek this slave
greatly fear money not safe

act il scene 1
house antipholus ephesus
enter adriana wife antipholus ephesus luciana her sister
adriana neither husband nor slave returnd
such haste sent seek his master
sure luciana two o'clock
from mart he's somewhere gone dinner
good sister let us dine never fret
man master his liberty
time their master when they see time
they'll go or come if so patient sister
adriana why should their liberty than ours more
luciana because their business still lies out o' door
adriana look when serve him so he takes ill
luciana o know he bridle will
luciana why headstrong liberty lash'd woe
there's nothing situate under heavens eye
but hath his bound earth sea sky
beasts fishes winged fowls
are their males' subjects at their controls
man more divine master all these
lord wide world wild wat'ry seas
indu'd intellectual sense souls
more pre eminence than fish fowls
then let will attend their accords
adriana this servitude makes keep unwed
luciana not this but troubles marriage bed
adriana but were wedded would bear some sway
luciana ere learn love i'll practise obey
adriana how if husband start some other where
luciana till he come home again would forbear
adriana patience unmov'd no marvel though she pause
they can meek have no other cause
bid quiet when hear cry
but were burd'ned weight pain
as much or more should ourselves complain
so thou hast no unkind mate grieve thee
urging helpless patience would relieve
but if thou live see right bereft
this fool begg'd patience thee will left
luciana well will marry one day but try
here comes man now husband nigh
adriana say tardy master now at hand
dromio ephesus nay he's at two hands two
ears can witness
adriana say didst thou speak him know'st thou his mind
dromio ephesus ay ay he told his mind upon mine ear
beshrew his hand scarce could understand
luciana spake he so doubtfully thou could'st not feel his meaning
dromio ephesus nay he struck so plainly could
well feel his blows withal so doubtfully could
adriana but say prithee he coming home
seems he hath great care please his wife
dromio ephesus why mistress sure master horn mad
adriana horn mad thou villain
dromio ephesus mean not cuckold mad
but sure he stark mad
when desir'd him come home dinner
he ask'd thousand marks gold
tis dinner time' quoth 'my gold' quoth he
'will come home' quoth 'my gold' quoth he
'where thousand marks gave thee villain'
'the pig' quoth 'is burnd' 'my gold' quoth he
'my mistress sir' quoth 'hang up thy mistress
know not thy mistress out thy mistress'
luciana quoth who
dromio ephesus quoth master
'i know' quoth he 'no house no wife no mistress'
so errand due unto tongue
conclusion he did beat there
adriana go back again thou slave fetch him home
dromio ephesus go back again new beaten home
god's sake send some other messenger
adriana back slave or will break thy pate across
dromio ephesus he will bless cross other beating
between shall have holy head
adriana hence prating peasant fetch thy master home
dromio ephesus am so round as
spurn hence he will spurn hither
if last this service must case leather
empty
luciana fie how impatience loureth face
adriana his company must do his minions grace
whilst at home starve merry look
hath homely age th' alluring beauty took
from poor cheek then he hath wasted
are discourses dull barren wit
unkindness blunts more than marble hard
do their gay vestments his affections bait
that's not fault he's master state
what ruins are can found
by him not ruind then he ground
defeatures decayed fair
sunny look his would soon repair
but too unruly deer he breaks pale
feeds from home poor am but his stale
adriana unfeeling fools can such wrongs dispense
know his eye doth homage otherwhere
or else what lets but he would here
sister know he promis'd chain
would alone love he would detain
so he would keep fair quarter his bed
see jewel best enamelled
will lose his beauty yet gold bides still
others touch often touching will
by falsehood corruption doth shame
since beauty cannot please his eye
i'll weep what's left away weeping die
luciana how many fond fools serve mad jealousy
empty
scene 2
mart
enter antipholus syracuse

wand'red forth care seek out
by computation mine host's report
could not speak dromio since at first
sent him from mart see here he comes
enter dromio syracuse
how now sir merry humour alter'd
as love strokes so jest again
know no centaur receiv'd no gold
mistress sent have home dinner
thus so madly thou didst answer
dromio syracuse what answer sir when spake such word
antipholus syracuse even now even here not half an hour since
dromio syracuse did not see since sent hence
home centaur gold gave
antipholus syracuse villain thou didst deny gold's receipt
told'st mistress dinner
which hope thou felt'st was displeas'd
dromio syracuse am glad see this merry vein
antipholus syracuse yea dost thou jeer flout teeth
think'st thou jest hold take thou
beating him
dromio syracuse hold sir god's sake now jest earnest
upon what bargain do give
antipholus syracuse because familiarly sometimes
do use fool chat
sauciness will jest upon love
make common serious hours
but creep crannies when he hides his beams
if will jest know aspect
fashion demeanour looks
or will beat this method sconce
dromio syracuse sconce call so would
leave battering had rather have head an use
these blows long must get sconce head
insconce too or else shall seek wit shoulders
but pray sir why am beaten
dromio syracuse nothing sir but am beaten
antipholus syracuse shall tell why
dromio syracuse ay sir wherefore they say
every why hath wherefore
antipholus syracuse why first flouting then wherefore
urging second time
dromio syracuse was there ever any man thus beaten out season
when why wherefore neither rhyme nor reason
well sir thank
dromio syracuse marry sir this something gave
nothing
antipholus syracuse i'll make amends next
give nothing something but say sir dinnertime
dromio syracuse no sir think meat wants have
antipholus syracuse good time sir what's
dromio syracuse basting
antipholus syracuse well sir then 'twill dry
dromio syracuse if sir pray eat none
dromio syracuse lest make choleric purchase
another dry basting
antipholus syracuse well sir learn jest good time
there's time all things
dromio syracuse durst have denied before
were so choleric
antipholus syracuse by what rule sir
dromio syracuse marry sir by rule as plain as
plain bald pate father time himself
dromio syracuse there's no time man recover
his hair grows bald by nature
antipholus syracuse may he not do by fine recovery
dromio syracuse yes pay fine periwig
recover lost hair another man
antipholus syracuse why time such niggard
hair being as so plentiful an excrement
dromio syracuse because blessing he bestows
beasts what he hath scanted men hair he hath
antipholus syracuse why but there's many man
hath more hair than wit
dromio syracuse not man those but he hath
wit lose his hair
antipholus syracuse why thou didst conclude hairy
men plain dealers without wit
dromio syracuse plainer dealer sooner lost
yet he loseth kind jollity
antipholus syracuse what reason
antipholus syracuse nay not sound pray
dromio syracuse sure ones then
antipholus syracuse nay not sure thing falsing
dromio syracuse certain ones then
antipholus syracuse name them
dromio syracuse one save money he spends
tiring other at dinner they should not drop his
empty
antipholus syracuse would all this time have prov'd there
dromio syracuse marry did sir namely no time recover
hair lost by nature
antipholus syracuse but reason was not substantial why
there no time recover
dromio syracuse thus mend time himself bald
therefore world's end will have bald followers
antipholus syracuse knew 't'would bald conclusion but
soft who wafts us yonder
enter adriana luciana
some other mistress hath thy sweet aspects
am not adriana nor thy wife
time was once when thou unurg'd wouldst vow
never words were music thine ear
never object pleasing thine eye
never touch well welcome thy hand
never meat sweet savour'd thy taste
unless spake or look'd or touch'd or carv'd thee
how comes now husband o how comes
thyself call being strange
undividable incorporate
am better than thy dear self's better part
ah do not tear away thyself from
know love as easy mayst thou fall
drop water breaking gulf
take unmingled thence drop again
without addition or diminishing
as take from thyself not too
should'st thou but hear were licentious
this body consecrate thee
by ruffian lust should contaminate
wouldst thou not spit at spurn at
hurl name husband face
tear staind skin off harlot brow
from false hand cut wedding ring
break deep divorcing vow
know thou canst therefore see thou do
blood mingled crime lust
if two one thou play false
do digest poison thy flesh
being strumpeted by thy contagion
keep then fair league truce thy true bed
live dis staind thou undishonoured
antipholus syracuse plead fair dame know not
ephesus am but two hours old
as strange unto town as talk
wants wit all one word understand
luciana fie brother how world chang'd
when were wont use sister thus
she sent by dromio home dinner
antipholus syracuse by dromio
dromio syracuse by
adriana by thee this thou didst return from him
he did buffet thee his blows
denied house his his wife
what course drift compact
dromio syracuse sir never saw her till this time
antipholus syracuse villain thou liest even her very words
didst thou deliver mart
dromio syracuse never spake her all life
antipholus syracuse how can she thus then call us by our names
unless by inspiration
adriana how ill agrees gravity
counterfeit thus grossly slave
wrong are from exempt
but wrong not wrong more contempt
come will fasten this sleeve thine
thou art an elm husband vine
whose weakness married thy stronger state
makes thy strength communicate
if aught possess thee from dross
usurping ivy brier or idle moss
who all want pruning intrusion
antipholus syracuse she speaks she moves her theme
what was married her dream
or sleep now think hear all this
what error drives our eyes ears amiss
until know this sure uncertainty
i'll entertain offer'd fallacy
luciana dromio go bid servants spread dinner
dromio syracuse o beads cross sinner
this fairy land o spite spites
if obey them not this will ensue
they'll suck our breath or pinch us black blue
luciana why prat'st thou thyself answer'st not
dromio thou drone thou snail thou slug thou sot
dromio syracuse am transformed master am not
antipholus syracuse think thou art mind so am
dromio syracuse nay master both mind shape
antipholus syracuse thou hast thine own form
dromio syracuse no am an ape
dromio syracuse 'tis true she rides long grass
'tis so am an ass else could never
but should know her as well as she knows
adriana come come no longer will fool
put finger eye weep
whilst man master laughs woes scorn
come sir dinner dromio keep gate
husband i'll dine above day
shrive thousand idle pranks
say he dines forth let no creature enter
come sister dromio play porter well
antipholus syracuse am earth heaven or hell
sleeping or waking mad or well advis'd
known unto these myself disguis'd
i'll say as they say persever so
this mist at all adventures go

adriana ay let none enter lest break pate

act iii scene 1
before house antipholus ephesus
enter antipholus ephesus dromio ephesus angelo balthazar
antipholus ephesus good signior angelo must excuse us all
wife shrewish when keep not hours
say linger'd at shop
see making her carcanet
morrow will bring home
he met mart beat him
charg'd him thousand marks gold
did deny wife house
thou drunkard thou what didst thou mean by this
dromio ephesus say what will sir but know what know
beat at mart have hand show
if skin were parchment blows gave were ink
own handwriting would tell what think
antipholus ephesus think thou art an ass
by wrongs suffer blows bear
should kick being kick'd being at pass
would keep from heels beware an ass
antipholus ephesus y'are sad signior balthazar pray god our cheer
may answer good will good welcome here
balthazar hold dainties cheap sir welcome dear
antipholus ephesus o signior balthazar either at flesh or fish
table full welcome makes scarce one dainty dish
balthazar good meat sir common every churl affords
but words
balthazar small cheer great welcome makes merry feast
antipholus ephesus ay niggardly host more sparing guest
but though cates mean take them good part
better cheer may have but not better heart
but soft door lock'd go bid them let us
dromio ephesus maud bridget marian cicely gillian ginn
dromio syracuse within mome malt horse capon coxcomb idiot patch
either get thee from door or sit down at hatch
when one one too many go get thee from door
dromio ephesus what patch made our porter
master stays street
dromio syracuse within let him walk from whence he came
lest he catch cold ons feet
antipholus ephesus who talks within there ho open door
dromio syracuse within right sir i'll tell when
an you'll tell wherefore
antipholus ephesus wherefore dinner

come again when may

from house owe

sir name dromio

office name
one ne'er got credit other mickle blame
thou wouldst have chang'd thy face name or thy name an ass

so tell master

have at proverb shall set staff
