antipholus ephesus do hear minion you'll let us hope
luce within thought have ask'd
dromio syracuse within said no
dromio ephesus so come help well struck there was blow blow
antipholus ephesus thou baggage let
luce within can tell whose sake
dromio ephesus master knock door hard
luce within let him knock till ache
luce within what needs all pair stocks town
enter adriana within
adriana within who at door keeps all this noise
dromio syracuse within by troth town
troubled unruly boys
antipholus ephesus are there wife might
have come before
adriana within wife sir knave go get from door
dromio ephesus if went pain master this 'knave' would go sore
balthazar debating which was best shall part neither
dromio ephesus they stand at door master bid them welcome hither
antipholus ephesus there something wind cannot get
dromio ephesus would say so master if garments were thin
cake here warm within stand here cold
would make man mad as buck so bought sold
antipholus ephesus go fetch something i'll break ope gate
dromio syracuse within break any breaking here
i'll break knave's pate
sir words are but wind
ay break face so he break not behind
dromio syracuse within seems thou want'st breaking
out upon thee hind
dromio ephesus here's too much 'out upon thee' pray thee let
dromio syracuse within ay when fowls have no
feathers fish have no fin
antipholus ephesus well i'll break go borrow crow
dromio ephesus crow without feather master mean so
if crow help us sirrah we'll pluck crow together
antipholus ephesus go get thee gone fetch an iron crow
balthazar have patience sir o let not so
herein war against reputation
draw within compass suspect
th' unviolated honour wife
once this long experience her wisdom
her sober virtue years modesty
plead her part some cause unknown
why at this time doors are made against
ruld by depart patience
let us tiger all dinner
about evening come yourself alone
know reason this strange restraint
if by strong hand offer break
now stirring passage day
vulgar comment will made
supposed by common rout
may foul intrusion enter
dwell upon grave when are dead
slander lives upon succession
ever hous'd where gets possession
antipholus ephesus have prevaild will depart quiet
despite mirth mean merry
know wench excellent discourse
pretty witty wild yet too gentle
there will dine this woman mean
hath oftentimes upbraided withal
her will dinner angelo get home
fetch chain by this know 'tis made
bring pray porpentine
there's house chain will bestow
nothing but spite wife
upon mine hostess there good sir make haste
since mine own doors refuse entertain
i'll knock elsewhere see if they'll disdain
antipholus ephesus do so this jest shall cost some expense
empty
scene 2
before house antipholus ephesus
enter luciana antipholus syracuse
luciana may have quite forgot
husband's office shall antipholus
even spring love thy love springs rot
shall love building grow so ruinous
then her wealth's sake use her more kindness
or if elsewhere do by stealth
muffle false love some show blindness
let not sister read eye
not thy tongue thy own shame's orator
look sweet speak fair become disloyalty
apparel vice virtue's harbinger
bear fair presence though heart tainted
teach sin carriage holy saint
what simple thief brags his own attaint
'tis double wrong truant bed
let her read thy looks at board
shame hath bastard fame well managed
ill deeds doubled an evil word
alas poor women make us but believe
being compact credit love us
though others have arm show us sleeve
motion turn may move us
comfort sister cheer her call her wife
'tis holy sport little vain
when sweet breath flattery conquers strife
antipholus syracuse sweet mistress what name else know not
nor by what wonder do hit mine
less knowledge grace show not
than our earth's wonder more than earth divine
teach dear creature how think speak
lay open earthy gross conceit
folded meaning words' deceit
against souls pure truth why labour
make wander an unknown field
are god would create new
transform then pow'r i'll yield
but if am then well know
weeping sister no wife mine
nor her bed no homage do owe
far more far more do decline
drown thy sister's flood tears
sing siren thyself will dote
spread o'er silver waves thy golden hairs
as bed i'll take them there he
glorious supposition think
he gains by death hath such means die
let love being light drowned if she sink
luciana what are mad do reason so
antipholus syracuse not mad but mated how do not know
antipholus syracuse gazing beams fair sun being by
luciana gaze where should will clear sight
antipholus syracuse as good wink sweet love as look night
luciana why call love call sister so
antipholus syracuse thy sister's sister
luciana that's sister
antipholus syracuse no
thyself mine own self's better part
mine eye's clear eye dear heart's dearer heart
sole earth's heaven heavens claim
luciana all this sister or else should
antipholus syracuse call thyself sister sweet am thee
thee will love thee lead life
thou hast no husband yet nor no wife
give thy hand
luciana o soft sir hold still
i'll fetch sister get her good will
exit luciana
antipholus syracuse why how now dromio where runst thou
so fast
dromio syracuse do know sir am dromio
am man am myself
antipholus syracuse thou art dromio thou art
man thou art thyself
dromio syracuse am an ass am womans man besides
empty
antipholus syracuse what womans man how besides thyself
woman one claims one haunts one
will have
antipholus syracuse what claim lays she thee
dromio syracuse marry sir such claim as would
lay horse she would have as beast not
being beast she would have but she
being very beastly creature lays claim
antipholus syracuse what she
dromio syracuse very reverent body ay such one
have but lean luck match yet she
wondrous fat marriage
antipholus syracuse how dost thou mean fat marriage
dromio syracuse marry sir she's kitchen wench
all grease know not what use put her but
make lamp her run from her by her own light
warrant her rags tallow them will burn
poland winter if she lives till doomsday she'll burn
week longer than whole world
dromio syracuse swart shoe but her face
nothing so clean kept why she sweats man may
go over shoes grime
antipholus syracuse that's fault water will mend
dromio syracuse no sir 'tis grain noah's flood
could not do
antipholus syracuse what's her name
dromio syracuse nell sir but her name three
quarters that's an ell three quarters will not measure
antipholus syracuse then she bears some breadth
dromio syracuse no longer from head foot than
from hip hip she spherical globe could find
out countries her
antipholus syracuse what part her body stands ireland
dromio syracuse marry sir her buttocks found out by
bogs
antipholus syracuse where scotland
dromio syracuse found by barrenness hard
antipholus syracuse where france
dromio syracuse her forehead arm'd reverted
making war against her heir
antipholus syracuse where england
dromio syracuse look'd chalky cliffs but
could find no whiteness them but guess stood her
chin by salt rheum ran between france
antipholus syracuse where spain
dromio syracuse faith saw not but felt hot
antipholus syracuse where america indies
dromio syracuse o sir upon her nose an o'er embellished
rubies carbuncles sapphires declining their rich aspect
hot breath spain who sent whole armadoes caracks
ballast at her nose
antipholus syracuse where stood belgia netherlands
dromio syracuse o sir did not look so low
conclude this drudge or diviner laid claim calld
dromio swore was assur'd her told what privy
mole neck great wart left arm
amaz'd ran from her as witch
think if breast had not been made faith
heart steel
she had transform'd curtal dog made turn i' th' wheel
antipholus syracuse go hie thee presently post road
an if wind blow any way from shore
will not harbour this town night
if any bark put forth come mart
if every one knows us know none
'tis time think trudge pack gone
dromio syracuse as from bear man would run life
so fly from her would wife
empty
antipholus syracuse there's none but witches do inhabit here
therefore 'tis high time were hence
she doth call husband even soul
doth wife abhor but her fair sister
such enchanting presence discourse
hath almost made traitor myself
but lest myself guilty self wrong
i'll stop mine ears against mermaid's song
enter angelo chain
angelo master antipholus
antipholus syracuse ay that's name
angelo know well sir lo here chain
thought have ta'en at porpentine
antipholus syracuse what will shall do this
angelo what please yourself sir have made
antipholus syracuse made sir bespoke not
angelo not once nor twice but twenty times have
go home please wife withal
soon at supper time i'll visit
then receive money chain
antipholus syracuse pray sir receive money now
fear ne'er see chain nor money more
empty
antipholus syracuse what should think this cannot tell
but this think there's no man so vain
would refuse so fair an offer'd chain
see man here needs not live by shifts
when streets he meets such golden gifts
i'll mart there dromio stay
if any ship put out then straight away
empty
public place
enter second merchant angelo an officer
second merchant know since pentecost sum due
since have not much importund
nor now had not but am bound
persia want guilders voyage
therefore make present satisfaction

instant met
he had chain at five o'clock
shall receive money same
pleaseth walk down his house
will discharge bond thank too
enter antipholus ephesus dromio ephesus from courtezans

locking out doors by day

buy thou rope bring home

antipholus ephesus man well holp up trusts
promised presence chain
but neither chain nor goldsmith came
belike thought our love would last too long
angelo saving merry humour here's note
how much chain weighs utmost carat
fineness gold chargeful fashion
which doth amount three odd ducats more
than stand debted this gentleman
pray see him presently discharg'd
he bound sea stays but
antipholus ephesus am not furnish'd present money
besides have some business town
take chain bid wife
disburse sum receipt thereof
perchance will there as soon as
angelo then will bring chain her yourself
antipholus ephesus no bear lest come not time enough
angelo well sir will have chain about

or else may return without money
angelo nay come pray sir give chain
blame have held him here too long

breach promise porpentine
should have chid not bringing
but shrew first begin brawl
second merchant hour steals pray sir dispatch
angelo hear how he importunes chain

angelo come come know gave even now

good sir say whe'r you'll answer or no

antipholus ephesus answer what should answer
angelo money owe chain
antipholus ephesus owe none till receive chain
angelo know gave half an hour since
angelo wrong more sir denying
consider how stands upon credit
second merchant well officer arrest him at suit
officer do charge duke's name obey
angelo this touches reputation
either consent pay this sum
or attach by this officer
antipholus ephesus consent pay thee never had
arrest foolish fellow if thou dar'st
would not spare brother this case
if he should scorn so apparently
officer do arrest sir hear suit

but sirrah shall buy this sport as dear
as all metal shop will answer
angelo sir sir shall have law ephesus
notorious shame doubt not
enter dromio syracuse from bay
stays but till her owner comes aboard
then sir she bears away our fraughtage sir
have convey'd aboard have bought
oil balsamum aqua vitx
ship her trim merry wind
blows fair from land they stay nought at an
but their owner master yourself

what ship epidamnum stays

told thee what purpose what end

sent bay sir bark

teach ears list more heed

that's cover'd o'er turkish tapestry

officer prison till come

where dowsabel did claim her husband
she too big hope compass
thither must although against will
servants must their masters' minds fulfil
scene 2
house antipholus ephesus
enter adriana luciana
adriana ah luciana did he tempt thee so
might'st thou perceive austerely his eye
he did plead earnest yea or no
look'd he or red or pale or sad or merrily
what observation mad'st thou this case
his heart's meteors tilting his face
adriana he meant he did none more spite
luciana then swore he he was stranger here
adriana true he swore though yet forsworn he were
luciana then pleaded
adriana what said he
luciana love begg'd he begg'd
adriana what persuasion did he tempt thy love
luciana words an honest suit might move
first he did praise beauty then speech
luciana have patience beseech
adriana cannot nor will not hold still
tongue though not heart shall have his will
he deformed crooked old sere
ill fac'd worse bodied shapeless everywhere
vicious ungentle foolish blunt unkind
stigmatical making worse mind
luciana who would jealous then such one
no evil lost waild when gone
yet would herein others' eyes were worse
far from her nest lapwing cries away
heart prays him though tongue do curse
enter dromio syracuse
dromio syracuse here go desk purse sweet
now make haste
luciana how hast thou lost thy breath
dromio syracuse by running fast
adriana where thy master dromio he well
devil an everlasting garment hath him
one whose hard heart buttond up steel
fiend fairy pitiless rough
wolf nay worse fellow all buff
back friend shoulder clapper one countermands
passages alleys creeks narrow lands
hound runs counter yet draws dry foot well
one before judgment carries poor souls hell
adriana why man what matter

but he's suit buff which 'rested him can tell
will send him mistress redemption money his desk

thus he unknown should debt
tell was he arrested band
dromio syracuse band but stronger thing
chain chain do not hear ring

was two ere left him now clock strikes one
adriana hours come back did never hear
dromio syracuse o yes if any hour meet sergeant
'a turns back very fear

more than he's worth season
nay he's thief too have not heard men say
if 'a debt theft sergeant way
hath he not reason turn back an hour day
re enter luciana purse

scene 3
enter antipholus syracuse
antipholus syracuse there's not man meet but doth salute
as if were their well acquainted friend
every one doth call by name
some tender money some invite
some other give thanks kindnesses
some offer commodities buy
even now tailor calld his shop
show'd silks he had bought
sure these are but imaginary wiles
lapland sorcerers inhabit here
enter dromio syracuse
dromio syracuse master here's gold sent
what have got picture old adam new apparelld
antipholus syracuse what gold this what adam dost thou mean
dromio syracuse not adam kept paradise
but adam keeps prison he goes
calf's skin was killd prodigal he came behind
antipholus syracuse understand thee not
dromio syracuse no why 'tis plain case he
went bass viol case leather man sir
when gentlemen are tired gives them sob rest
them he sir takes pity decayed men give
them suits durance he sets up his rest do more
exploits his mace than morris pike
antipholus syracuse what thou meanst an officer
dromio syracuse ay sir sergeant band
thinks man always going bed says 'god give
good rest'
antipholus syracuse well sir there rest foolery
there any ship puts forth night may gone
dromio syracuse why sir brought word an
hour since bark expedition put forth night
then were hind'red by sergeant tarry
boy delay here are angels sent deliver

some blessed power deliver us from hence
enter courtezan

see sir have found goldsmith now
chain promis'd day
antipholus syracuse satan avoid charge thee tempt not
dromio syracuse master this mistress satan
antipholus syracuse devil
dromio syracuse nay she worse she devils
thereof comes wenches say 'god damn me' that's
as much say 'god make light wench' written
they appear men angels light light an effect
fire fire will burn ergo light wenches will burn
come not near her
courtezan man are marvellous merry sir
will go we'll mend our dinner here

or bespeak long spoon

must eat devil
antipholus syracuse avoid then fiend what tellst thou supping
thou art as are all sorceress
conjure thee leave gone
courtezan give ring mine had at dinner
or diamond chain promis'd
i'll gone sir not trouble
dromio syracuse some devils ask but parings one's nail
nut cherry stone
but she more covetous would have chain
master wise an if give her
devil will shake her chain fright us
courtezan pray sir ring or else chain
hope do not mean cheat so
antipholus syracuse avaunt thou witch come dromio let us go
dromio syracuse 'fly pride' says peacock mistress know
exeunt antipholus syracuse dromio syracuse
else would he never so demean himself
ring he hath mine worth forty ducats
same he promis'd chain
both one other he denies now
reason gather he mad
besides this present instance his rage
mad tale he told day at dinner
his own doors being shut against his entrance
belike his wife acquainted his fits
way now hie home his house
tell his wife being lunatic
he rush'd into house took perforce
ring away this course fittest choose
forty ducats too much lose
empty
scene 4
street
enter antipholus ephesus officer
i'll give thee ere leave thee so much money

should attach'd ephesus
tell 'twill sound harshly her cars

how now sir have sent

beating him
dromio ephesus nay 'tis patient am
empty
officer good now hold thy tongue
dromio ephesus nay rather persuade him hold his hands
antipholus ephesus thou whoreson senseless villain
dromio ephesus would were senseless sir
might not feel blows
antipholus ephesus thou art sensible nothing but
blows so an ass
by long 'ears have served him from hour
nativity this instant have nothing at his hands
service but blows when am cold he heats
beating when am warm he cools beating am
wak'd when sleep rais'd when sit driven
out doors when go from home welcom'd home
when return nay bear shoulders as
beggar wont her brat think when he hath lam'd
shall beg from door door
calld pinch
antipholus ephesus come go along wife coming yonder
dromio ephesus mistress 'respice finem' respect end or
rather prophesy parrot 'beware rope's end'

beating him
courtezan how say now not husband mad
adriana his incivility confirms no less
good doctor pinch are conjurer
will please what will demand
luciana alas how fiery how sharp he looks
courtezan mark how he trembles his ecstasy
pinch give hand let feel pulse
antipholus ephesus there hand let feel ear
striking him
pinch charge thee satan hous'd within this man
yield possession holy prayers
thy state darkness hie thee straight
antipholus ephesus peace doting wizard peace am not mad
adriana o thou wert not poor distressed soul
antipholus ephesus minion are these customers
did this companion saffron face
revel feast at house day
whilst upon guilty doors were shut
denied enter house
adriana o husband god doth know dind at home
where would had remaind until this time
antipholus ephesus dind at home thou villain what sayest thou
dromio ephesus sir sooth say did not dine at home
antipholus ephesus were not doors lock'd up shut out
dromio ephesus perdie doors were lock'd shut out
antipholus ephesus did not she herself revile there
dromio ephesus sans fable she herself revild there
antipholus ephesus did not her kitchen maid rail taunt scorn
dromio ephesus certes she did kitchen vestal scornd
antipholus ephesus did not rage depart from thence
since have felt vigour his rage
adriana is't good soothe him these contraries
pinch no shame fellow finds his vein
yielding him humours well his frenzy
antipholus ephesus thou hast subornd goldsmith arrest
adriana alas sent money redeem
by dromio here who came haste
dromio ephesus money by heart goodwill might
but surely master not rag money
adriana he came deliver'd
luciana am witness her she did

was sent nothing but rope
pinch mistress both man master possess'd
know by their pale deadly looks
they must bound laid some dark room

why dost thou deny bag gold

but confess sir were lock'd out

art confederate damned pack
make loathsome abject scorn

would behold this shameful sport

am thy prisoner wilt thou suffer them
make rescue

he prisoner shall not have him

they bind dromio
hast thou delight see wretched man

long were safe sound aboard

act v scene 1
street before priory
enter second merchant angelo
angelo am sorry sir have hind'red
but protest he had chain
though most dishonestly he doth deny
second merchant how man esteem'd here city
credit infinite highly belov'd
second none lives here city
his word might bear wealth at any time
second merchant speak softly yonder as think he walks
enter antipholus syracuse dromio syracuse
angelo 'tis so self chain about his neck
which he forswore most monstrously have
good sir draw near i'll speak him
signior andpholus wonder much
not without some scandal yourself
circumstance oaths so deny
this chain which now wear so openly
beside charge shame imprisonment
have done wrong this honest friend
who but staying our controversy
had hoisted sail put sea day
this chain had can deny
antipholus syracuse think had never did deny
antipholus syracuse who heard deny or forswear
second merchant these ears mine thou know'st did hear thee
fie thee wretch 'tis pity thou liv'st
walk where any honest men resort
antipholus syracuse thou art villain impeach thus
i'll prove mine honour mine honesty
against thee presently if thou dar'st stand
second merchant dare do defy thee villain
they draw
adriana hold hurt him not god's sake he mad
some get within him take his sword away
bind dromio too bear them house
dromio syracuse run master run god's sake take house
this some priory or are spoild
exeunt antipholus syracuse dromio syracuse priory
enter lady abbess
abbess quiet people wherefore throng hither
adriana fetch poor distracted husband hence
bear him home his recovery
angelo knew he was not his perfect wits
second merchant am sorry now did draw him
abbess how long hath this possession held man
adriana this week he hath been heavy sour sad
much different from man he was
but till this afternoon his passion
ne'er brake into extremity rage
abbess hath he not lost much wealth by wreck sea
stray'd his affection unlawful love
sin prevailing much youthful men
who give their eyes liberty gazing
which these sorrows he subject
adriana none these except last
namely some love drew him oft from home
abbess should have reprehended him
adriana why so did
abbess ay but not rough enough
abbess haply private
adriana assemblies too
abbess ay but not enough
adriana was copy our conference
bed he slept not urging
at board he fed not urging
alone was subject theme
company often glanced
still did tell him was vile bad
venom clamours jealous woman
poisons more deadly than mad dog's tooth
seems his sleeps were hind'red by thy railing
thereof comes his head light
thou say'st his meat was sauc'd thy upbraidings
unquiet meals make ill digestions
thereof raging fire fever bred
what's fever but fit madness
thou say'st his sports were hind'red by thy brawls
but moody dull melancholy
kinsman grim comfortless despair
at her heels huge infectious troop
pale distemperatures foes life
food sport life preserving rest
disturb'd would mad or man or beast
consequence then thy jealous fits
hath scar'd thy husband from use wits
luciana she never reprehended him but mildly
why bear these rebukes answer not
adriana she did betray own reproof
good people enter lay hold him
abbess no not creature enters house
adriana then let servants bring husband forth
abbess neither he took this place sanctuary
shall privilege him from hands
till have brought him his wits again
or lose labour assaying
diet his sickness office
will have no attorney but myself
therefore let have him home
abbess patient will not let him stir
till have us'd approved means have
wholesome syrups drugs holy prayers
make him formal man again
branch parcel mine oath
charitable duty order
adriana will not hence leave husband here
ill doth beseem holiness
separate husband wife

comes this way melancholy vale
place death sorry execution

second merchant see reverend syracusian merchant
who put unluckily into this bay
against laws statutes this town
angelo see where they come will behold his death
luciana kneel duke before he pass abbey
enter duke attended aegeon bareheaded
headsman other officers
duke yet once again proclaim publicly
if any friend will pay sum him
he shall not die so much tender him
adriana justice most sacred duke against abbess
duke she virtuous reverend lady
adriana may please grace antipholus husband
who made lord all had
at important letters this ill day
most outrageous fit madness took him
desp'rately he hurried through street
him his bondman all as mad as he
doing displeasure citizens
by rushing their houses bearing thence
rings jewels anything his rage did
whilst take order wrongs went
here there his fury had committed
anon wot not by what strong escape
he broke from those had guard him
his mad attendant himself
each one ireful passion drawn swords
met us again madly bent us
chas'd us away till raising more aid
came again bind them then they fled
here abbess shuts gates us
will not suffer us fetch him out
nor send him forth may bear him hence
therefore most gracious duke thy command
let him brought forth borne hence help
duke long since thy husband serv'd wars
thee engag'd prince's word
when thou didst make him master thy bed
do him all grace good could
bid lady abbess come
will determine this before stir
enter messenger
messenger o mistress mistress shift save yourself
master his man are both broke loose
beaten maids row bound doctor
whose beard they have sing'd off brands fire
ever as blaz'd they threw him
great pails puddled mire quench hair
his man scissors nicks him fool
sure unless send some present help
between them they will kill conjurer
adriana peace fool thy master his man are here
false thou dost report us
messenger mistress upon life tell true
have not breath'd almost since did see
he cries vows if he can take
scorch face disfigure
hark hark hear him mistress fly gone
duke come stand by fear nothing guard halberds
adriana ay husband witness
he borne about invisible
even now hous'd him abbey here
now he's there past thought human reason
enter antipholus ofephesus dromio ofephesus
antipholus ofephesus justice most gracious duke o grant justice
even service long since did thee
deep scars save thy life even blood
then lost thee now grant justice
aegeon unless fear death doth make dote
see son antipholus dromio
antipholus ofephesus justice sweet prince against woman there
she whom thou gav'st wife
hath abused dishonoured
even strength height injury
beyond imagination wrong
duke discover how thou shalt find just
antipholus ofephesus this day great duke she shut doors upon
while she harlots feasted house
duke grievous fault say woman didst thou so
adriana no good lord myself he sister
day did dine together so befall soul
as this false he burdens withal
luciana ne'er may look day nor sleep night
but she tells highness simple truth
this madman justly chargeth them
antipholus ephesus liege am advised what say
neither disturbed effect wine
nor heady rash provok'd raging ire
albeit wrongs might make one wiser mad
this woman lock'd out this day from dinner
goldsmith there were he not pack'd her
could witness he was then
who parted go fetch chain
where balthazar did dine together
our dinner done he not coming thither
went seek him street met him
his company gentleman
there did this perjur'd goldsmith swear down
this day him receiv'd chain
which god he knows saw not which
he did arrest an officer
did obey sent peasant home
then fairly bespoke officer
go person house
by th' way met wife her sister rabble more
vile confederates along them
they brought one pinch hungry lean fac'd villain
mere anatomy mountebank
threadbare juggler fortune teller
needy hollow ey'd sharp looking wretch
living dead man this pernicious slave
gazing mine eyes feeling pulse
no face as 'twere outfacing
cries out was possess'd then all together
they fell upon bound bore thence
dark dankish vault at home
there left man both bound together
till gnawing teeth bonds sunder
gaind freedom immediately
ran hither grace whom beseech
these deep shames great indignities
angelo lord truth thus far witness him
he dind not at home but was lock'd out
duke but had he such chain thee or no
angelo he had lord when he ran here
these people saw chain about his neck
second merchant besides will sworn these ears mine
heard confess had chain him
after first forswore mart
then fled into this abbey here
from whence think are come by miracle
antipholus ephesus never came within these abbey walls
nor ever didst thou draw thy sword
never saw chain so help heaven
this false burden withal
duke why what an intricate impeach this
think all have drunk circe's cup
if here hous'd him here he would have been
say he dind at home goldsmith here
denies saying sirrah what say

courtezan he did from finger snatch'd ring

duke saw'st thou him enter at abbey here
courtezan as sure liege as do see grace
duke why this strange go call abbess hither
think are all mated or stark mad
aegeon most mighty duke vouchsafe speak word
haply see friend will save life
pay sum may deliver

aegeon not name sir calld antipholus
not bondman dromio

now am dromio his man unbound

lately were bound as are now
are not pinch's patient are sir
aegeon why look strange know well
antipholus ephesus never saw life till now
aegeon o grief hath chang'd since saw last
careful hours time's deformed hand
have written strange defeatures face
but tell yet dost thou not know voice
aegeon dromio nor thou
dromio ephesus no trust sir nor
aegeon am sure thou dost
dromio ephesus ay sir but am sure do not
whatsoever man denies are now bound believe him
aegeon not know voice o time's extremity
hast thou so crack'd splitted poor tongue
seven short years here only son
knows not feeble key untund cares
sap consuming winter's drizzled snow
all conduits blood froze up
yet hath night life some memory
wasting lamps some fading glimmer left
dull deaf ears little use hear
all these old witnesses cannot err
tell thou art son antipholus

thou sham'st acknowledge misery

city can witness not so
ne'er saw syracuse life

have been patron antipholus

first citizen are accounted poor citizens patricians good
us but superfluity while were wholesome might guess

thirst revenge

empty

end though soft conscienc'd men can content say
was his country he did please his mother
partly proud which he even altitude his virtue
vice him must no way say he covetous

within what shouts are these other side o' th' city
risen why stay prating here th' capitol
all come come

bats clubs matter speak pray
first citizen our business not unknown th' senate they have
had inkling this fortnight what intend do which now we'll
show 'em deeds they say poor suitors have strong breaths
they shall know have strong arms too
menenius why masters good friends mine honest neighbours
will undo yourselves
menenius tell friends most charitable care
have patricians wants
suffering this dearth may as well
strike at heaven staves as lift them
against roman state whose course will
way takes cracking ten thousand curbs
more strong link asunder than can ever
appear impediment dearth
gods not patricians make
are transported by calamity
thither where more attends slander
helms o' th' state who care fathers
when curse them as enemies
first citizen care us true indeed they ne'er car'd us

grain make edicts usury support usurers repeal daily
any wholesome act established against rich provide more
piercing statutes daily chain up restrain poor if
empty
menenius either must
confess yourselves wondrous malicious
or accus'd folly shall tell
pretty tale may have heard
but since serves purpose will venture
stale't little more

fob off our disgrace tale but ant please deliver
rebelld against belly thus accus'd
only gulf did remain
i' th' midst o' th' body idle unactive
still cupboarding viand never bearing
labour rest where th' other instruments
did see hear devise instruct walk feel
mutually participate did minister
unto appetite affection common
whole body belly answer'd

which ne'er came from lungs but even thus
look may make belly smile
as well as speak tauntingly replied
th' discontented members mutinous parts
envied his receipt even so most fitly
as malign our senators
they are not such as

most grave belly was deliberate
not rash his accusers thus answered

which do live upon fit
because am storehouse shop
whole body but if do remember
send through rivers blood
even court heart th' seat o' th' brain
through cranks offices man
strongest nerves small inferior veins
from receive natural competency

mutinous members examine

but proceeds or comes from them
no way from yourselves what do think
great toe this assembly
first citizen great toe why great toe
menenius being one o' th' lowest basest poorest
this most wise rebellion thou goest foremost
thou rascal art worst blood run
but make ready stiff bats clubs

one side must have bale
enter caius marcius

marcius thanks what's matter dissentious rogues
rubbing poor itch opinion
make yourselves scabs
first citizen have ever good word
beneath abhorring what would have curs
nor peace nor war one affrights
other makes proud he trusts
where he should find lions finds hares
where foxes geese are no surer no
than coal fire upon ice
or hailstone sun virtue
make him worthy whose offence subdues him
curse justice did who deserves greatness
sick mans appetite who desires most
which would increase his evil he depends
upon favours swims fins lead
hews down oaks rushes hang ye trust ye
every minute do change mind
call him noble was now hate
him vile was garland what's matter
these several places city
cry against noble senate who
would feed one another what's their seeking
menenius corn at their own rates whereof they say
city well stor'd
marcius hang 'em they say
they'll sit by th' fire presume know
what's done i' th' capitol who's rise
who thrives who declines side factions give out
conjectural marriages making parties strong
feebling such as stand not their liking
would nobility lay aside their ruth
let use sword i'd make quarry
thousands these quarter'd slaves as high
as could pick lance
menenius nay these are almost thoroughly persuaded
though abundantly they lack discretion
yet are they passing cowardly but beseech
what says other troop
marcius they are dissolv'd hang 'em
hunger broke stone walls dogs must eat
meat was made mouths gods sent not
corn rich men only these shreds
they vented their complainings which being answer'd
petition granted them strange one
break heart generosity
make bold power look pale they threw their caps
as they would hang them horns o' th' moon
shouting their emulation
marcius five tribunes defend their vulgar wisdoms
their own choice one's junius brutus
sicinius velutus know not 'sdeath
rabble should have first unroof'd city
ere so prevaild will time
win upon power throw forth greater themes
insurrections arguing

scene ii
corioli senate house
first senator so opinion aufidius
they rome are ent'red our counsels
know how proceed

what ever have been thought this state
could brought bodily act ere rome
had circumvention 'tis not four days gone
since heard thence these are words think
have letter hereyes here
whether east or west dearth great
people mutinous rumour'd
cominius marcius old enemy
who rome worse hated than
titus lartius most valiant roman
these three lead this preparation
whither 'tis bent most likely 'tis
consider it'
first senator our army's field
answer us
aufidius nor did think folly
keep great pretences veild till when
they needs must show themselves which hatching
seem'd appear'd rome by discovery
shall short'ned our aim which was
take many towns ere almost rome
should know were afoot
second senator noble aufidius

if they set down before's remove
bring up army but think you'll find
th' have not prepar'd us

all gods assist

scene iii
rome marcius' house
enter volumnia virgilia mother wife marcius
volumnia pray daughter sing or express yourself more
comfortable sort if son were husband should freelier
rejoice absence wherein he won honour than
embracements his bed where he would show most love when yet
he was but tender bodied only son womb when youth
comeliness pluck'd all gaze his way when day
kings' entreaties mother should not sell him an hour from her
beholding considering how honour would become such person
was no better than picture hang by th' wall if
he was find fame cruel war sent him from whence he
returnd his brows bound oak tell thee daughter
sprang not more joy at first hearing he was man child than
now first seeing he had proved himself man
virgilia but had he died business madam how then
volumnia then his good report should have been son therein
would have found issue hear profess sincerely had dozen
sons each love alike none less dear than thine
good marcius had rather had eleven die nobly their country
enter gentlewoman
gentlewoman madam lady valeria come visit
virgilia beseech give leave retire myself
volumnia indeed shall not
methinks hear hither husband's drum
see him pluck aufidius down by th' hair
as children from bear volsces shunning him
methinks see him stamp thus call thus
'come cowards were got fear
his maild hand then wiping forth he goes
harvest man that's task'd mow
or all or lose his hire
virgilia his bloody brow o jupiter no blood
volumnia away fool more becomes man
than gilt his trophy breasts hecuba
when she did suckle hector look'd not lovelier
than hector's forehead when spit forth blood
at grecian sword contemning tell valeria

tread upon his neck

before corioli

now mars prithee make us quick work
smoking swords may march from hence
help our fielded friends come blow thy blast
they sound parley enter two senators others
walls corioli
tullus aufidius he within walls
first senator no nor man fears less than he
that's lesser than little drum afar off hark our drums
rather than they shall pound us up our gates
which yet seem shut have but pinnd rushes
they'll open themselves alarum far off hark far off
there aufidius list what work he makes
amongst cloven army
marcius o they are at
lartius their noise our instruction ladders ho
enter army volsces
marcius they fear us not but issue forth their city
hearts more proof than shields advance brave titus
they do disdain us much beyond our thoughts
which makes sweat wrath come fellows
he retires i'll take him volsce
he shall feel mine edge
alarum romans are beat back their trenches
re enter marcius cursing
marcius all contagion south light
shames rome herd boils plagues
farther than seen one infect another
against wind mile souls geese
bear shapes men how have run
from slaves apes would beat pluto hell
all hurt behind backs red faces pale
flight agued fear mend charge home
or by fires heaven i'll leave foe
make wars look to't come
if you'll stand fast we'll beat them their wives
another alarum volsces fly marcius follows
them gates
so now gates are ope now prove good seconds
'tis followers fortune widens them
not fliers mark do
marcius enters gates
first soldier fool hardiness not
second soldier not marcius shut
first soldier see they have shut him
re enter titus lartius
lartius what become marcius
all slain sir doubtless
first soldier following fliers at very heels
them he enters who upon sudden
clapp'd their gates he himself alone
answer all city
lartius o noble fellow
who sensibly outdares his senseless sword
carbuncle entire as big as thou art
were not so rich jewel thou wast soldier
even cato's wish not fierce terrible
only strokes but thy grim looks
thunder percussion thy sounds
thou mad'st thine enemies shake as if world
were feverous did tremble
re enter marcius bleeding assaulted by enemy
first soldier look sir
let's fetch him off or make remain alike
they fight all enter city
scene v
within corioli street
enter certain romans spoils
first roman this will carry rome
second roman this
third roman murrain 't took this silver
alarum continues still afar off
marcius see here these movers do prize their hours
at crack'd drachma cushions leaden spoons
irons doit doublets hangmen would
bury those wore them these base slaves
ere yet fight done pack up down them
exeunt pillagers
hark what noise general makes him
there man souls hate aufidius
piercing our romans then valiant titus take
whilst those have spirit will haste
help cominius
lartius worthy sir thou bleed'st
thy exercise hath been too violent
second course fight
marcius sir praise not
work hath yet not warm'd fare well
blood drop rather physical
than dangerous aufidius thus
lartius now fair goddess fortune
fall deep love thee her great charms
misguide thy opposers' swords bold gentleman
prosperity thy page
marcius thy friend no less
than those she placeth highest so farewell
lartius thou worthiest marcius exit marcius
go sound thy trumpet market place
call thither all officers o' th' town
scene vi
near camp cominius
enter cominius as were retire soldiers
cominius breathe friends well fought are come off
romans neither foolish our stands
nor cowardly retire believe sirs
shall charg'd again whiles have struck
by interims conveying gusts have heard
charges our friends roman gods
both our powers smiling fronts encount'ring
may give thankful sacrifice
enter messenger
thy news
messenger citizens corioli have issued
given lartius marcius battle
saw our party their trenches driven
then came away
cominius though thou speak'st truth
messenger above an hour lord
cominius 'tis not mile briefly heard their drums
how couldst thou mile confound an hour
bring thy news so late
messenger spies volsces
held chase was forc'd wheel
three or four miles about else had sir
half an hour since brought report
enter marcius
does appear as he were flay'd o gods
he has stamp marcius have
before time seen him thus
marcius come too late
cominius shepherd knows not thunder from tabor
more than know sound marcius' tongue
from every meaner man
marcius come too late
cominius ay if come not blood others
marcius o let clip ye
arms as sound as when woo'd heart
as merry as when our nuptial day was done
tapers burnd bedward
cominius flower warriors
how is't titus lartius
marcius as man busied about decrees
condemning some death some exile
ransoming him or pitying threat'ning th' other
even fawning greyhound leash
let him slip at will
cominius where slave
which told they had beat trenches
where he call him hither
marcius let him alone
he did inform truth but our gentlemen
common file plague tribunes them
mouse ne'er shunnd cat as they did budge
cominius but how prevaild
marcius will time serve tell do not think
where enemy are lords o' th' field
if not why cease till are so
cominius marcius
have at disadvantage fought did
retire win our purpose
marcius how lies their battle know which side
they have plac'd their men trust
their bands i' th' vaward are antiates
their best trust o'er them aufidius
their very heart hope
marcius do beseech
by all battles wherein have fought
by th' blood have shed together by th' vows
have made endure friends directly
set against aufidius his antiates
not delay present but
prove this very hour
cominius though could wish
were conducted gentle bath
balms applied yet dare never
deny asking take choice those
best can aid action
marcius those are they
most are willing if any such here
as were sin doubt love this painting
lesser his person than an ill report
if any think brave death outweighs bad life
his country's dearer than himself
let him alone or so many so minded
wave thus express his disposition
follow marcius they all shout wave their
swords take him up their arms cast up their caps
o alone make sword
if these shows not outward which
able bear against great aufidius
shield as hard as his certain number
though thanks all must select from all rest
shall bear business some other fight
as cause will obey'd please march
four shall quickly draw out command
which men are best inclind
cominius march fellows
make good this ostentation shall
scene vii
gates corioli
titus lartius having set guard upon corioli going drum trumpet
toward cominius caius marcius enters lieutenant other soldiers
scout
lartius so let ports guarded keep duties
as have set them down if do send dispatch
those centuries our aid rest will serve
short holding if lose field
lieutenant fear not our care sir
lartius hence shut gates upons
our guider come th' roman camp conduct us exeunt
scene viii
field battle between roman volscian camps
alarum as battle enter marcius aufidius at several doors
marcius i'll fight none but thee do hate thee
worse than promise breaker
aufidius hate alike
more than thy fame envy fix thy foot
marcius let first budger die other's slave
gods doom him after
aufidius if fly marcius
halloa hare
marcius within these three hours tullus
alone fought corioli walls
made what work pleas'd 'tis not blood
wherein thou seest mask'd thy revenge
aufidius wert thou hector
was whip bragg'd progeny
thou shouldst not scape here
here they fight certain volsces come aid
aufidius marcius fights till they driven
empty
officious not valiant have sham'd
condemned seconds exeunt
scene ix
flourish alarum retreat sounded enter at one door
cominius romans at another door marcius his arm scarf
cominius if should tell thee o'er this thy day's work
thou't not believe thy deeds but i'll report
where senators shall mingle tears smiles
where great patricians shall attend shrug
i' th' end admire where ladies shall frighted
gladly quak'd hear more where dull tribunes
fusty plebeians hate thine honours
our rome hath such soldier'
yet cam'st thou morsel this feast
having fully dind before
enter titus lartius his power from pursuit
lartius o general
here steed caparison
hadst thou beheld
marcius pray now no more mother
who has charter extol her blood
as have done that's what can induc'd
as have been that's country
he has but effected his good will
hath overta'en mine act
cominius shall not
grave deserving rome must know
value her own 'twere concealment
worse than theft no less than traducement
hide doings silence
would seem but modest therefore beseech
sign what are not reward
what have done before our army hear
marcius have some wounds upon they smart
hear themselves rememb'red
cominius should they not
well might they fester 'gainst ingratitude
tent themselves death all horses
whereof have ta'en good good store all
render tenth ta'en forth
before common distribution at
only choice
marcius thank general
but cannot make heart consent take
bribe pay sword do refuse
stand upon common part those
have beheld doing
long flourish they all cry 'marcius marcius'
may these same instruments which profane
never sound more when drums trumpets shall
i' th' field prove flatterers let courts cities
made all false fac'd soothing when steel grows
soft as parasite's silk let him made
an overture th' wars no more say
have not wash'd nose bled
or foild some debile wretch which without note
here's many else have done shout forth
as if lov'd little should dieted
praises sauc'd lies
cominius too modest are
more cruel good report than grateful
us give truly by patience
if 'gainst yourself incens'd we'll put
one means his proper harm manacles
then reason safely therefore known
as us all world caius marcius
noble steed known camp give him
all his trim belonging from this time
what he did before corioli can him
all th' applause clamour host
caius marcius coriolanus
bear th' addition nobly ever
flourish trumpets sound drums
all caius marcius coriolanus
coriolanus will go wash
whether blush or no howbeit thank
mean stride steed at all times
undercrest good addition
th' fairness power
cominius so our tent
where ere do repose us will write
rome our success titus lartius
must corioli back send us rome
best whom may articulate
lartius shall lord
coriolanus gods begin mock now
refus'd most princely gifts am bound beg
lord general
cominius take't 'tis yours what is't
coriolanus sometime lay here corioli
at poor mans house he us'd kindly
he cried saw him prisoner
but then aufidius was within view
give poor host freedom
cominius o well begg'd
were he butcher son he should
free as wind deliver him titus
lartius marcius his name
coriolanus by jupiter forgot
am weary yea memory tir'd
have no wine here
cominius go our tent
should look'd come exeunt
scene x
camp volsces
flourish cornets enter tullus aufidius bloody two or three soldiers
aufidius town ta'en
first soldier 'twill deliver'd back good condition
aufidius condition
would were roman cannot
being volsce am condition
i' th' part at mercy five times marcius
have fought thee so often hast thou beat
wouldst do so think should encounter
as often as eat by th' elements
if e'er again meet him beard beard
he's mine or am his mine emulation
hath not honour int had where
thought crush him an equal force
true sword sword i'll potch at him some way
first soldier he's devil
aufidius bolder though not so subtle valour's poisond
only suff'ring stain by him him
shall fly out itself nor sleep nor sanctuary
being naked sick nor fane nor capitol
prayers priests nor times sacrifice
embarquements all fury shall lift up
their rotten privilege custom 'gainst
hate marcius where find him were
against hospitable canon would
wash fierce hand ins heart go th' city
learn how 'tis held what they are must
hostages rome
first soldier will not go
aufidius am attended at cypress grove pray
'tis south city mills bring word thither
how world goes pace
may spur journey

proud violent testy magistrates alias fools as any rome

not glad see thee are three

call nettle but nettle
faults fools but folly

coriolanus menenius ever ever

coriolanus his wife mother hand yours
ere our own house do shade head
good patricians must visited
but them change honours
volumnia have lived
see inherited very wishes
buildings fancy only
there's one thing wanting which doubt not but
our rome will cast upon thee
coriolanus know good mother
had rather their servant way
than sway them theirs
flourish cornets exeunt state as before
brutus sicinius come forward
brutus all tongues speak him bleared sights
are spectacled see him prattling nurse
into rapture lets her baby cry
while she chats him kitchen malkin pins
her richest lockram 'bout her reechy neck
clamb'ring walls eye him stalls bulks windows
are smother'd up leads filld ridges hors'd
earnestness see him seld shown flamens
do press among popular throngs puff
win vulgar station our veild dames
commit war white damask
their nicely gawded cheeks th' wanton spoil
phoebus' burning kisses such pother
as if whatsoever god who leads him
were slily crept into his human powers
gave him graceful posture
warrant him consul
brutus then our office may
during his power go sleep
sicinius he cannot temp'rately transport his honours
from where he should begin end but will
lose those he hath won
brutus there's comfort
sicinius doubt not
commoners whom stand but they
least cause these his new honours which
he will give them make as little question
as he proud do't
brutus heard him swear
were he stand consul never would he
appear i' th' market place nor him put
napless vesture humility
nor showing as manner his wounds
th' people beg their stinking breaths
brutus was his word o he would miss rather
than carry but by suit gentry him
desire nobles
sicinius wish no better
than have him hold purpose put
execution
brutus 'tis most he will
sicinius shall him then as our good wills
sure destruction
him or our authorities an end
must suggest people what hatred
he still hath held them to's power he would
have made them mules silenc'd their pleaders
dispropertied their freedoms holding them
human action capacity
no more soul nor fitness world
than camels their war who have their provand
only bearing burdens sore blows
sicinius this as say suggested
at some time when his soaring insolence
shall touch people which time shall not want
if he put upont that's as easy
as set dogs sheep will his fire
kindle their dry stubble their blaze
shall darken him ever
enter messenger
brutus what's matter
marcius shall consul
have seen dumb men throng see him
blind hear him speak matrons flung gloves
ladies maids their scarfs handkerchers
upon him as he pass'd nobles bended
as jove's statue commons made
shower thunder their caps shouts
never saw
brutus let's capitol
but hearts event
sicinius have exeunt
scene ii
rome capitol
enter two officers lay cushions as were capitol
first officer come come they are almost here how many stand
empty
second officer three they say but 'tis thought every one
coriolanus will carry
loves not common people
second officer faith there have been many great men have
flatter'd people who ne'er loved them there many
they have loved they know not wherefore so if they
love they know not why they hate upon no better ground
therefore coriolanus neither care whether they love or
hate him manifests true knowledge he has their
disposition out his noble carelessness lets them plainly
empty
he waved indifferently 'twixt doing them neither good nor harm
but he seeks their hate greater devotion than they can
render him leaves nothing undone may fully discover
him their opposite now seem affect malice
displeasure people as bad as which he dislikes
flatter them their love
second officer he hath deserved worthily his country his
ascent not by such easy degrees as those who having been
supple courteous people bonneted without any further
he hath so planted his honours their eyes his actions
their hearts their tongues silent not confess
so much were kind ingrateful injury report otherwise
were malice giving itself lie would pluck reproof
rebuke from every car heard
first officer no more him he's worthy man make way they
are coming
sennet enter patricians tribunes
people lictors before them coriolanus
brutus take their places by themselves
coriolanus stands
menenius having determind volsces
send titus lartius remains
as main point this our after meeting
gratify his noble service
hath thus stood his country therefore please
most reverend grave elders desire
present consul last general
little worthy work perform'd
by caius marcius coriolanus whom
met here both thank remember
honours himself coriolanus sits
first senator speak good cominius
leave nothing out length make us think
rather our state's defective requital
than stretch out masters o' th' people
do request kindest ears after
yield what passes here
sicinius are convented
upon pleasing treaty have hearts
inclinable honour advance
theme our assembly
brutus which rather
shall bless'd do if he remember
kinder value people than
he hath hereto priz'd them at
would rather had been silent please
hear cominius speak
brutus most willingly
but yet caution was more pertinent
than rebuke give
menenius he loves people
but tie him not their bedfellow
worthy cominius speak
coriolanus rises offers go away
first senator sit coriolanus never shame hear
what have nobly done
coriolanus honours' pardon
had rather have wounds heal again
than hear say how got them
brutus sir hope
words disbench'd not
coriolanus no sir yet oft
when blows have made stay fled from words
love them as they weigh
menenius pray now sit down
coriolanus had rather have one scratch head i' th' sun
when alarum were struck than idly sit
hear nothings monster'd exit
menenius masters people
multiplying spawn how can he flatter
that's thousand one good one when now see
he had rather venture all his limbs honour
cominius shall lack voice deeds coriolanus
should not utter'd feebly held
valour chiefest virtue
most dignifies haver if
man speak cannot world
singly counterpois'd at sixteen years
when tarquin made head rome he fought
beyond mark others our then dictator
whom all praise point at saw him fight
bristled lips before him he bestrid
an o'erpress'd roman i' th' consuls view
slew three opposers tarquins self he met
struck him his knee day's feats
when he might act woman scene
he prov'd best man i' th' field his meed
was brow bound oak his pupil age
man ent'red thus he waxed sea
brunt seventeen battles since
before corioli let say
cannot speak him home he stopp'd fliers
by his rare example made coward
turn terror into sport as weeds before
vessel under sail so men obey'd
fell below his stem his sword death's stamp
where did mark took from face foot
he was thing blood whose every motion
was tim'd dying cries alone he ent'red
shunless destiny aidless came off
sudden re enforcement struck
corioli planet now alls his
when by by din war 'gan pierce
his ready sense then straight his doubled spirit
re quick'ned what flesh was fatigate
battle came he where he did
run reeking o'er lives men as if
'twere perpetual spoil till calld
ease his breast panting
menenius worthy man
first senator he cannot but measure fit honours
which devise him
cominius our spoils he kick'd at
look'd upon things precious as they were
common muck world he covets less
than misery itself would give rewards
his deeds doing them content
menenius he's right noble
let him calld
first senator call coriolanus
officer he doth appear
re enter coriolanus
menenius senate coriolanus are well pleas'd
make thee consul
coriolanus do owe them still
life services
do speak people

wounds' sake give their suffrage please
may pass this doing

honour form

shall blush acting might well
taken from people

our purpose them our noble consul

scene iii
rome forum
enter seven or eight citizens
first citizen once if he do require our voices ought not
second citizen may sir if will
third citizen have power ourselves do but
power have no power do if he show us his wounds
tell us his deeds are put our tongues into those
wounds speak them so if he tell us his noble deeds
must also tell him our noble acceptance them ingratitude
monstrous multitude ingrateful were make
monster multitude which being members should
bring ourselves monstrous members
will serve once stood up about corn he himself stuck
not call us many headed multitude
third citizen have been calld so many not our heads
are some brown some black some abram some bald but our
wits are so diversely colour'd truly think if all our wits
were issue out one skull they would fly east west north
south their consent one direct way should at once
all points o' th' compass
second citizen think so which way do judge wit would
third citizen nay wit will not so soon out as another mans
will 'tis strongly wedg'd up block head but if were at
liberty 'twould sure southward
second citizen why way
third citizen lose itself fog where being three parts
melted away rotten dews fourth would return
conscience' sake help get thee wife
second citizen are never without tricks may
empty
no matter greater part carries say if he would
incline people there was never worthier man
enter coriolanus gown humility
menenius
here he comes gown humility mark his behaviour
are not stay all together but come by him where he
stands by ones by twos by threes he's make his
requests by particulars wherein every one us has single
honour giving him our own voices our own tongues
all content content exeunt citizens
menenius o sir are not right have not known
worthiest men have done't
coriolanus what must say
'i pray sir' plague upont cannot bring
tongue such pace 'look sir wounds
got them country's service when
some certain brethren roar'd ran
from th' noise our own drums'
must not speak must desire them
think upon
coriolanus think upon hang 'em
would they would forget virtues
which our divines lose by 'em
menenius you'll mar all
i'll leave pray speak 'em pray
wholesome manner exit
re enter three citizens
keep their teeth clean so here comes brace
know cause sir standing here
third citizen do sir tell us what hath brought to't
coriolanus mine own desert
second citizen own desert
coriolanus ay not mine own desire
third citizen how not own desire
coriolanus no sir 'twas never desire yet trouble poor
begging
gain by
coriolanus well then pray price o' th' consulship
first citizen price ask kindly
coriolanus kindly sir pray let ha't have wounds show
which shall yours private good voice sir what
say
second citizen shall ha' worthy sir
coriolanus match sir there's all two worthy voices begg'd
have alms adieu
second citizen an 'twere give again but 'tis no matter
exeunt three citizens
re enter two other citizens
coriolanus pray now if may stand tune
voices may consul have here customary gown
fourth citizen have deserved nobly country
have not deserved nobly
coriolanus enigma
fourth citizen have been scourge her enemies have
empty
coriolanus should account more virtuous have
not been common love will sir flatter sworn
brother people earn dearer estimation them 'tis
condition they account gentle since wisdom their
choice rather have hat than heart will practise
insinuating nod off them most counterfeitly
sir will counterfeit bewitchment some popular man
give bountiful desirers therefore beseech
fifth citizen hope find our friend therefore give
our voices heartily
fourth citizen have received many wounds country
coriolanus will not seal knowledge showing them
will make much voices so trouble no farther
both citizens gods give joy sir heartily
exeunt citizens
coriolanus most sweet voices
better die better starve
why this wolvish toge should stand here
beg hob dick do appear
their needless vouches custom calls to't
what custom wills all things should do't
dust antique time would lie unswept
mountainous error too highly heap'd
truth o'erpeer rather than fool so
let high office honour go
one would do thus am half through
re enter three citizens more
here come moe voices
voices voices have fought
watch'd voices voices bear
wounds two dozen odd battles thrice six
have seen heard voices have
done many things some less some more voices
indeed would consul
sixth citizen he has done nobly cannot go without any honest
seventh citizen therefore let him consul gods give him
joy make him good friend people
all amen amen god save thee noble consul
exeunt citizens

he flouted us downright

sicinius why so he did am sure
all no no no man saw 'em
third citizen he said he had wounds which he could show
empty
his hat thus waving scorn
'i would consul' says he 'aged custom
but by voices will not so permit
voices therefore' when granted
here was 'i thank voices thank
have no further you' was not this mockery
sicinius why either were ignorant see't
or seeing such childish friendliness
yield voices
brutus could not have told him
as were lessond when he had no power
but was petty servant state
he was enemy ever spake against
liberties charters bear
place potency sway o' th' state
if he should still malignantly remain
fast foe th' plebeii voices might
curses yourselves should have said
as his worthy deeds did claim no less
than what he stood so his gracious nature
would think upon voices
translate his malice towards into love
standing friendly lord
as were fore advis'd had touch'd his spirit
tried his inclination from him pluck'd
either his gracious promise which might
as cause had calld up have held him
or else would have galld his surly nature
which easily endures not article
tying him aught so putting him rage
should have ta'en th' advantage his choler
pass'd him unelected
he did solicit free contempt
when he did need loves do think
his contempt shall not bruising
when he hath power crush why had bodies
no heart among or had tongues cry
against rectorship judgment
sicinius have
ere now denied asker now again
him did not ask but mock bestow
third citizen he's not confirm'd may deny him yet
second citizens will deny him
i'll have five hundred voices sound
first citizen twice five hundred their friends piece
empty

they have chose consul will from them take
their liberties make them no more voice
than dogs are as often beat barking
sicinius let them assemble
safer judgment all revoke
ignorant election enforce his pride
his old hate unto besides forget not
what contempt he wore humble weed
how his suit he scornd but loves
thinking upon his services took from
th' apprehension his present portance
which most gibingly ungravely he did fashion
brutus lay
fault us tribunes labour'd
no impediment between but must
cast election him
sicinius say chose him
more after our commandment than as guided
by own true affections minds
pre occupied what rather must do
than what should made against grain
brutus ay spare us not say read lectures
how youngly he began serve his country
how long continued what stock he springs
noble house o' th' marcians from whence came
ancus marcius numa's daughter's son
who after great hostilius here was king
same house publius quintus were
our best water brought by conduits hither
censorinus nobly named so
was his great ancestor
sicinius one thus descended
hath beside well his person wrought
set high place did commend
remembrances but have found
scaling his present bearing his past
he's fixed enemy revoke
sudden approbation
brutus say ne'er had done't
presently when have drawn number
repair th' capitol
citizens will will so almost all
repent their election exeunt plebeians

this mutiny were better put hazard
than stay past doubt greater
if as his nature he fall rage
their refusal both observe answer

this shall seem as partly 'tis their own
which have goaded onward exeunt

which they have given beggars

man their infirmity

his absolute 'shall

coriolanus 'shall
o good but most unwise patricians why
grave but reckless senators have thus
given hydra here choose an officer
horn noise o' th' monster's wants not spirit
say he'll turn current ditch
make channel his if he have power
then vail ignorance if none awake
dangerous lenity if are learnd
not as common fools if are not
let them have cushions by are plebeians
if they senators they are no less
when both voices blended great'st taste
such one as he who puts his 'shall'
his popular 'shall' against graver bench
than ever frownd greece by jove himself
makes consuls base soul aches
know when two authorities are up
neither supreme how soon confusion
may enter 'twixt gap both take
one by th' other

corn o' th' storehouse gratis as 'twas us'd
sometime greece

ruin state

was not our recompense resting well assur'd
they ne'er did service for't being press'd th' war
even when navel state was touch'd

did not deserve corn gratis being i' th' war
their mutinies revolts wherein they show'd
most valour spoke not them th' accusation
which they have often made against senate
all cause unborn could never native
how shall this bosom multiplied digest
senate's courtesy let deeds express
what's their words 'we did request
are greater poll true fear
they gave us our demands' thus debase
nature our seats make rabble
call our cares fears which will time
break ope locks o' th' senate bring
crows peck eagles

cannot conclude but by yea no

better vantage

must then do't them

though therein can never too noble
honour policy unsever'd friends
i' th' war do grow together grant tell
peace what each them by th' other lose
they combine not there
coriolanus tush tush
menenius good demand
volumnia if honour wars seem
same are not which best ends
adopt policy how less or worse
honour as war since both
stands request
coriolanus why force this
volumnia because now lies speak
th' people not by own instruction
nor by th' matter which heart prompts
but such words are but roted
tongue though but bastards syllables
no allowance bosom's truth
than take town gentle words
which else would put fortune
hazard much blood
would dissemble nature where
fortunes friends at stake requir'd
should do so honour am this
wife son these senators nobles
will rather show our general louts
how can frown than spend fawn upon 'em
what want might ruin

come go us speak fair may salve so
not what dangerous present but los
what past
volumnia prithee now son
go them this bonnet thy hand
thus far having stretch'd here them
thy knee bussing stones such busines
more learned than ears waving thy head
which often thus correcting thy stout heart
now humble as ripest mulberry
will not hold handling or say them
thou art their soldier being bred broils
hast not soft way which thou dost confess
were fit thee use as they claim
asking their good loves but thou wilt frame
thyself forsooth hereafter theirs so far
menenius this but done
even as she speaks why their hearts were yours
they have pardons being ask'd as free
as words little purpose
volumnia prithee now
go ruld although know thou hadst rather
follow thine enemy fiery gulf
than flatter him bower
enter cominius
cominius have been i' th' market place sir 'tis fit

can thereto frame his spirit

prithee now say will go about

yet were there but this single plot lose
this mould marcius they dust should grind

have put now such part which never
shall discharge th' life
cominius come come we'll prompt

praises made thee first soldier so
thou hast not done before
coriolanus well must do't
away disposition possess
some harlot's spirit throat war turnd
which quier'd drum into pipe
small as an eunuch or virgin voice
babies lulls asleep smiles knaves
tent cheeks schoolboys' tears take up
glasses sight beggar's tongue
who bow'd but stirrup bend his
hath receiv'd an alms will not do't
lest surcease honour mine own truth
by body's action teach mind
most inherent baseness
volumnia at thy choice then
beg thee more dishonour
than thou them come all ruin let
thy mother rather feel thy pride than fear
as big heart as thou do as thou list
thy valiantness was mine thou suck'dst from
but owe thy pride thyself

shall so
plebeians shall so shall so
coriolanus common cry curs whose breath hate

as dead carcasses unburied men
do corrupt air banish

fan into despair have power still
banish defenders till at length
ignorance which finds not till feels
making but reservation yourselves
still own foes deliver

act iv scene
rome before gate city
enter coriolanus volumnia virgilia menenius cominius
young nobility rome
coriolanus come leave tears brief farewell beast
many heads butts away nay mother
where ancient courage were us'd
say extremities was trier spirits
common chances common men could bear
show'd mastership floating fortune's blows
when most struck home being gentle wounded craves
noble cunning were us'd load
precepts would make invincible
heart connd them
virgilia o heavens o heavens
coriolanus nay prithee woman
volumnia now red pestilence strike all trades rome
occupations perish
shall lov'd when am lack'd nay mother
resume spirit when were wont say
if had been wife hercules
six his labours you'd have done sav'd
husband so much sweat cominius
droop not adieu farewell wife mother
i'll do well yet thou old true menenius
thy tears are salter than younger mans
venomous thine eyes sometime general
heart hard'ning spectacles tell these sad women
'tis fond wail inevitable strokes
as 'tis laugh at 'em mother wot well
hazards still have been solace
believe't not lightly though go alone
lonely dragon his fen
makes fear'd talk'd more than seen son
will or exceed common or caught
cautelous baits practice
whither wilt thou go take good cominius
thee awhile determine some course
more than wild exposture each chance
starts i' th' way before thee
virgilia o gods
cominius i'll follow thee month devise
where thou shalt rest thou mayst hear us
thee so if time thrust forth
cause thy repeal shall not send
lose advantage which doth ever cool
i' th' absence needer
coriolanus fare ye well
thou hast years upon thee thou art too full
wars' surfeits go rove one
that's yet unbruis'd bring but out at gate
come sweet wife dearest mother
friends noble touch when am forth
bid farewell smile pray come
hear from still never aught
but what formerly

violent breaking out

scene iv
antium before aufidius' house

save sir

o world thy slippery turns friends now fast sworn
whose double bosoms seems wear one heart
whose hours whose bed whose meal exercise
are still together who twin as 'twere love
unseparable shall within this hour
dissension doit break out
bitterest enmity so fellest foes
whose passions whose plots have broke their sleep
some trick not worth an egg shall grow dear friends
interjoin their issues so
birthplace hate love's upon
this enemy town i'll enter if he slay
he does fair justice if he give way
i'll do his country service

thou show'st noble vessel what's thy name
coriolanus prepare thy brow frown know'st thou yet
coriolanus name caius marcius who hath done
thee particularly all volsces
great hurt mischief thereto witness may
surname coriolanus painful service
extreme dangers drops blood
shed thankless country are requited
but surname good memory
witness malice displeasure
which thou shouldst bear only name remains
permitted by our dastard nobles who
have all forsook hath devour'd rest
an suffer'd by th' voice slaves
whoop'd out rome now this extremity
hath brought thy hearth not out hope
mistake not save life if
had fear'd death all men i' th' world
would have 'voided thee but mere spite
full quit those banishers
heart wreak thee wilt revenge
thine own particular wrongs stop those maims
shame seen through thy country speed thee straight
make misery serve thy turn so use
revengeful services may prove
as benefits thee will fight
against cank'red country spleen
all under fiends but if so
thou dar'st not this prove more fortunes
longer live most weary present
throat thee thy ancient malice
which not cut would show thee but fool
since have ever followed thee hate
drawn tuns blood out thy country's breast
cannot live but thy shame unless
do thee service
aufidius o marcius marcius
each word thou hast spoke hath weeded from heart
should from yond cloud speak divine things
say ''tis true' i'd not believe them more
than thee all noble marcius let twine
mine arms about body where against
grained ash an hundred times hath broke
scarr'd moon splinters here clip
anvil sword do contest
as hotly as nobly thy love
as ever ambitious strength did
lov'd maid married never man
sigh'd truer breath but see thee here
thou noble thing more dances rapt heart
than when first wedded mistress saw
bestride threshold why thou mars tell
have power foot had purpose
once more hew thy target from thy brawn
or lose mine arm for't thou hast beat out
twelve several times have nightly since
have been down together sleep
unbuckling helms fisting each other's throat
wak'd half dead nothing worthy marcius
had no other quarrel else rome but
thou art thence banish'd would muster all
from twelve seventy pouring war
into bowels ungrateful rome
bold flood o'erbeat o come go
take our friendly senators by th' hands
who am prepar'd against territories
though not rome itself
coriolanus bless gods
aufidius therefore most absolute sir if thou wilt have
leading thine own revenges take
th' one half commission set down
as best thou art experienc'd since thou know'st
thy country's strength weakness thine own ways
whether knock against gates rome
fright them ere destroy but come
let commend thee first those shall
say yea thy desires thousand welcomes
more friend than e'er an enemy
yet marcius was much hand most welcome

scene vi
enter two tribunes sicinius brutus

scene vii
camp at short distance from rome
enter aufidius his lieutenant
aufidius do they still fly th' roman
lieutenant do not know what witchcraft's him but
their talk at table their thanks at end
are dark'ned this action sir
even by own
aufidius cannot help now
unless by using means lame foot
our design he bears himself more proudlier
even person than thought he would
when first did embrace him yet his nature
that's no changeling must excuse
lieutenant yet wish sir
mean particular had not
joind commission him but either
had borne action yourself or else
him had left solely
aufidius understand thee well thou sure
when he shall come his account he knows not
what can urge against him although seems
so he thinks no less apparent
shows good husbandry volscian state
fights dragon does achieve as soon
as draw his sword yet he hath left undone
which shall break his neck or hazard mine
whene'er come our account
lieutenant sir beseech think he'll carry rome
aufidius all places yield him ere he sits down
nobility rome are his
senators patricians love him too
will as rash repeal as hasty
expel him thence think he'll rome
as osprey fish who takes
by sovereignty nature first he was
noble servant them but he could not
carry his honours even whether 'twas pride
which out daily fortune ever taints
happy man whether defect judgment
fail disposing those chances
not other than one thing not moving
from th' casque th' cushion but commanding peace
even same austerity garb
as he controlld war but one these
as he hath spices them all not all
dare so far free him made him fear'd
so hated so banish'd but he has merit
choke utt'rance so our virtues
lie th' interpretation time
hath not tomb so evident as chair
t' extol what hath done
one fire drives out one fire one nail one nail
rights by rights falter strengths by strengths do fail
come let's away when caius rome thine
thou art poor'st all then shortly art thou mine
empty
act v scene
rome public place
menenius no i'll not go hear what he hath said
which was sometime his general who lov'd him
most dear particular he calld father
but what o' go banish'd him
mile before his tent fall down knee
way into his mercy nay if he coy'd
hear cominius speak i'll keep at home
cominius he would not seem know
menenius do hear
urg'd our old acquaintance drops
have bled together 'coriolanus'
he would not answer forbid all names
he was kind nothing titleless
till he had forg'd himself name i' th' fire
burning rome
menenius why so have made good work
pair tribunes have wrack'd rome
make coals cheap noble memory
when was less expected he replied
was bare petition state
one whom they had punish'd
menenius very well
could he say less

for's private friends his answer was
he could not stay pick them pile
noisome musty chaff he said 'twas folly
still nose th' offence

am one those his mother wife his child
this brave fellow too are grains
are musty chaff are smelt
above moon must burnt

rome towards marcius

return as cominius returnd

his unkindness say't so

must have thanks from rome after measure
as intended well
menenius i'll undertake't
think he'll hear yet bite his lip
hum at good cominius much unhearts
he was not taken well he had not dind
pout upon morning are unapt
give or forgive but when have stuff'd
these pipes these conveyances our blood
wine feeding have suppler souls
than our priest fasts therefore i'll watch him
till he dieted request
then i'll set upon him
brutus know very road into his kindness
cannot lose way
speed how will shall ere long have knowledge
success exit
cominius he'll never hear him
sicinius not
cominius tell he does sit gold his eye
red as 'twould burn rome his injury
gaoler his pity kneeld before him
'twas very faintly he said 'rise' dismiss'd
thus his speechless hand what he would do
bound an oath yield his conditions
so all hope vain
unless his noble mother his wife
who as hear mean solicit him
mercy his country therefore let's hence
our fair entreaties haste them exeunt
scene ii
volscian camp before rome

am an officer state come
speak coriolanus
first watch from whence
menenius from rome
first watch may not pass must return our general
will no more hear from thence

menenius good friends
if have heard general talk rome
his friends there lots blanks
name hath touch'd ears menenius
first watch so go back virtue name
not here passable
menenius tell thee fellow
thy general lover have been
book his good acts whence men have read
have ever verified friends
whom he's chief all size verity
would without lapsing suffer nay sometimes
bowl upon subtle ground
have tumbled past throw his praise
have almost stamp'd leasing therefore fellow
must have leave pass
first watch faith sir if had told as many lies his behalf
as have uttered words own should not pass here
therefore go back
menenius prithee fellow remember name menenius always
factionary party general

have am one telling true under him must say cannot
pass therefore go back

him till after dinner
first watch are roman are

have push'd out gates very defender them
violent popular ignorance given enemy shield think

intercession such decay'd dotant as seem can

having back

guardant cannot office from son coriolanus guess but by
