particular prosperity love thee no worse than thy old father

coriolanus wife mother child know not affairs
are servanted others though owe

than pity note how much therefore gone

scene iii
tent coriolanus
enter coriolanus aufidius others
set down our host partner this action
must report th' volscian lords how plainly
have borne this business
aufidius only their ends
have respected stopp'd ears against
general suit rome never admitted
private whisper no not such friends
thought them sure
coriolanus this last old man
lov'd above measure father
nay godded indeed their latest refuge
was send him whose old love have
though show'd sourly him once more offer'd
first conditions which they did refuse
cannot now accept grace him only
thought he could do more very little
have yielded fresh embassies suits
nor from state nor private friends hereafter
shall tempted infringe vow
same time 'tis made will not
enter mourning habits virgilia volumnia valeria
young marcius attendants
wife comes foremost then honour'd mould
wherein this trunk was fram'd her hand
grandchild her blood but out affection
all bond privilege nature break
let virtuous obstinate
which can make gods forsworn melt am not
stronger earth than others mother bows
as if olympus molehill should
supplication nod young boy
hath an aspect intercession which
great nature cries 'deny not' let volsces
plough rome harrow italy i'll never
such gosling obey instinct but stand
as if man were author himself
virgilia lord husband
coriolanus these eyes are not same wore rome
virgilia sorrow delivers us thus chang'd
makes think so
coriolanus dull actor now
have forgot part am out
even full disgrace best flesh
forgive tyranny but do not say
'forgive our romans' o kiss
now by jealous queen heaven kiss
carried from thee dear true lip
hath virgind e'er since gods prate
most noble mother world
leave unsaluted sink knee i' th' earth kneels
thy deep duty more impression show
than common sons
volumnia o stand up blest
whilst no softer cushion than flint
show duty as mistaken all this while
between child parent kneels
coriolanus what's this
knees corrected son
then let pebbles hungry beach
fillip stars then let mutinous winds
strike proud cedars 'gainst fiery sun
murd'ring impossibility make
what cannot slight work
holp frame thee do know this lady
coriolanus noble sister publicola
moon rome chaste as icicle
that's curdied by frost from purest snow
hangs dians temple dear valeria
volumnia this poor epitome yours
which by th' interpretation full time

have led since thy exile think thyself
how more unfortunate than all living women
make our eyes flow joy hearts dance comforts

making mother wife child see
son husband father tearing
his country's bowels out poor
thine enmity's most capital thou bar'st us

all but enjoy how can
alas how can our country pray
whereto are bound alack or must lose
country our dear nurse or else thy person
our comfort country must find
an evident calamity though had
our wish which side should win either thou
must as foreign recreant led
manacles through our streets or else

bear palm having bravely shed
purpose not wait fortune till
these wars determine if can not persuade thee
rather show noble grace both parts
than seek end one thou shalt no sooner

trust to't thou shalt not thy mother's womb
brought thee this world

have sat too long rising

may say 'this mercy have show'd' romans

if thou conquer rome benefit
which thou shalt thereby reap such name
whose repetition will dogg'd curses
but his last attempt he wip'd out
destroy'd his country his name remains
th' ensuing age abhorr'd' speak son
thou hast affected fine strains honour
imitate graces gods
tear thunder wide cheeks o' th' air
yet charge thy sulphur bolt
should but rive an oak why dost not speak
think'st thou honourable noble man
he cares not weeping speak thou boy
perhaps thy childishness will move him more
than can our reasons there's no man world
more bound to's mother yet here he lets prate
one i' th' stocks thou hast never thy life
show'd thy dear mother any courtesy
when she poor hen fond no second brood
has cluck'd thee wars safely home
loaden honour say request's unjust

thou restrainst from duty which
mother's part belongs he turns away
down ladies let us shame him our knees
his surname coriolanus 'longs more pride
than pity our prayers down an end

scene v
britain cymbeline's palace
enter queen ladies cornelius
make haste who has note them
lady madam
queen dispatch exeunt ladies
now master doctor have brought those drugs
cornelius pleaseth highness ay here they are madam
presenting box
but beseech grace without offence
conscience bids ask wherefore have
commanded these most poisonous compounds
but though slow deadly
queen wonder doctor
thou ask'st such question have not been
thy pupil long hast thou not learnd how
make perfumes distil preserve yea so
our great king himself doth woo oft
confections having thus far proceeded
unless thou think'st devilish is't not meet
did amplify judgment
these thy compounds such creatures as
count not worth hanging but none human
try vigour them apply
allayments their act by them gather
their several virtues effects
cornelius highness
shall from this practice but make hard heart
besides seeing these effects will
both noisome infectious
enter pisanio
aside here comes flattering rascal upon him
will first work he's his master
an enemy son how now pisanio
doctor service this time ended
take own way
cornelius aside do suspect madam
but shall do no harm
queen pisanio hark thee word
strange ling'ring poisons do know her spirit
will not trust one her malice
drug such damnd nature those she has
will stupefy dull sense awhile
which first perchance she'll prove cats dogs
then afterward up higher but there

act iii scene
britain hall cymbeline's palace
enter state cymbeline queen cloten lords at one door
at another caius lucius attendants

lucius when julius caesar whose remembrance yet
lives mens eyes will ears tongues
theme hearing ever was this britain
conquer'd cassibelan thine uncle
than his feats deserving him
his succession granted rome tribute
yearly three thousand pounds which by thee lately
left untender'd
queen kill marvel
shall so ever
cloten there many caesars
ere such another julius britain
world by itself will nothing pay
queen opportunity
which then they had take from 's resume
have again remember sir liege
kings ancestors together
natural bravery isle which stands
as neptune's park ribb'd pald
rocks unscalable roaring waters
sands will not bear enemies' boats
but suck them up th' top mast kind conquest
'came saw overcame' shame
first ever touch'd him he was carried
from off our coast twice beaten his shipping
poor ignorant baubles our terrible seas
egg shells mov'd upon their surges crack'd
as easily 'gainst our rocks joy whereof
fam'd cassibelan who was once at point
o giglot fortune master caesar's sword
made lud's town rejoicing fires bright
cloten come there's no more tribute paid our kingdom
stronger than was at time as said there no
moe such caesars other them may have crook'd noses but
owe such straight arms none
cymbeline son let mother end
cloten have yet many among us can gripe as hard as cassibelan
do not say am one but have hand why tribute why should
pay tribute if caesar can hide sun from us blanket
or put moon his pocket will pay him tribute light
cymbeline must know
till injurious romans did extort
this tribute from us were free caesar's ambition
which swelld so much did almost stretch
sides o' th' world against all colour here
did put yoke upons which shake
becomes warlike people whom reckon
ourselves
cloten do
our ancestor was mulmutius which
ordaind our laws whose use sword caesar
hath too much mangled whose repair franchise
shall by power hold our good deed
though rome therefore angry mulmutius made our laws
who was first britain which did put
his brows within golden crown calld
himself king
lucius am sorry cymbeline

thyself domestic officers thine enemy
receive from then war confusion

fury not resisted thus defied
thank thee myself

thy caesar knighted youth spent
much under him him gather'd honour
behoves keep at utterance am perfect
pannonians dalmatians
their liberties are now arms precedent
which not read would show britons cold
so caesar shall not find them
lucius let proof speak
cloten his majesty bids welcome make pastime us day or
two or longer if seek us afterwards other terms
shall find us our salt water girdle if beat us out
better there's an end
lucius so sir
cymbeline know master's pleasure he mine
all remain welcome exeunt
scene ii
britain another room cymbeline's palace
enter pisanio reading letter
pisanio how adultery wherefore write not
what monsters her accuse leonatus
falln into thy ear what false italian
as poisonous tongu'd as handed hath prevaild
thy too ready hearing disloyal no
she's punish'd her truth undergoes
more goddess than wife such assaults
as would take some virtue o master
thy mind her now as low as were
thy fortunes how should murder her
upon love truth vows which
if so do good service never

should seem lack humanity
so much as this fact comes reads 'do't letter
have sent her by her own command
shall give thee opportunity' o damnd paper
black as ink that's thee senseless bauble
art thou fedary this act look'st
so virgin without lo here she comes
am ignorant what am commanded
imogen how now pisanio
pisanio madam here letter from lord
imogen who thy lord lord leonatus
o learnd indeed were astronomer
knew stars as his characters
he'd lay future open good gods
let what here containd relish love
lord's health his content yet not
some griefs are med'cinable one them
doth physic love his content
all but good wax thy leave blest
bees make these locks counsel lovers
men dangerous bonds pray not alike
though forfeiters cast prison yet
clasp young cupid's tables good news gods
empty
'justice father's wrath should he take his
creatures would even renew eyes take notice
am cambria at milford haven what own love will out
this advise follow so he wishes all happiness
remains loyal his vow increasing love
leonatus posthumus'
o horse wings hear'st thou pisanio
he at milford haven read tell
how far 'tis thither if one mean affairs
may plod week why may not
who long'st see thy lord who long'st
o let 'bate but not yet long'st
but fainter kind o not
mine's beyond beyond say speak thick
love's counsellor should fill bores hearing
th' smothering sense how far
this same blessed milford by th' way
tell how wales was made so happy as
t' inherit such haven but first all
shall make time from our hence going
our return excuse but first how get hence
why should excuse born or ere begot
we'll talk hereafter prithee speak
how many score miles may well ride
'twixt hour hour
pisanio one score 'twixt sun sun
madam 's enough too much too
imogen why one rode to's execution man
where horses have been nimbler than sands
run i' th' clock's behalf but this foolry
go bid woman feign sickness say
she'll home her father provide presently
riding suit no costlier than would fit
franklins huswife
pisanio madam you're best consider

nor what ensues but have fog them
do as bid thee there's no more say
accessible none but milford way exeunt
scene iii
wales mountainous country cave
enter from cave belarius guiderius arviragus
belarius goodly day not keep house such
whose roof's as low as ours stoop boys this gate
instructs how t' adore heavens bows
morning's holy office gates monarchs
keep their impious turbans without
good morrow sun hail thou fair heaven
house i' th' rock yet use thee not so hardly
as prouder livers do
guiderius hail heaven
arviragus hail heaven
belarius now our mountain sport up yond hill
legs are young i'll tread these flats consider
when above perceive crow
may then revolve what tales have told
courts princes tricks war
this service not service so being done
but being so allow'd apprehend thus
draws us profit from all things see
often our comfort shall find
sharded beetle safer hold
than full wing'd eagle o this life
nobler than attending check
prouder than rustling unpaid silk
such gain cap him makes him fine
yet keeps his book uncross'd no life ours
guiderius out proof speak poor unfledg'd
have never wing'd from view o' th' nest nor know not
what air's from home haply this life best
if quiet life best sweeter
have sharper known well corresponding
stiff age but unto us
prison debtor not dares
stride limit
arviragus what should speak
when are old as when shall hear
rain wind beat dark december how
this our pinching cave shall discourse
freezing hours away have seen nothing
are beastly subtle as fox prey
warlike as wolf what eat
make choir as doth prisond bird
sing our bondage freely
belarius how speak
did but know city's usuries
felt them knowingly art o' th' court
as hard leave as keep whose top climb
certain falling or so slipp'ry
fear's as bad as falling toil o' th' war
pain only seems seek out danger
hath as oft sland'rous epitaph
as record fair act nay many times
doth ill deserve by doing well what's worse
must curtsy at censure o boys this story
world may read body's mark'd
roman swords report was once
first best note cymbeline lov'd
when soldier was theme name
was not far off then was as tree
storm or robbery call what will
shook down mellow hangings nay leaves
left bare weather
guiderius uncertain favour
belarius fault being nothing as have told oft
but two villains whose false oaths prevaild
before perfect honour swore cymbeline
was confederate romans so
follow'd banishment this twenty years
where have liv'd at honest freedom paid
more pious debts heaven than all
fore end time but up th' mountains
this not hunters' language he strikes
venison first shall lord o' th' feast
him other two shall minister
will fear no poison which attends
place greater state i'll meet valleys
exeunt guiderius arviragus
these boys know little they are sons th' king
nor cymbeline dreams they are alive
they think they are mine though traind up thus meanly
i' th' cave wherein they bow their thoughts do hit
roofs palaces nature prompts them
simple low things prince much
beyond trick others this polydore
heir cymbeline britain who
king his father calld guiderius jove
warlike feats have done his spirits fly out
into story say 'thus mine enemy fell
thus set foot ons neck' even then
princely blood flows his cheek he sweats
strains his young nerves puts himself posture
acts words younger brother cadwal
once arviragus as figure
strikes life into speech shows much more
his own conceiving hark game rous'd
thou didst unjustly banish whereon
at three two years old stole these babes
thinking bar thee succession as
thou refts lands euriphile
thou wast their nurse they took thee their mother
every day do honour her grave
myself belarius am morgan calld
they take natural father game up exit
scene iv
enter pisanio imogen
imogen thou told'st when came from horse place
was near at hand ne'er long'd mother so
see first as have now pisanio man
where posthumus what thy mind
makes thee stare thus wherefore breaks sigh
from th' inward thee one but painted thus
would interpreted thing perplex'd
beyond self explication put thyself
vanquish staider senses what's matter
why tender'st thou paper
look untender if't summer news
smile to't before if winterly thou need'st
but keep count'nance still husband's hand
drug damnd italy hath out craftied him
he's at some hard point speak man thy tongue
may take off some extremity which read
would even mortal
shall find wretched man thing
most disdaind fortune
imogen reads 'thy mistress pisanio hath play'd strumpet
bed testimonies whereof lie bleeding speak not
out weak surmises but from proof as strong as grief as
certain as expect revenge part thou pisanio must act
if thy faith not tainted breach hers let
thine own hands take away her life shall give thee opportunity
at milford haven she hath letter purpose where if
pander her dishonour equally disloyal'
pisanio what shall need draw sword paper
hath cut her throat already no 'tis slander
whose edge sharper than sword whose tongue
outvenoms all worms nile whose breath
rides posting winds doth belie
all corners world kings queens states
maids matrons nay secrets grave
this viperous slander enters what cheer madam
lie watch there think him
weep twixt clock clock if sleep charge nature
break fearful dream him
cry myself awake that's false to's bed

pisanio alas good lady
imogen false thy conscience witness iachimo
thou didst accuse him incontinency
thou then look'dst villain now methinks
whose mother was her painting hath betray'd him
poor am stale garment out fashion
am richer than hang by th' walls
must ripp'd pieces o
mens vows are womens traitors all good seeming
by thy revolt o husband shall thought
put villainy not born where't grows
but worn bait ladies
pisanio good madam hear
were his time thought false sinons weeping
did scandal many holy tear took pity
from most true wretchedness so thou posthumus
wilt lay leaven all proper men
goodly gallant shall false perjur'd
from thy great fail come fellow thou honest
do thou thy master's bidding when thou seest him
little witness obedience look
draw sword myself take hit
fear not 'tis empty all things but grief
thy master not there who was indeed
riches do his bidding strike
thou mayst valiant better cause
but now thou seem'st coward
pisanio hence vile instrument
thou shalt not damn hand
imogen why must die
if do not by thy hand thou art
there prohibition so divine
cravens weak hand come here's heart
something's afore't soft soft we'll no defence
obedient as scabbard what here
scriptures loyal leonatus
all turnd heresy away away
corrupters faith shall no more
stomachers heart thus may poor fools
believe false teachers though those are betray'd
stands worse case woe thou posthumus
didst set up disobedience 'gainst king
father make put into contempt suits
princely fellows shalt hereafter find
no act common passage but
strain rareness grieve myself
think when thou shalt disedg'd by her
now thou tirest how thy memory
will then pang'd by prithee dispatch
thou art too slow do thy master's bidding
when desire too
pisanio o gracious lady
since receiv'd command do this busines
have not slept one wink
imogen do't bed then
pisanio i'll wake mine eyeballs first
imogen wherefore then
didst undertake why hast thou abus'd
mine action thine own our horses' labour
time inviting thee perturb'd court
being absent whereunto never
purpose return why hast thou gone so far
unbent when thou hast ta'en thy stand
th' elected deer before thee
pisanio but win time

have consider'd course good lady
imogen talk thy tongue weary speak

thought would not back again

bringing here kill

this cursed injury

dead husband

hath britain all sun shines day night

great pool swans nest prithee think
there's livers out britain

think other place th' ambassador
morrow now if could wear mind
dark as fortune but disguise
which t' appear itself must not yet

pretty full view yea happily near

would adventure

handmaids all women or more truly
woman pretty self into waggish courage
ready gibes quick answer'd saucy

common kissing titan forget

made great juno angry

man already

how now son

scene vi
wales before cave belarius
enter imogen alone boy's clothes

have made ground bed should sick
but resolution helps milford

foundations fly wretched such mean
where they should reliev'd two beggars told
could not miss way will poor folks lie
have afflictions them knowing 'tis
punishment or trial yes no wonder
sorer than lie need falsehood
worse kings than beggars dear lord
thou art one o' th' false ones now think thee
hunger's gone but even before was
at point sink food but what this
here path to't 'tis some savage hold
were best not call dare not call yet famine
ere clean o'erthrow nature makes valiant
plenty peace breeds cowards hardness ever
if anything that's civil speak if savage
take or lend ho no answer then i'll enter
best draw sword if mine enemy
but fear sword he'll scarcely look ont
such foe good heavens exit into cave

poor house keep'st thyself

here were fairy

have died had not made

rome public place

act iv scene
wales near cave belarius
enter cloten alone
cloten am near th' place where they should meet if pisanio
have mapp'd truly how fit his garments serve why should
his mistress who was made by him made tailor not
fit too rather saving reverence word 'tis said
dare speak myself not vain glory man
his glass confer his own chamber mean lines
body are as well drawn as his no less young more strong not
beneath him fortunes beyond him advantage time
above him birth alike conversant general services
more remarkable single oppositions yet this imperceiverant
thing loves him despite what mortality posthumus thy
head which now growing upon thy shoulders shall within this
hour off thy mistress enforced thy garments cut pieces
who may haply little angry so rough usage but
mother having power his testiness shall turn all into
commendations horse tied up safe out sword
sore purpose fortune put them into hand this very
description their meeting place fellow dares not
deceive exit
scene ii
wales before cave belarius
enter from cave belarius guiderius arviragus imogen
we'll come after hunting

are not brothers

but clay clay differs dignity
whose dust both alike am very sick
guiderius go hunting i'll abide him

but not so citizen wanton as
stick journal course breach custom

cannot amend society no comfort
one not sociable am not very sick
since can reason pray trust here
i'll rob none but myself let die

yield rustic mountaineer exeunt fighting
re enter belarius arviragus
belarius no company's abroad
arviragus none world did mistake him sure
belarius cannot tell long since saw him
but time hath nothing blurr'd those lines favour
which then he wore snatches his voice
burst speaking were as his am absolute
'twas very cloten
wish brother make good time him
say he so fell

mean man he had not apprehension
or roaring terrors defect judgment
oft cease fear
re enter guiderius clotens head
but see thy brother
guiderius this cloten was fool an empty purse
could have knock'd out his brains he had none
yet not doing this fool had borne
head as do his
belarius what hast thou done
guiderius am perfect what cut off one clotens head
son queen after his own report
who calld traitor mountaineer swore
his own single hand he'd take us
displace our heads where thank gods they grow
belarius are all undone
guiderius why worthy father what have lose
but he swore take our lives law
protects not us then why should tender
let an arrogant piece flesh threat us
play judge executioner all himself
do fear law what company
discover abroad
belarius no single soul
he must have some attendants though his humour
was nothing but mutation ay
from one bad thing worse not frenzy not
absolute madness could so far have rav'd
bring him here alone although perhaps
may heard at court such as
cave here hunt here are outlaws time
may make some stronger head which he hearing
as him might break out swear
come alone either he so undertaking
or they so suffering then good ground fear
if do fear this body hath tail
more perilous than head
arviragus let ordinance
come as gods foresay howsoe'er
brother hath done well
belarius had no mind
hunt this day boy fidele's sickness
guiderius his own sword
which he did wave against throat have ta'en
his head from him i'll throw't into creek
behind our rock let sea
tell fishes he's queens son cloten
that's all reck exit
belarius fear'twill reveng'd
would polydore thou hadst not done't though valour
becomes thee well enough
so revenge alone pursu'd polydore
love thee brotherly but envy much
thou hast robb'd this deed would revenges
possible strength might meet would seek us through
put us our answer
belarius well 'tis done
we'll hunt no more day nor seek danger
where there's no profit prithee our rock
fidele play cooks i'll stay
dinner presently
arviragus poor sick fidele
i'll willingly him gain his colour
i'd let parish such clotens blood
praise myself charity exit
belarius o thou goddess
thou divine nature thou thyself thou blazonst
these two princely boys they are as gentle
as zephyrs blowing below violet
their royal blood enchaf'd as rud'st wind
by top doth take mountain pine
make him stoop th' vale 'tis wonder
an invisible instinct should frame them
royalty unlearnd honour untaught
civility not seen from other valour
wildly grows them but yields crop
as if had been sow'd yet still it's strange
what clotens being here us portends
re enter guiderius
guiderius where's brother
have sent clotens clotpoll down stream
embassy his mother his body's hostage
his return solemn music
belarius ingenious instrument
hark polydore sounds but what occasion
hath cadwal now give motion hark
guiderius he at home
guiderius what does he mean since death dear'st mother
did not speak before all solemn things
should answer solemn accidents matter

have made so much had rather

than have seen this
guiderius o sweetest fairest lily
brother wears thee not one half so well
as when thou grew'st thyself
who ever yet could sound thy bottom find

how found him
arviragus stark as see
thus smiling as some fly had tickled slumber
not as death's dart being laugh'd at his right cheek

clouted brogues from off feet whose rudeness
answer'd steps too loud

which being cruel world concluded

were present when she finish'd

affected greatness got by not
married royalty was wife place
abhorr'd person

but she spoke dying would not

such integrity she did confess
was as scorpion her sight whose life
but her flight prevented she had
ta'en off by poison
cymbeline o most delicate fiend
who is't can read woman there more
cornelius more sir worse she did confess she had
mortal mineral which being took
by inches waste which time she purpos'd
by watching weeping tendance kissing
o'ercome her show time
when she had fitted her craft work
her son into th' adoption crown
but failing her end by his strange absence
grew shameless desperate opend despite
heaven men her purposes repented
evils she hatch'd were not effected so
cymbeline heard all this her women
lady did so please highness
cymbeline mine eyes
were not fault she was beautiful
mine ears heard her flattery nor heart
thought her her seeming had been vicious
have mistrusted her yet o daughter
was folly thou mayst say
prove thy feeling heaven mend all
roman prisoners guarded posthumus behind imogen
thou com'st not caius now tribute
britons have raz'd out though loss
many bold one whose kinsmen have made suit
their good souls may appeas'd slaughter
their captives which ourself have granted
so think estate

was yours by accident had gone us
our prisoners sword but since gods
will have thus nothing but our lives
may calld ransom let come sufficeth
roman romans heart can suffer
augustus lives think ont so much
peculiar care this one thing only
will entreat boy briton born

page so kind so duteous diligent

his favour familiar boy

art mine own know not why wherefore

noblest ta'en

must shuffle itself

why stands he so perplex'd

good or bad cymbeline imogen advance

which our honour bitter torture shall

cymbeline all belongs this

whom heart drops blood false spirits
quail remember give leave faint

memory green us befitted

contracted one brow woe
yet so far hath discretion fought nature
wisest sorrow think him
therefore our sometime sister now our queen
th' imperial jointress this warlike state
have as 'twere defeated joy
an auspicious dropping eye

equal scale weighing delight dole

better wisdoms which have freely gone

holding weak supposal our worth

our state disjoint out frame
colleagued this dream his advantage

scene iii
elsinore room house polonius
enter laertes ophelia
laer necessaries are embark'd farewell
sister as winds give benefit
convoy assistant do not sleep
oph do doubt
laer hamlet trifling his favour
hold fashion toy blood
violet youth primy nature
forward not permanent sweet not lasting
perfume suppliance minute
no more
oph no more but so
laer think no more
thews bulk but as this temple waxes
inward service mind soul
grows wide withal perhaps he loves now
now no soil nor cautel doth besmirch
virtue his will but must fear
his greatness weigh'd his will not his own
he himself subject his birth
he may not as unvalued persons do
carve himself his choice depends
therefore must his choice circumscrib'd
unto voice yielding body
whereof he head then if he says he loves
fits wisdom so far believe
as he his particular act place
may give his saying deed which no further
than main voice denmark goes withal
then weigh what loss honour may sustain
if too credent ear list his songs
his unmast'red importunity
fear ophelia fear dear sister
keep rear affection
out shot danger desire
chariest maid prodigal enough
if she unmask her beauty moon
virtue itself scopes not calumnious strokes
canker galls infants spring
too oft before their buttons disclos'd
contagious blastments are most imminent
wary then best safety lies fear
youth itself rebels though none else near
oph shall th' effect this good lesson keep
as watchman heart but good brother
do not as some ungracious pastors do
show steep thorny way heaven
whiles puff'd reckless libertine
himself primrose path dalliance treads
laer o fear not
enter polonius
stay too long but here father comes
double blessing double grace
occasion smiles upon second leave
pol yet here laertes aboard aboard shame
wind sits shoulder sail
are stay'd there blessing thee
these few precepts thy memory
nor any unproportiond thought his act
thou familiar but by no means vulgar
those friends thou hast their adoption tried
grapple them unto thy soul hoops steel
but do not dull thy palm entertainment
each new hatch'd unfledg'd comrade beware
entrance quarrel but being
bear't th' opposed may beware thee
give every man thine ear but few thy voice
costly thy habit as thy purse can buy
but not express'd fancy rich not gaudy
apparel oft proclaims man
they france best rank station
are most select generous chief
neither borrower nor lender
loan oft loses both itself friend
borrowing dulls edge husbandry
this above all thine own self true
thou canst not then false any man
farewell blessing season this thee
laer most humbly do take leave lord
pol time invites go servants tend
laer farewell ophelia remember well
what have said
oph 'tis memory lock'd
yourself shall keep key
laer farewell exit
oph so please something touching lord hamlet
pol marry well bethought
'tis told he hath very oft late
given private time yourself
have audience been most free bounteous
if so as so 'tis put
way caution must tell
do not understand yourself so clearly
as behooves daughter honour
oph he hath lord late made many tenders
his affection
pol affection pooh speak green girl
unsifted such perilous circumstance
do believe his tenders as call them
oph do not know lord what should think
pol marry will teach think yourself baby
have ta'en these tenders true pay
which are not sterling tender yourself more dearly
running thus you'll tender fool
oph lord he hath importund love
honourable fashion
pol ay fashion may call go go
oph hath given countenance his speech lord
almost all holy vows heaven

pith marrow our attribute

'the rugged pyrrhus he whose sable arms
black as his purpose did night resemble
when he lay couched ominous horse
hath now this dread black complexion smear'd
heraldry more dismal head foot
now total gules horridly trick'd

but whiff wind his fell sword
th' unnerved father falls then senseless ilium
seeming feel this blow flaming top
stoops his base hideous crash
takes prisoner pyrrhus' ear lo his sword
reverend priam seem'd i' th' air stick
so as painted tyrant pyrrhus stood
neutral his will matter
did nothing
but as often see against some storm
silence heavens rack stand still
bold winds speechless orb below
as hush as death anon dreadful thunder
doth rend region so after pyrrhus' pause
never did cyclops' hammers fall
mars's armour forg'd proof eterne
less remorse than pyrrhus' bleeding sword
now falls priam

hath primal eldest curse upont

both neglect what if this cursed hand
were thicker than itself brother's blood

but confront visage offence

can serve turn 'forgive foul murther'

those effects which did murther
crown mine own ambition queen

there no shuffling there action lies
his true nature ourselves compelld
even teeth forehead our faults

where every god did seem set his seal
give world assurance man

here husband mildew'd ear

could this fair mountain leave feed
cannot call love at age
heyday blood tame it's humble
waits upon judgment what judgment
would step from this this sense sure have
else could not have motion but sure sense
apoplex'd madness would not err
nor sense ecstacy was ne'er so thralld

serve such difference what devil was't

or but sickly part one true sense
could not so mope

this bodiless creation ecstasy
very cunning
ham ecstasy
pulse as yours doth temperately keep time
makes as healthful music not madness
have utt'red bring test
matter will reword which madness
would gambol from mother love grace
lay not flattering unction soul
will but skin film ulcerous place
whiles rank corruption mining all within
infects unseen confess yourself heaven
repent what's past avoid what come
do not spread compost weeds
make them ranker forgive this virtue
fatness these pursy times
virtue itself vice must pardon beg
yea curb woo leave do him good
ham o throw away worser part
live purer other half
good night but go not uncle's bed
assume virtue if have not
monster custom who all sense doth eat
habits evil angel yet this
use actions fair good
he likewise gives frock or livery
aptly put refrain night
next abstinence next more easy
use almost can change stamp nature
either master devil or throw him out
wondrous potency once more good night
when are desirous blest
i'll blessing beg this same lord
do repent but heaven hath pleas'd so
punish this this
must their scourge minister
death gave him so again good night
must cruel only kind

scene england wales
london palace
enter king lord john lancaster earl westmoreland
sir walter blunt others
king so shaken as are so wan care
find time frighted peace pant
breathe short winded accents new broils
commenc'd stronds afar remote
no more thirsty entrance this soil
shall daub her lips her own childrens blood
nor bruise her flow'rets armed hoofs
hostile paces those opposed eyes
which meteors troubled heaven
all one nature one substance bred
did lately meet intestine shock
furious close civil butchery
shall now mutual well beseeming ranks
march all one way no more oppos'd
against acquaintance kindred allies
no more shall cut his master therefore friends
as far as sepulchre christ
whose soldier now under whose blessed cross
are impressed engag'd fight
forthwith power english shall levy
whose arms were moulded their mother's womb
chase these pagans those holy fields
over whose acres walk'd those blessed feet
which fourteen hundred years ago were naild
but this our purpose now twelvemonth old
bootless 'tis tell will go
therefore meet not now then let hear
gentle cousin westmoreland
what yesternight our council did decree
forwarding this dear expedience
west liege this haste was hot question
many limits charge set down
but yesternight when all athwart there came
whose worst was noble mortimer
leading men herefordshire fight
against irregular wild glendower
was by rude hands welshman taken
thousand his people butchered
upon whose dead corpse there was such misuse
such beastly shameless transformation
by those welshwomen done as may not
without much shame retold or spoken
brake off our business holy land
west this match'd other did gracious lord
more uneven unwelcome news
came from north thus did import
holy rood day gallant hotspur there
young harry percy brave archibald
ever valiant approved scot
at holmedon met
where they did spend sad bloody hour
shape likelihood news was told
he brought them very heat
pride their contention did take horse
uncertain issue any way
king here dear true industrious friend
sir walter blunt new lighted from his horse
staind variation each soil
betwixt holmedon this seat ours
he hath brought us smooth welcome news
ten thousand bold scots two twenty knights
balk'd their own blood did sir walter see
holmedons plains prisoners hotspur took
mordake earl fife eldest son
beaten douglas earl athol
murray angus menteith
not this an honourable spoil
gallant prize ha cousin not
west faith
king yea there thou mak'st sad mak'st sin
envy lord northumberland
should father so blest son
son who theme honour's tongue
amongst grove very straightest plant
who sweet fortune's minion her pride
whilst by looking praise him
see riot dishonour stain brow
young harry o could prov'd
cradle clothes our children where they lay
calld mine percy his plantagenet
then would have his harry he mine
but let him from thoughts what think coz
this young percy's pride prisoners
which he this adventure hath surpris'd
his own use he keeps sends word
shall have none but mordake earl fife
west this his uncle's teaching this worcester
which makes him prune himself bristle up
crest youth against dignity
king but have sent him answer this
this cause awhile must neglect
our holy purpose jerusalem
cousin wednesday next our council
will hold at windsor so inform lords
but come yourself speed us again
more said done
west will liege exeunt
scene ii
london an apartment prince's
enter prince wales sir john falstaff
fal now hal what time day lad
prince thou art so fat witted drinking old sack
unbuttoning thee after supper sleeping upon benches after
noon thou hast forgotten demand truly which thou
wouldest truly know what devil hast thou do time
clocks tongues bawds dials signs leaping
houses blessed sun himself fair hot wench
flame coloured taffeta see no reason why thou shouldst so
superfluous demand time day
fal indeed come near now hal take purses go
by moon seven stars not by phoebus he
wand'ring knight so fair prithee sweet wag when thou art
king as god save thy grace majesty should say grace thou
wilt have none
fal no by troth not so much as will serve prologue
an egg butter
prince well how then come roundly roundly
fal marry then sweet wag when thou art king let not us
are squires night's body called thieves day's
beauty let us diana's foresters gentlemen shade
minions moon let men say men good
government being governed as sea by our noble chaste
mistress moon under whose countenance steal
us are moons men doth ebb flow sea being
governed as sea by moon as proof now purse
gold most resolutely snatch'd monday night most
dissolutely spent tuesday morning got swearing 'lay by'
spent crying 'bring now ill as low an ebb as
foot ladder by by as high flow as ridge
gallows
fal by lord thou say'st true lad not hostess
tavern most sweet wench
buff jerkin most sweet robe durance
fal how now how now mad wag what thy quips thy
quiddities what plague have do buff jerkin
prince why what pox have do hostess tavern
fal well thou hast calld her reckoning many time oft
prince did ever call thee pay thy part
fal no i'll give thee thy due thou hast paid all there
prince yea elsewhere so far as coin would stretch
where would not have used credit
art heir apparent but prithee sweet wag shall there
gallows standing england when thou art king resolution
thus fubb'd as rusty curb old father antic
law do not thou when thou art king hang thief
prince no thou shalt
fal shall o rare by lord i'll brave judge
prince thou judgest false already mean thou shalt have

no man regards

now am if man should speak truly little better than one
wicked must give over this life will give over
by lord an do not am villain i'll damnd

poins now shall know if gadshill have set match o if men

true man

prince else he had been damnd cozening devil
poins but lads lads morrow morning by four o'clock
early at gadshill there are pilgrims gong canterbury
have vizards all have horses yourselves
gadshill lies night rochester have bespoke supper

will go will stuff purses full crowns if will

fal hear ye yedward if tarry at home go not i'll hang
going
poins will chops
fal hal wilt thou make one
fal there's neither honesty manhood nor good fellowship thee

prince well then once days i'll madcap

prince well come what will i'll tarry at home
fal by lord i'll traitor then when thou art king
prince care not
poins sir john prithee leave prince alone will

prove false thief poor abuses time want

poins now good sweet honey lord ride us morrow
have jest execute cannot manage alone falstaff
already waylaid yourself will not there when they
have booty if do not rob them cut this head off
from shoulders
prince how shall part them setting forth
poins why will set forth before or after them appoint them
place meeting wherein at our pleasure fail
then will they adventure upon exploit themselves which they
shall have no sooner achieved but we'll set upon them
prince yea but 'tis they will know us by our horses by
poins tut our horses they shall not see i'll tie them
wood our wizards will change after leave them
sirrah have cases buckram nonce immask our
noted outward garments
prince yea but doubt they will too hard us
poins well two them know them as true bred
cowards as ever turnd back third if he fight
longer than he sees reason i'll forswear arms virtue
this jest will lie incomprehensible lies this same fat
he fought what wards what blows what extremities he
endured reproof this lies jest
prince well i'll go thee provide us all things necessary
meet night eastcheap there i'll sup farewell
poins farewell lord exit
prince know all will awhile uphold
unyok'd humour idleness
yet herein will imitate sun
who doth permit base contagious clouds
when he please again lie himself
being wanted he may more wond'red at
by breaking through foul ugly mists
vapours did seem strangle him
if all year were playing holidays
sport would as tedious as work
but when they seldom come they wish'd come
nothing pleaseth but rare accidents
so when this loose behaviour throw off
by how much better than word am
by so much shall falsify mens hopes
bright metal sullen ground
reformation glitt'ring o'er fault
shall show more goodly attract more eyes
than which hath no foil set off
i'll so offend make offence skill
redeeming time when men think least will exit
scene iii
enter king northumberland worcester hotspur sir walter blunt
others
king blood hath been too cold temperate
unapt stir at these indignities
have found accordingly
tread upon patience but sure
will from henceforth rather myself
mighty fear'd than condition
which hath been smooth as oil soft as young down
which proud soul ne'er pays but proud
wor our house sovereign liege little deserves
scourge greatness us'd
same greatness too which our own hands
have holp make so portly
north lord
king worcester get thee gone do see
danger disobedience thine eye
o sir presence too bold peremptory
moody frontier servant brow
tou have good leave leave us when need
'your use counsel shall send
exit worcester
were about speak
north yea good lord
those prisoners highness' name demanded
which harry percy here at holmedon took
were as he says not such strength denied
either envy therefore or misprision
guilty this fault not son
hot liege did deny no prisoners
but remember when fight was done
when was dry rage extreme toll
breathless faint leaning upon sword
came there certain lord neat trimly dress'd
fresh as bridegroom his chin new reap'd
show'd stubble land at harvest home
'twixt his finger his thumb he held
pouncet box which ever anon
he gave his nose took't away again
who therewith angry when next came there
took snuff still he smild talk'd
as soldiers bore dead bodies by
he calld them untaught knaves unmannerly
bring slovenly unhandsome corse
betwixt wind his nobility
he questioned amongst rest demanded
prisoners majesty's behalf
then all smarting wounds being cold
so pest'red popingay
out grief impatience
answer'd neglectingly know not what
he should or he should not he made mad
see him shine so brisk smell so sweet
talk so waiting gentlewoman
telling sovereignest thing earth
was parmacity an inward bruise
was great pity so was
this villanous saltpetre should digg'd
out bowels harmless earth
which many good tall fellow had destroy'd
so cowardly but these vile 'guns
he would himself have been soldier
this bald unjointed chat his lord
beseech let not his report
come current an accusation
betwixt love high majesty
blunt circumstance considered good lord
whate'er lord harry percy then had said
such person such place
at such time all rest retold
may reasonably die never rise
do him wrong or any way impeach
king why yet he doth deny his prisoners
but proviso exception
at our own charge shall ransom straight
his brother law foolish mortimer
who soul hath wilfully betray'd
lives those he did lead fight
against great magician damnd glendower
whose daughter as hear earl march
hath lately married shall our coffers then
shall buy treason indent fears
when they have lost forfeited themselves
no barren mountains let him starve
shall never hold man friend
whose tongue shall ask one penny cost
ransom home revolted mortimer
hot revolted mortimer
he never did fall off sovereign liege
but by chance war prove true
those mouthed wounds which valiantly he took
when gentle severns sedgy bank
single opposition hand hand
he did confound best part an hour
changing hardiment great glendower
three times they breath'd three times did they drink
upon agreement swift severns flood
who then affrighted their bloody looks
ran fearfully among trembling reeds
bloodstained these valiant cohabitants
never did base rotten policy
colour her working such deadly wounds
nor never could noble mortimer
receive so many all willingly
then let not him slandered revolt

tell thee

then was when unhappy king

depos'd shortly murdered

heir crown

world curses undergo

o pardon descend so low

or fill up chronicles time come
did gage them both an unjust behalf
as both god pardon have done

are foold discarded shook off

revenge jeering disdaind contempt
this proud king who studies day night
answer all debt he owes
even bloody payment deaths
therefore say

quick conceiving discontents

as o'erwalk current roaring loud

scene ii
london palace
enter king prince wales others
king lords give us leave prince wales
must have some private conference but near at hand
shall presently have need
know not whether god will have so
some displeasing service have done
his secret doom out blood
he'll breed revengement scourge
but thou dost thy passages life
make believe thou art only mark'd
hot vengeance rod heaven
punish mistreadings tell else
could such inordinate low desires
such barren pleasures rude society
as thou art match'd withal grafted
accompany greatness thy blood
hold their level thy princely heart
prince so please majesty would could
quit all offences as clear excuse
as well as am doubtless can purge
myself many am charged withal
yet such extenuation let beg
which oft ear greatness needs must bear
by smiling pickthanks base newsmongers
may some things true wherein youth
hath faulty wand'red irregular
pardon lily true submission
king god pardon thee yet let wonder harry
at thy affections which do hold wing
quite from flight all thy ancestors
thy place council thou hast rudely lost
art almost an alien hearts
all court princes blood
hope expectation thy time
ruind soul every man
prophetically do forethink thy fall
had so lavish presence been
so common hackney'd eyes men
so stale cheap vulgar company
opinion did help crown
left reputeless banishment
fellow no mark nor likelihood
by being seldom seen could not stir
but comet was wond'red at
men would tell their children 'this he'
others would say 'where which bolingbroke'
then stole all courtesy from heaven
dress'd myself such humility
did pluck allegiance from mens hearts
even presence crowned king
thus did keep person fresh new
presence robe pontifical
ne'er seen but wond'red at so state
seldom but sumptuous show'd feast
won by rareness such solemnity
skipping king he ambled up down
shallow jesters rash bavin wits
soon kindled soon burnt carded his state
had his great name profaned their scorns
gave his countenance against his name
laugh at gibing boys stand push
every beardless vain comparative
grew companion common streets
enfeoff'd himself popularity
being dally swallowed by mens eyes
they surfeited honey began
loathe taste sweetness whereof little
so when he had occasion seen
he was but as cuckoo june
heard not regarded seen but such eyes
as sick blunted community
afford no extraordinary gaze
such as bent unlike majesty
when shines seldom admiring eyes
but rather drows'd hung their eyelids down
slept his face rend'red such aspect
being his presence glutted gorg'd full
very line harry standest thou
thou hast lost thy princely privilege
vile participation not an eye
but aweary thy common sight
save mine which hath desir'd see thee more
which now doth would not have do
make blind itself foolish tenderness
prince shall hereafter thrice gracious lord
king all world
as thou art this hour was richard then
when from france set foot at ravenspurgh
even as was then percy now
now by sceptre soul boot
he hath more worthy interest state
than thou shadow succession
no right nor colour right
he doth fill fields harness realm
being no more debt years than thou
leads ancient lords reverend bishops
bloody battles bruising arms
what never dying honour hath he got
against renowmed douglas whose high deeds
whose hot incursions great name arms
holds from all soldiers chief majority
military title capital
through all kingdoms acknowledge christ
this infant warrior his enterprises
discomfited great douglas ta'en him once
enlarged him made friend him
fill mouth deep defiance up
shake peace safety our throne
what say this percy northumberland
archbishop's grace york douglas mortimer
capitulate against us are up
but wherefore do tell these news thee
which art nearest dearest enemy'
thou art enough through vassal fear
base inclination start spleen
fight against under percy's pay
dog his heels curtsy at his frowns
show how much thou art degenerate
prince do not think so shall not find so
god forgive them so much have sway'd
majesty's good thoughts away from
closing some glorious day
bold tell am son
when will wear garment all blood
stain favours bloody mask
which wash'd away shall scour shame
shall day whene'er lights
this same child honour renown
this gallant hotspur this all praised knight
unthought harry chance meet

his glorious deeds indignities

act iv scene
rebel camp near shrewsbury
enter harry hotspur worcester douglas
hot well said noble scot if speaking truth
such attribution should douglas have
as not soldier this seasons stamp
should go so general current through world
by god cannot flatter defy
tongues soothers but braver place
heart's love hath no man than yourself
nay task word approve lord
doug thou art king honour
no man so potent breathes upon ground
enter one letters
hot do so 'tis well
what letters hast thou there can but thank
messenger these letters come from father
hot letters from him why comes he not himself
mess he cannot come lord he grievous sick
hot zounds how has he leisure sick
such justling time who leads his power
under whose government come they along
wor prithee tell doth he keep his bed
mess he did lord four days ere set forth
at time departure thence
he was much fear'd by his physicians
wor would state time had first been whole
ere he by sickness had been visited
his health was never better worth than now
hot sick now droop now this sickness doth infect
very lifeblood our enterprise
he writes here inward sickness
his friends by deputation could not
so soon drawn no did he think meet
lay so dangerous dear trust
any soul remov'd but his own
yet doth he give us bold advertisement
our small conjunction should
see how fortune dispos'd us
as he writes there no quailing now
all our purposes what say
wor father's sickness maim us
hot perilous gash very limb lopp'd off
yet faith not his present want
seems more than shall find were good
set exact wealth all our states
all at one cast set so rich man
nice hazard one doubtful hour
were not good therein should read
very list very utmost bound
all our fortunes
doug faith so should
where now remains sweet reversion
may boldly spend upon hope what
come
comfort retirement lives this
hot rendezvous home fly unto
if devil mischance look big
wor but yet would father had been here
quality hair our attempt
brooks no division will thought
by some know not why he away
wisdom loyalty mere dislike
our proceedings kept earl from hence
think how such an apprehension
may turn tide fearful faction
breed kind question our cause
must keep aloof from strict arbitrement
stop all sight holes every loop from whence
eye reason may pry upon us
this absence father's draws curtain
shows ignorant kind fear
before not dreamt
hot strain too far
rather his absence make this use
lends lustre more great opinion
than if earl were here men must think
if without his help can make head
push against kingdom his help
shall o'erturn topsy turvy down
yet all goes well yet all our joints are whole
doug as heart can think there not such word
spoke scotland as this term fear
enter sir richard vernon
hot cousin vernon welcome by soul
earl westmoreland seven thousand strong
marching hitherwards him prince john
hot no harm what more
ver further have learnd
king himself person set forth
or hitherwards intended speedily
strong mighty preparation
hot he shall welcome too where his son
nimble footed madcap prince wales
bid pass
ver all furnish'd all arms
all plum'd estridges wind
bated eagles having lately bath'd
glittering golden coats images
as full spirit as month may
gorgeous as sun at midsummer
wanton as youthful goats wild as young bulls
saw young harry his beaver
rise from ground feathered mercury
vaulted such ease into his seat
as if an angel dropp'd down from clouds
turn wind fiery pegasus
witch world noble horsemanship
hot no more no more worse than sun march
this praise doth nourish agues let them come
they come sacrifices their trim
fire ey'd maid smoky war
mailed mars shall his altar sit
up ears blood am fire
hear this rich reprisal so nigh
yet not ours come let taste horse
who bear thunderbolt
against bosom prince wales
harry harry shall hot horse horse
meet ne'er part till one drop down corse
glendower were come

scene iii
rebel camp near shrewsbury
enter hotspur worcester douglas vernon

ver not whit

ver so do
wor good cousin advis'd stir not night
ver do not lord
doug do not counsel well
speak out fear cold heart
ver do no slander douglas by life
dare well maintain life
if well respected honour bid
hold as little counsel weak fear
as lord or any scot this day lives
which us fears
doug yea or night
ver content
hot night say
come come may not wonder much
being men such great leading as are
foresee not what impediments
drag back our expedition certain horse
cousin vernons are not yet come up
now their pride mettle asleep
their courage hard labour tame dull
not horse half half himself
hot so are horses enemy
general journey bated brought low
better part ours are full rest
wor number king exceedeth ours
god's sake cousin stay till all come
trumpet sounds parley
blunt come gracious offers from king
if vouchsafe hearing respect
hot welcome sir walter blunt would god
were our determination
some us love well even those some
envy great deservings good name
because are not our quality
but stand against us an enemy
blunt god defend but still should stand so
stand against anointed majesty
but charge king hath sent know
nature griefs whereupon
conjure from breast civil peace
such bold hostility teaching his duteous land
audacious cruelty if king
have any way good deserts forgot
which he confesseth manifold
he bids name griefs all speed
pardon absolute yourself these
herein misled by suggestion
hot king kind well know king
knows at what time promise when pay
father uncle myself
did give him same royalty he wears
when he was not six twenty strong
sick world's regard wretched low
poor unminded outlaw sneaking home
when he heard him swear vow god
he came but duke lancaster
sue his livery beg his peace
tears innocency terms zeal
father kind heart pity mov'd
swore him assistance performed too
now when lords barons realm
perceiv'd northumberland did lean him
more less came cap knee
attended him bridges stood lanes
laid gifts before him proffer'd him their oaths
give him their heirs as pages followed him
even at heels golden multitudes
he presently as greatness knows itself
steps little higher than his vow
made father while his blood was poor
upon naked shore at ravenspurgh
now forsooth takes him reform
lie too heavy commonwealth
cries out upon abuses seems weep
over his country's wrongs by this face
this seeming brow justice did he win
hearts all he did angle
proceeded further cut off heads
all favourites absent king
deputation left behind him here
when he was personal irish war
hot then point
short time after lie depos'd king
soon after depriv'd him his life
neck task'd whole state
make worse suff'red his kinsman march
who if every owner were well placid
indeed his king engag'd wales
there without ransom lie forfeited
disgrac'd happy victories
rated mine uncle from council board
rage dismiss'd father from court
broke an oath oath committed wrong wrong
conclusion drove us seek out
this head safety withal pry
into his title which find
too indirect long continuance
blunt shall return this answer king
hot not so sir walter we'll withdraw awhile
some surety safe return again
morning early shall mine uncle
bring him our purposes so farewell
blunt would would accept grace love
hot may so shall
blunt pray god do

what injuries wanton time
contrarious winds held king
so long his unlucky irish wars
all england did repute him dead
from this swarm fair advantages
took occasion quickly woo'd
gripe general sway into hand
forgot oath us at doncaster

fear swallowing but nimble wing
were enforc'd safety sake fly
out sight raise this present head

as yourself have forg'd against yourself
by unkind usage dangerous countenance
violation all faith troth

face garment rebellion

this present enterprise set off his head

part may speak shame

so hear he doth account too
yet this before father's majesty

his great name estimation

try fortune him single fight
albeit considerations infinite

scene england
empty
warkworth before northumberland's castle
enter rumour painted full tongues
rumour open ears which will stop
vent hearing when loud rumour speaks
from orient drooping west
making wind post horse still unfold
acts commenced this ball earth
upon tongues continual slanders ride
which every language pronounce
speak peace while covert emnity
under smile safety wounds world
who but rumour who but only
make fearful musters prepar'd defence
whiles big year swoln some other grief
thought child by stern tyrant war
no such matter rumour pipe
blown by surmises jealousies conjectures
so easy so plain stop
still discordant wav'ring multitude
can play upon but what need thus
well known body anatomize
among household why rumour here
run before king harry's victory
who bloody field by shrewsbury
hath beaten down young hotspur his troops
quenching flame bold rebellion
even rebels' blood but what mean
noise abroad harry monmouth fell
under wrath noble hotspur's sword
king before douglas' rage
stoop'd his anointed head as low as death
this have rumour'd through peasant towns
between royal field shrewsbury
this worm eaten hold ragged stone
where hotspur's father old northumberland
lies crafty sick posts come tiring
than they have learnt from rumour's tongues
they bring smooth comforts false worse than true wrongs
empty
act scene
warkworth before northumberland's castle
enter lord bardolph

porter opens gate
where earl

he himself will answer

full high feeding madly hath broke loose
bears down all before him

bring certain news from shrewsbury

lord bardolph as good as heart can wish

fortune lord son

prisoner son o such day
so fought so followed so fairly won
came not till now dignify times
since cxsar's fortunes
northumberland how this deriv'd
saw field came from shrewsbury
lord bardolph spake one lord came from thence
freely rend'red these news true
enter travers
northumberland here comes servant travers whom sent
tuesday last listen after news
lord bardolph lord over rode him way
he furnish'd no certainties
more than he haply may retail from
northumberland now travers what good tidings comes
travers lord sir john umfrevile turnd back
out rode after him came spurring hard
gentleman almost forspent speed
stopp'd by breathe his bloodied horse
he ask'd way chester him
did demand what news from shrewsbury
he told rebellion had bad luck
young harry percy's spur was cold
he gave his able horse head
bending forward struck his armed heels
up rowel head starting so
he seem'd running devour way
staying no longer question
northumberland ha again
said he young harry percy's spur was cold
hotspur coldspur rebellion
had met ill luck
lord bardolph lord i'll tell what
if young lord son have not day
i'll give barony never talk

give then such instances loss
lord bardolph who he
he was some hilding fellow had stoln
horse he rode upon life
spoke at venture look here comes more news
enter morton
northumberland yea this mans brow title leaf
so looks strand whereon imperious flood
hath left witness'd usurpation
say morton didst thou come from shrewsbury
morton ran from shrewsbury noble lord
where hateful death put his ugliest mask
fright our party
northumberland how doth son brother
thou tremblest whiteness thy cheek
apter than thy tongue tell thy errand
so dull so dread look so woe begone
drew priam's curtain dead night
would have told him half his troy was burnt
but priam found fire ere he his tongue
percy's death ere thou report'st
this thou wouldst say 'your son did thus thus
brother thus so fought noble douglas'
stopping greedy ear their bold deeds
but end stop ear indeed
ending 'brother son all are dead'
morton douglas living brother yet
but lord son
northumberland why he dead
see what ready tongue suspicion hath
he but fears thing he would not know
hath by instinct knowledge from others' eyes
what he fear'd chanced yet speak morton
tell thou an earl his divination lies
make thee rich doing such wrong
morton are too great by gainsaid
spirit too true fears too certain
northumberland yet all this say not percy's dead
see strange confession thine eye
thou shak'st thy head hold'st fear or sin
speak truth if he slain say so
tongue offends not reports his death
he doth sin doth belie dead
yet first bringer unwelcome news
hath but losing office his tongue
sounds ever after as sullen bell
rememb'red tolling departing friend
lord bardolph cannot think lord son dead
morton am sorry should force believe
which would god had not seen
but these mine eyes saw him bloody state
rend'ring faint quittance wearied out breath'd
never daunted percy earth
from whence life he never more sprung up
few his death whose spirit lent fire
even dullest peasant his camp
being bruited once took fire heat away
from best temper'd courage his troops
from his metal was his party steeled
which once him abated an rest
turnd themselves dull heavy lead
upon enforcement flies greatest speed
so did our men heavy hotspur's loss
lend this weight such lightness their fear
arrows fled not swifter toward their aim
than did our soldiers aiming at their safety
fly from field then was noble worcester
too soon ta'en prisoner furious scot
bloody douglas whose well labouring sword
had three times slain th' appearance king
those turnd their backs his flight
stumbling fear was took sum all
king hath won hath sent out
speedy power encounter lord
under conduct young lancaster
westmoreland this news at full
northumberland this shall have time enough mourn
poison there physic these news
having been well would have made sick
as wretch whose fever weak'ned joints
strengthless hinges buckle under life
impatient his fit breaks fire
out his keeper's arms even so limbs
weak'ned grief being now enrag'd grief
are thrice themselves hence therefore thou nice crutch
scaly gauntlet now joints steel
must glove this hand hence thou sickly coif
thou art guard too wanton head
now bind brows iron approach
ragged'st hour time spite dare bring
frown upon th' enrag'd northumberland
let heaven kiss earth now let not nature's hand
keep wild flood confind let order die
let this world no longer stage
feed contention ling'ring act
but let one spirit first born cain
reign all bosoms each heart being set
darkness burier dead
lord bardolph this strained passion doth wrong lord
morton sweet earl divorce not wisdom from honour
lives all loving complices
lean health which if give o'er
stormy passion must perforce decay
cast th' event war noble lord
summ'd account chance before said
'let us make head' was pre surmise
knew he walk'd o'er perils an edge
more likely fall than get o'er
were advis'd his flesh was capable
wounds scars his forward spirit
would lift him where most trade danger rang'd
yet did say 'go forth' none this
though strongly apprehended could restrain
stiff borne action what hath then befalln
or what hath this bold enterprise brought forth
lord bardolph all are engaged this loss
knew ventured such dangerous seas
if wrought out life 'twas ten one
yet ventur'd gain propos'd
chok'd respect likely peril fear'd
since are o'erset venture again
come will put forth body goods
morton 'tis more than time most noble lord
hear certain dare speak truth
well appointed pow'rs he man
who double surety binds his followers
lord son had only but corpse
but shadows shows men fight
same word 'rebellion did divide
action their bodies from their souls
they did fight queasiness constraind
as men drink potions their weapons only
seem'd our side but their spirits souls
as fish are pond but now bishop
turns insurrection religion
suppos'd sincere holy his thoughts
he's follow'd both body mind
doth enlarge his rising blood
fair king richard scrap'd from pomfret stones
derives from heaven his quarrel his cause
tells them he doth bestride bleeding land
gasping life under great bolingbroke
northumberland knew this before but speak truth
this present grief had wip'd from mind
go counsel every man
aptest way safety revenge
get posts letters make friends speed
never so few never yet more need exeunt

scene iii
warkworth before castle
enter northumberland lady northumberland lady percy
northumberland pray thee loving wife gentle daughter
give even way unto rough affairs
put not visage times
them percy troublesome
do what will wisdom guide
northumberland alas sweet wife honour at pawn
but going nothing can redeem
lady percy o yet god's sake go not these wars
time was father broke word
when were more endear'd than now
when own percy when heart's dear harry
threw many northward look see his father
bring up his powers but he did long vain
there were two honours lost yours sons
yours god heaven brighten
his stuck upon him as sun
grey vault heaven by his light
did all chivalry england move
do brave acts he was indeed glass
wherein noble youth did dress themselves
he had no legs practis'd not his gait
speaking thick which nature made his blemish
those who could speak low tardily
would turn their own perfection abuse
seem him so speech gait
diet affections delight
military rules humours blood
he was mark glass copy book
fashiond others him o wondrous him
o miracle men him did leave
second none unseconded by
disadvantage abide field
where nothing but sound hotspur's name
did seem defensible so left him
never o never do his ghost wrong
hold honour more precise nice
others than him let them alone
marshal archbishop are strong
had sweet harry had but half their numbers
day might hanging hotspur's neck
northumberland beshrew heart
fair daughter do draw spirits from
new lamenting ancient oversights
but must go meet danger there
or will seek another place
find worse provided
lady northumberland o fly scotland
till nobles armed commons
have their puissance made little taste
then join them rib steel
make strength stronger but all our loves
first let them try themselves so did son
he was so suff'red so came widow
never shall have length life enough
rain upon remembrance mine eyes
may grow sprout as high as heaven
recordation noble husband
northumberland come come go 'tis mind
makes still stand running neither way
fain would go meet archbishop
but many thousand reasons hold back
will resolve scotland there am
till time vantage crave company exeunt

act iii scene
enter king his nightgown page
king go call earls surrey warwick
but ere they come bid them o'er read these letters
well consider them make good speed exit page
how many thousands poorest subjects
are at this hour asleep o sleep o gentle sleep
nature's soft nurse how have frightened thee
thou no more will weigh eyelids down
steep senses forgetfulness
upon uneasy pallets stretching thee
hush'd buzzing night flies thy slumber
than perfum'd chambers great
under canopies costly state
lulld sound sweetest melody
o thou dull god why liest thou vile
loathsome beds leav'st kingly couch
watch case or common 'larum bell
wilt thou upon high giddy mast
cradle rude imperious surge
visitation winds
who take ruffian billows by top
curling their monstrous heads hanging them
deafing clamour slippery clouds
hurly death itself awakes
canst thou o partial sleep give thy repose
wet sea boy an hour so rude
calmest most stillest night
deny king then happy low lie down
uneasy lies head wears crown
enter warwick surrey
warwick many good morrows majesty
king good morrow lords
warwick 'tis one o'clock past
king why then good morrow all lords
have read o'er letters sent
warwick have liege
how foul what rank diseases grow
what danger near heart
warwick but as body yet distempered
which his former strength may restored
good advice little medicine
lord northumberland will soon coold
king o god one might read book fate
see revolution times
make mountains level continent
into sea other times see
beachy girdle ocean
too wide neptune's hips how chances mock
changes fill cup alteration
divers liquors o if this were seen
happiest youth viewing his progress through
what perils past what crosses ensue
would shut book sit him down die
'tis not ten years gone
did feast together two years after
were they at wars but eight years since
this percy was man nearest soul
who brother toild affairs
laid his love life under foot
yea sake even eyes richard
gave him defiance but which was by
warwick cousin nevil as may remember
when richard his eye brim full tears
did speak these words now prov'd prophecy
'northumberland thou ladder by which
cousin bolingbroke ascends throne'
though then god knows had no such intent
but necessity so bow'd state
greatness were compelld kiss
'the time shall come' thus did he follow
'the time will come foul sin gathering head
shall break into corruption so went
division our amity
warwick there history all mens lives
figuring natures times deceas'd
which observ'd man may prophesy
near aim main chance things
as yet not come life who their seeds
weak beginning lie intreasured
such things become hatch brood time
by necessary form this
great northumberland then false him
would seed grow greater falseness
which should not find ground root upon
unless
king are these things then necessities
then let us meet them necessities
same word even now cries out us
they say bishop northumberland
are fifty thousand strong
rumour doth double voice echo
numbers feared please grace
go bed upon soul lord
powers already have sent forth
shall bring this prize very easily
comfort more have receiv'd
certain instance glendower dead
majesty hath been this fortnight ill
these unseasoned hours perforce must ad
king will take counsel
were these inward wars once out hand
would dear lords unto holy land exeunt

act iv scene
yorkshire within forest gaultree
enter archbishop york mowbray hastings others
archbishop what this forest calld
hastings 'tis gaultree forest ant shall please grace
archbishop here stand lords send discoverers forth
hastings have sent forth already
archbishop 'tis well done
friends brethren these great affairs
must acquaint have receiv'd
new dated letters from northumberland
their cold intent tenour substance thus
here doth he wish his person such powers
as might hold sortance his quality
which he could not levy whereupon
scotland concludes hearty prayers
attempts may overlive hazard
fearful meeting their opposite
mowbray thus do hopes have him touch ground
dash themselves pieces
enter messenger
hastings now what news
messenger west this forest scarcely off mile
goodly form comes enemy
upon or near rate thirty thousand
mowbray just proportion gave them out
let us sway face them field
enter westmoreland
archbishop what well appointed leader fronts us here
mowbray think lord westmoreland
westmoreland health fair greeting from our general
prince lord john duke lancaster
archbishop say lord westmoreland peace
westmoreland then lord
unto grace do chief address
substance speech if rebellion
came itself base abject routs
led by bloody youth guarded rags
countenanc'd by boys beggary
say if damnd commotion so appear'd
his true native most proper shape
reverend father these noble lords
base bloody insurrection
fair honours lord archbishop
whose see by civil peace maintaind
whose beard silver hand peace hath touch'd
whose learning good letters peace hath tutor'd
whose white investments figure innocence
dove very blessed spirit peace
wherefore do so ill translate yourself
out speech peace bears such grace
turning books graves ink blood
pens lances tongue divine
loud trumpet point war
archbishop wherefore do this so question stands
briefly this end are all diseas'd
our surfeiting wanton hours
have brought ourselves into burning fever
must bleed which disease
our late king richard being infected died
take not here as physician
nor do as an enemy peace
troop throngs military men
but rather show awhile fearful war
diet rank minds sick happiness
purge th' obstructions which begin stop
our very veins life hear more plainly
have equal balance justly weigh'd
what wrongs our arms may do what wrongs suffer
see which way stream time doth run
are enforc'd from our most quiet there
by rough torrent occasion
have summary all our griefs
when time shall serve show articles
which long ere this offer'd king
might by no suit gain our audience
when are wrong'd would unfold our griefs
are denied access unto his person
dangers days but newly gone
whose memory written earth
yet appearing blood examples
every minute's instance present now
hath put us these ill beseeming arms
not break peace or any branch
but establish here peace indeed
concurring both name quality
westmoreland when ever yet was appeal denied

their neighing coursers daring spur

therefore will he wipe his tables clean

chief justice am assur'd if measur'd rightly
majesty hath no just cause hate
king no
how might prince great hopes forget
what rate rebuke roughly send prison
th' immediate heir england was this easy
may this wash'd lethe forgotten
chief justice then did use person father
image his power lay then
th' administration his law
whiles was busy commonwealth
highness pleased forget place
majesty power law justice
struck very seat judgment
whereon as an offender father
gave bold way authority
did commit if deed were ill
contented wearing now garland
have son set decrees at nought
pluck down justice from awful bench
trip course law blunt sword
guards peace safety person
mock workings second body
question royal thoughts make case yours
now father propose son
hear own dignity so much profand
see most dreadful laws so loosely slighted
behold yourself so by son disdaind
then imagine taking part
power soft silencing son
after this cold considerance sentence
what have done misbecame place
person or liege's sovereignty
king are right justice weigh this well
therefore still bear balance sword
do wish honours may increase
till do live see son mine
offend obey as did
so shall live speak father's words
'happy am have man so bold
not less happy having such son
would deliver up his greatness so
into hands justice' did commit
which do commit into hand
th' unstained sword have us'd bear
this remembrance use same
bold just impartial spirit
as have done 'gainst there hand
shall as father youth
will stoop humble intents
well practis'd wise directions
princes all believe beseech
father gone wild into his grave
his tomb lie affections
his spirits sadly survive
mock expectation world
frustrate prophecies raze out
rotten opinion who hath writ down
hath proudly flow'd vanity till now
now doth turn ebb back sea
where shall mingle state floods
flow henceforth formal majesty
now call our high court parliament
let us choose such limbs noble counsel
great body our state may go
equal rank best governd nation
war or peace or both at once may
which father shall have foremost hand
our coronation done will accite
as before rememb'red all our state
god consigning good intents
no prince nor peer shall have just cause say
god shorten harry's happy life one day exeunt

enter chorus
brightest heaven invention
kingdom stage princes act
monarchs behold swelling scene
then should warlike harry himself
assume port mars at his heels

crouch employment but pardon gentles all
flat unraised spirits hath dar'd
this unworthy scaffold bring forth
vasty fields france or may cram
within this wooden o very casques
did affright air at agincourt
o pardon since crooked figure may
attest little place million
let us ciphers this great accompt
imaginary forces work
suppose within girdle these walls
are now confind two mighty monarchies
perilous narrow ocean parts asunder
piece out our imperfections thoughts
into thousand parts divide one man
make imaginary puissance
think when talk horses see them
