which commission thy years art
not so long speak long die
if what thou speak'st speak not remedy

as desperate which would prevent
if rather than marry county paris

thing death chide away this shame
if thou dar'st i'll give thee remedy
jul o bid leap rather than marry paris
from off battlements yonder tower
or walk thievish ways or bid lurk
where serpents are chain roaring bears
or shut nightly charnel house
o'ercover'd quite dead mens rattling bones
reeky shanks yellow chapless skulls
or bid go into new made grave
things hear them told have made tremble
will do without fear or doubt
live an unstaind wife sweet love
friar hold then go home merry give consent
marry paris wednesday morrow
morrow night look thou lie alone
let not nurse lie thee thy chamber
take thou this vial being then bed
this distilled liquor drink thou off
cold drowsy humour no pulse
shall keep his native progress but surcease
no warmth no breath shall testify thou livest
roses thy lips cheeks shall fade
paly ashes thy eyes' windows fall
death when he shuts up day life
each part depriv'd supple government
shall stiff stark cold appear death
this borrowed likeness shrunk death
then awake as from pleasant sleep
now when bridegroom morning comes
rouse thee from thy bed there art thou dead
then as manner our country
thy best robes uncovered bier
thou shalt borne same ancient vault
where all kindred capulets lie
mean time against thou shalt awake
shall romeo by letters know our drift
will watch thy waking very night
shall romeo bear thee hence mantua
this shall free thee from this present shame
if no inconstant toy nor womanish fear
abate thy valour acting
jul give give o tell not fear

act v scene
mantua street
enter romeo
rom if may trust flattering truth sleep
bosom's lord sits lightly his throne
all this day an unaccustom'd spirit

dreamt lady came found dead
strange dream gives dead man leave think
breath'd such life kisses lips
reviv'd was an emperor
ah how sweet love itself possess'd
when but love's shadows are so rich joy
news from verona how now balthasar
dost thou not bring letters from friar
how doth lady father well
how fares juliet ask again
nothing can ill if she well
man then she well nothing can ill
her body sleeps capels monument
her immortal part angels lives

o pardon bringing these ill news
since did leave office sir

thou knowest lodging get ink paper
hire posthorses will hence night

some misadventure
rom tush thou art deceiv'd

man no good lord
rom no matter get thee gone

exit balthasar
well juliet will lie thee night
let's see means o mischief thou art swift
enter thoughts desperate men
do remember an apothecary
tatt'red weeds overwhelming brows
culling simples meagre were his looks
sharp misery had worn him bones
his needy shop tortoise hung
an alligator stuff'd other skins
ill shaped fishes about his shelves
beggarly account empty boxes
green earthen pots bladders musty seeds
remnants packthread old cakes roses
noting this penury myself said
'an if man did need poison now
whose sale present death mantua
here lives caitiff wretch would sell him'
o this same thought did but forerun need
this same needy man must sell
as remember this should house
being holiday beggar's shop shut what ho apothecary
enter apothecary
rom come hither man see thou art poor
hold there forty ducats let have
dram poison such soon speeding gear
as will disperse itself through all veins
life weary taker mall fall dead
trunk may discharg'd breath
as violently as hasty powder fir'd
doth hurry from fatal cannons womb
apoth such mortal drugs have but mantua's law
rom art thou so bare full wretchedness
fearest die famine thy cheeks
need oppression starveth thine eyes
contempt beggary hangs upon thy back
world not thy friend nor world's law
world affords no law make thee rich
then not poor but break take this
apoth poverty but not will consents
rom pay thy poverty not thy will
drink off if had strength
twenty men would dispatch straight
rom there thy gold worse poison mens souls
doing more murther this loathsome world
than these poor compounds thou mayst not sell
sell thee poison thou hast sold none
farewell buy food get thyself flesh
come cordial not poison go
juliet's grave there must use thee

where infectious pestilence did reign
seald up doors would not let us forth
so speed mantua there was stay'd

dear import neglecting
may do much danger friar john go hence

scene iii
verona churchyard monument capulets
enter paris his page flowers torch
par give thy torch boy hence stand aloof
yet put out would not seen
holding thine ear close hollow ground
so shall no foot upon churchyard tread
being loose unfirm digging up graves
but thou shalt hear whistle then
as signal thou hear'st something approach
give those flowers do as bid thee go
page aside am almost afraid stand alone
here churchyard yet will adventure retires
par sweet flower flowers thy bridal bed strew
which sweet water nightly will dew
or wanting tears distilld by moans
obsequies thee will keep
nightly shall strew thy grave weep
whistle boy
boy gives warning something doth approach
what cursed foot wanders this way night
cross obsequies true love's rite
what torch muffle night awhile retires
crow iron
rom give mattock wrenching iron
hold take this letter early morning
see thou deliver lord father
give light upon thy life charge thee
whate'er thou hearest or seest stand all aloof
do not interrupt course
why descend into this bed death
partly behold lady's face
precious ring ring must use
dear employment therefore hence gone
but if thou jealous dost return pry
what farther shall intend do
by heaven will tear thee joint by joint
strew this hungry churchyard thy limbs
time intents are savage wild
more fierce more inexorable far
than empty tigers or roaring sea
rom so shalt thou show friendship take thou
live prosperous farewell good fellow
bal aside all this same i'll hide hereabout
his looks fear his intents doubt retires
rom thou detestable maw thou womb death
gorg'd dearest morsel earth
thus enforce thy rotten jaws open
despite i'll cram thee more food
romeo opens tomb
murd'red love's cousin which grief
supposed fair creature died
here come do some villanous shame
dead bodies will apprehend him
stop thy unhallowed toil vile montague
can vengeance pursu'd further than death
condemned villain do apprehend thee
obey go thou must die
rom must indeed therefore came hither
fly hence leave think upon these gone
let them affright thee beseech thee youth
but not another sin upon head
by urging fury o gone
by heaven love thee better than myself
come hither arm'd against myself
stay not gone live hereafter say
madmans mercy bid thee run away
par do defy thy conjuration
rom wilt thou provoke then have at thee boy
they fight
page o lord they fight will go call watch
exit paris falls
par o am slain if thou merciful
open tomb lay juliet dies
rom faith will let peruse this face
mercutio's kinsman noble county paris
what said man when betossed soul
he told paris should have married juliet
said he not so or did dream so
or am mad hearing him talk juliet
think was so o give thy hand
one writ sour misfortune's book
i'll bury thee triumphant grave
grave o no lanthorn slaught'red youth
here lies juliet her beauty makes
this vault feasting presence full light
lays him tomb
how oft when men are at point death
have they been merry which their keepers call
lightning before death o how may
call this lightning o love wife
death hath suck'd honey thy breath
hath had no power yet upon thy beauty
thou art not conquer'd beauty's ensign yet
crimson thy lips thy cheeks
tybalt liest thou there thy bloody sheet
o what more favour can do thee
than hand cut thy youth twain
sunder his was thine enemy
forgive cousin' ah dear juliet
why art thou yet so fair shall believe
unsubstantial death amorous
lean abhorred monster keeps
thee here dark his paramour
never from this palace dim night
depart again here here will remain
worms are thy chambermaids o here
will set up everlasting rest
shake yoke inauspicious stars
from this world wearied flesh eyes look last
arms take last embrace lips o
doors breath seal righteous kiss
dateless bargain engrossing death
thou desperate pilot now at once run
dashing rocks thy seasick weary bark
here's love drinks o true apothecary
thy drugs are quick thus kiss die falls

what mean these masterless gory swords
lie discolour'd by this place peace enters tomb

death contagion unnatural sleep
greater power than can contradict
hath thwarted our intents come come away

among sisterhood holy nuns

what's here cup clos'd true love's hand
poison see hath been his timeless end
o churl drunk all left no friendly drop

see ground whereon these woes do lie

enter montague others
prince come montague thou art early up
mon alas liege wife dead night
grief sons exile hath stopp'd her breath
what further woe conspires against mine age
prince look thou shalt see
mon o thou untaught what manners this
press before thy father grave
prince seal up mouth outrage while
till can clear these ambiguities
know their spring their head their true descent
lead even death meantime forbear
let mischance slave patience
bring forth parties suspicion
friar am greatest able do least
yet most suspected as time place
doth make against this direful murther
here stand both impeach purge
myself condemned myself excus'd
prince then say once what thou dost know this
not so long as tedious tale
romeo there dead was husband juliet
she there dead romeo's faithful wife
married them their stoln marriage day
was tybalt's doomsday whose untimely death
banish'd new made bridegroom from this city
whom not tybalt juliet pind
remove siege grief from her
betroth'd would have married her perforce
wild looks bid devise some mean
rid her from this second marriage
or cell there would she kill herself
then gave her so tutored by art
sleeping potion which so took effect
as intended wrought her
form death meantime writ romeo
he should hither come as this dire night
help take her from her borrowed grave
but he which bore letter friar john
was stay'd by accident yesternight
returnd letter back then all alone
at prefixed hour her waking
came take her from her kindred's vault
meaning keep her closely at cell
till conveniently could send romeo
but when came some minute ere time
her awaking here untimely lay
she wakes entreated her come forth
bear this work heaven patience
but then noise did scare from tomb
she too desperate would not go
but as seems did violence herself
all this know marriage
her nurse privy if aught this
miscarried by fault let old life
sacrific'd some hour before his time
prince still have known thee holy man
where's romeo's man what can he say this
bal brought master news juliet's death
then post he came from mantua
this same place this same monument
this letter he early bid give his father
threat'ned death going vault
if departed not left him there
prince give letter will look
sirrah what made master this place
boy he came flowers strew his lady's grave
bid stand aloof so did
anon comes one light ope tomb
by by master drew him
then ran away call watch
prince this letter doth make good friar's words
their course love tidings her death
here he writes he did buy poison
came this vault die lie juliet
where these enemies capulet montage
see what scourge laid upon hate
heaven finds means kill joys love
winking at discords too
have lost brace kinsmen all are punish'd
cap o brother montague give thy hand
this daughter's jointure no more
can demand
will raise her statue pure gold
whiles verona by name known
there shall no figure at such rate set
as true faithful juliet
cap as rich shall romeo's by his lady's lie
poor sacrifices our enmity
prince glooming peace this morning brings
sun sorrow will not show his head
go hence have more talk these sad things
never was story more woe
than this juliet her romeo
exeunt omnes

brach merriman poor cur emboss'd
couple clowder deep mouth'd brach
at hedge corner coldest fault
would not lose dog twenty pound
first huntsman why belman as good as he lord
he cried upon at merest loss
twice day pick'd out dullest scent
trust take him better dog
lord thou art fool if echo were as fleet
would esteem him worth dozen such
but sup them well look unto them all
first huntsman will lord
lord what's here one dead or drunk
see doth he breathe

this were bed but cold sleep so soundly
lord o monstrous beast how swine he lies
grim death how foul loathsome thine image
sirs will practise this drunken man
what think if he were convey'd bed
most delicious banquet by his bed
brave attendants near him when he wakes
would not beggar then forget himself
first huntsman believe lord think he cannot choose
second huntsman would seem strange unto him when he wak'd
lord even as flatt'ring dream or worthless fancy
then take him up manage well jest
carry him gently fairest chamber
hang round all wanton pictures
burn sweet wood make lodging sweet
procure music ready when he wakes
make dulcet heavenly sound
if he chance speak ready straight
low submissive reverence
say 'what honour will command'
let one attend him silver basin
full rose water bestrew'd flowers
another bear ewer third diaper
some one ready costly suit

another tell him his hounds horse
his lady mourns at his disease
persuade him he hath been lunatic
when he says he say he dreams
he nothing but mighty lord
this do do kindly gentle sirs
will pastime passing excellent
first huntsman lord warrant will play our part
as he shall think by our true diligence
he no less than what say he
lord take him up gently bed him
each one his office when he wakes

now fellows are welcome

lord do intend stay night
lord all heart this fellow remember
since once he play'd farmer's eldest son
'twas where woo'd gentlewoman so well
have forgot name but sure part
was aptly fitted naturally perform'd
player think 'twas soto honour means
lord 'tis very true thou didst excellent
well are come happy time
rather have some sport hand
there lord will hear play night
but am doubtful modesties
lest over eying his odd behaviour
yet his honour never heard play
break into some merry passion
so offend him tell sirs
if should smile he grows impatient
player fear not lord can contain ourselves
were he veriest antic world
give them friendly welcome every one

sirrah go bartholomew page
see him dress'd all suits lady
done conduct him drunkard's chamber
call him 'madam' do him obeisance
tell him from as he will win love
he bear himself honourable action
unto their lords by them accomplished
such duty drunkard let him do
soft low tongue lowly courtesy
say 'what is't honour will command
wherein lady humble wife
may show her duty make known her love'
then kind embracements tempting kisses
declining head into his bosom
bid him shed tears as being overjoyed
who this seven years hath esteemed him
no better than poor loathsome beggar
if boy have not womans gift
rain shower commanded tears
an onion will do well such shift
which napkin being close convey'd
shall despite enforce watery eye
see this dispatch'd all haste thou canst
anon i'll give thee more instructions exit servingman
voice gait action gentlewoman
long hear him call drunkard 'husband'
how men will stay themselves from laughter
when they do homage this simple peasant
i'll counsel them haply presence
may well abate over merry spleen
which otherwise would grow into extremes exeunt

scene ii
enter aloft sly attendants some apparel basin

sly god's sake pot small ale

third servant what raiment will honour wear day
sly am christophero sly call not 'honour' nor 'lordship'
ne'er drank sack life if give any conserves
give conserves beef ne'er ask what raiment i'll wear
legs nor no more shoes than feet nay sometime more feet than
shoes or such shoes as toes look through overleather
lord heaven cease this idle humour honour
o mighty man such descent
such possessions so high esteem
should infused so foul spirit
sly what would make mad am not christopher sly old

cardmaker by transmutation bear herd now by present

third servant o this makes lady mourn
second servant o this makes servants droop
lord hence comes kindred shuns house
as beaten hence by strange lunacy
o noble lord bethink thee thy birth
banish hence these abject lowly dreams
look how thy servants do attend thee
each his office ready at thy beck
wilt thou have music hark apollo plays music
twenty caged nightingales do sing
or wilt thou sleep we'll have thee couch
softer sweeter than lustful bed
purpose trimm'd up semiramis
say thou wilt walk will bestrew ground
their harness studded all gold pearl
dost thou love hawking thou hast hawks will soar
above morning lark or wilt thou hunt
thy hounds shall make welkin answer them
fetch shall echoes from hollow earth
first servant say thou wilt course thy greyhounds are as swift
as breathed stags ay fleeter than roe
second servant dost thou love pictures will fetch thee
empty
cytherea all sedges hid
which seem move wanton her breath
even as waving sedges play wi' th' wind
lord we'll show thee lo as she was maid
how she was beguiled surpris'd
as lively painted as deed was done
third servant or daphne roaming through thorny wood
scratching her legs one shall swear she bleeds
at sight shall sad apollo weep
lord thou art lord nothing but lord
thou hast lady far more beautiful
than any woman this waning age
first servant till tears she hath shed thee
envious floods o'er run her lovely face
she was fairest creature world
yet she inferior none
sly am lord have such lady
or do dream or have dream'd till now
smell sweet savours feel soft things
upon life am lord indeed
not tinker nor christopher sly
well bring our lady hither our sight
once again pot o' th' smallest ale
second servant willt please mightiness wash hands
o how joy see wit restor'd
o once more knew but what are
these fifteen years have been dream
sly these fifteen years by fay goodly nap
but did never speak all time
first servant o yes lord but very idle words
though lay here this goodly chamber
yet would say ye were beaten out door
rail upon hostess house
say would present her at leet
because she brought stone jugs no seald quarts
sometimes would call out cicely hacket

nor no such men as have reckond up
as stephen sly old john naps greece
peter turph henry pimpernell
twenty more such names men as these
which never were nor no man ever saw
sly now lord thanked good amends
all amen

where wife

sly are wife will not call husband

page husband lord lord husband

sly know well what must call her
sly alce madam or joan madam
lord madam nothing else so lords call ladies
sly madam wife they say have dream'd
slept above some fifteen year or more
page ay time seems thirty unto
being all this time abandond from bed
sly 'tis much servants leave her alone

madam undress come now bed
pardon yet night or two
or if not so until sun set
physicians have expressly charg'd
peril incur former malady
should yet absent from bed
hope this reason stands excuse
sly ay stands so may hardly tarry so long but would

despite flesh blood

are come play pleasant comedy
so doctors hold very meet

melancholy nurse frenzy

frame mind mirth merriment
which bars thousand harms lengthens life

see fair padua nursery arts

shall become serve all hopes conceiv'd

therefore tranio time study
virtue part philosophy
will apply treats happiness
tell thy mind have pisa left

shallow plash plunge him deep

am all affected as yourself
glad thus continue resolve
suck sweets sweet philosophy
only good master while do admire
let's no stoics nor no stocks pray
or so devote aristotle's checks
as ovid an outcast quite abjur'd

rest will comfort thy counsels sound

perhaps mark'd not what's pith all

such as daughter agenor had
made great jove humble him her hand
when his knees he kiss'd cretan strand
tranio saw no more mark'd not how her sister
mortal ears might hardly endure din
lucentio tranio saw her coral lips move
her breath she did perfume air
sacred sweet was all saw her
tranio nay then 'tis time stir him from his trance

bend thoughts wits achieve her thus stands
her elder sister so curst shrewd
till father rid his hands her
therefore has he closely mew'd her up
because she will not annoy'd suitors

nor can distinguish'd by our faces

scene ii
padua before hortensio's house
petruchio verona while take leave
see friends padua but all
best beloved approved friend
hortensio trow this his house
here sirrah grumio knock say
grumio knock sir whom should knock
there any man has rebus'd worship
petruchio villain say knock here soundly
grumio knock here sir why sir what am sir
petruchio villain say knock at this gate
rap well or i'll knock knave's pate
grumio master grown quarrelsome should knock first
then know after who comes by worst
petruchio will not
faith sirrah an you'll not knock i'll ring
i'll try how can sol fa sing
he wrings him by ears
grumio help masters help master mad
enter hortensio
hortensio how now what's matter old friend grumio
good friend petruchio how do all at verona
petruchio signior hortensio come part fray
'con tutto il cuore ben trovato' may say
hortensio alla nostra casa ben venuto
molto honorato signor mio petruchio
rise grumio rise will compound this quarrel
grumio nay 'tis no matter sir what he 'leges latin if this
he bid knock him rap him soundly sir well was fit
servant use his master so being perhaps aught
see two thirty pip out
whom would god had well knock'd at first
then had not grumio come by worst
petruchio senseless villain good hortensio
bade rascal knock upon gate
could not get him heart do
grumio knock at gate o heavens spake not these words
knock soundly' come now 'knocking at gate'
petruchio sirrah gone or talk not advise
hortensio petruchio patience am grumio's pledge
why this's heavy chance 'twixt him
ancient trusty pleasant servant grumio
tell now sweet friend what happy gale
blows padua here from old verona
petruchio such wind as scatters young men through world
seek their fortunes farther than at home
signior hortensio thus stands
antonio father deceas'd
have thrust myself into this maze
haply wive thrive as best may
crowns purse have goods at home
so am come abroad see world
hortensio petruchio shall then come roundly thee
wish thee shrewd ill favour'd wife
thou'dst thank but little counsel
very rich but th'art too much friend
i'll not wish thee her
petruchio signior hortensio 'twixt such friends as
few words suffice therefore if thou know
one rich enough petruchio's wife
as wealth burden wooing dance
she as foul as was florentius' love
as old as sibyl as curst shrewd
as socrates' xanthippe or worse
affections edge were she as rough
as are swelling adriatic seas
come wive wealthily padua
if wealthily then happily padua
grumio nay look sir he tells flatly what his mind
why give him gold enough marry him puppet or an
aglet baby or an old trot ne'er tooth her head though
she has as many diseases as two fifty horses why nothing
comes amiss so money comes withal
will continue broach'd jest
can petruchio help thee wife
wealth enough young beauteous
brought up as best becomes gentlewoman
her only fault faults enough
she intolerable curst
shrewd froward so beyond all measure
were state far worser than
would not wed her mine gold
tell her father's name 'tis enough
will board her though she chide as loud
as thunder when clouds autumn crack
hortensio her father baptista minola
an affable courteous gentleman
her name katherina minola
renownd padua her scolding tongue
petruchio know her father though know not her
he knew deceased father well
therefore let thus bold
give over at this first encounter
unless will accompany thither
grumio pray sir let him go while humour lasts o'
word she knew him as well as do she would think scolding
would do little good upon him she may perhaps call him half
score knaves or so why that's nothing he begin once he'll
rail his rope tricks i'll tell what sir an she stand
him but little he will throw figure her face so
withal than cat know him not sir
hortensio tarry petruchio must go thee
baptista's keep treasure
he hath jewel life hold
his youngest daughter beautiful bianca
her withholds from other more
suitors her rivals love
supposing thing impossible
those defects have before rehears'd
therefore this order hath baptista ta'en
none shall have access unto bianca
till katherine curst have got husband
grumio katherine curst
title maid all titles worst
hortensio now shall friend petruchio do grace
offer disguis'd sober robes
old baptista as schoolmaster
well seen music instruct bianca
have leave leisure make love her
unsuspected court her by herself
enter gremio lucentio disguised as cambio
grumio here's no knavery see beguile old folks how
young folks lay their heads together master master look about
who goes there ha
hortensio peace grumio rival love petruchio
stand by awhile
grumio proper stripling an amorous
gremio o very well have perus'd note
hark sir i'll have them very fairly bound
all books love see at any hand
see read no other lectures her
understand over beside
signior baptista's liberality
i'll mend largess take paper too
let have them very well perfum'd
she sweeter than perfume itself
lucentio whate'er read her i'll plead
as patron stand so assur'd
as firmly as yourself were still place
yea perhaps more successful words
than unless were scholar sir
gremio o this learning what thing
grumio o this woodcock what an ass
petruchio peace sirrah
hortensio grumio mum coming forward
gremio are well met signior hortensio
trow whither am going baptista minola
promis'd enquire carefully
about schoolmaster fair bianca
by good fortune have lighted well
this young man learning behaviour
fit her turn well read poetry
other books good ones warrant ye
hortensio 'tis well have met gentleman
fine musician instruct our mistress
so shall no whit behind duty
fair bianca so beloved
gremio beloved deeds shall prove
grumio his bags shall prove
hortensio gremio 'tis now no time vent our love
listen if speak fair
i'll tell news indifferent good either
here gentleman whom by chance met
will undertake woo curst katherine
yea marry her if her dowry please
gremio so said so done well
hortensio have told him all her faults
petruchio know she an irksome brawling scold
if all masters hear no harm
gremio no say'st so friend what countryman
petruchio born verona old antonio's son
father dead fortune lives
gremio o sir such life such wife were strange
but if have stomach to't god's name
shall have assisting all
but will woo this wild cat
petruchio will live
grumio will he woo her ay or i'll hang her
petruchio why came hither but intent
think little din can daunt mine ears
have not time heard lions roar
rage an angry boar chafed sweat
have not heard great ordnance field
heavens artillery thunder skies
have not pitched battle heard
loud 'larums neighing steeds trumpets' clang
do tell womans tongue
gives not half so great blow hear
as will chestnut fariner's fire
tush tush fear boys bugs
gremio hortensio hark
this gentleman happily arriv'd
mind presumes his own good ours
hortensio promis'd would contributors
bear his charge wooing whatsoe'er
gremio so will provided he win her
grumio would were as sure good dinner
enter tranio bravely apparelled as lucentio biondello
tranio gentlemen god save if may bold
house signior baptista minola
biondello he has two fair daughters is't he mean
tranio even he biondello
gremio hark sir mean not her
tranio perhaps him her sir what have do
petruchio not her chides sir at any hand pray
tranio love no chiders sir biondello let's away
lucentio aside well begun tranio
hortensio sir word ere go
tranio if sir any offence
gremio no if without more words will get hence
tranio why sir pray are not streets as free
as
gremio but so not she
tranio what reason beseech
gremio this reason if you'll know
she's choice love signior gremio
hortensio she's chosen signior hortensio
do this right hear patience
baptista noble gentleman
whom father not all unknown
were his daughter fairer than she
she may more suitors have one
fair leda's daughter had thousand wooers
then well one more may fair bianca have
so she shall lucentio shall make one
though paris came hope speed alone
lucentio sir give him head know he'll prove jade
petruchio hortensio what end are all these words
hortensio sir let so bold as ask
did yet ever see baptista's daughter
tranio no sir but hear do he hath two
one as famous scolding tongue
as other beauteous modesty
petruchio sir sir first's let her go by
gremio yea leave labour great hercules
petruchio sir understand this sooth
youngest daughter whom hearken
her father keeps from all access suitors
will not promise her any man
until elder sister first wed
younger then free not before
tranio if so sir are man
must stead us all amongst rest
if break ice do this feat
our access whose hap shall have her
will not so graceless ingrate
hortensio sir say well well do conceive
since do profess suitor
must as do gratify this gentleman
whom all rest generally beholding
tranio sir shall not slack sign whereof
please ye may contrive this afternoon
quaff carouses our mistress' health
strive mightily but eat drink as friends
grumio biondello o excellent motion fellows let's gone
hortensio motions good indeed so
petruchio shall ben venuto exeunt
act il scene
padua baptista's house
enter katherina bianca
bianca good sister wrong not nor wrong yourself
make bondmaid slave
unbind hands i'll pull them off myself
yea all raiment petticoat
or what will command will do
so well know duty elders
katherina all thy suitors here charge thee tell
whom thou lov'st best see thou dissemble not
bianca believe sister all men alive
never yet beheld special face
which could fancy more than any other
bianca if affect him sister here swear
i'll plead myself but shall have him
katherina o then belike fancy riches more
will have gremio keep fair
bianca him do envy so
nay then jest now well perceive
have but jested all this while
prithee sister kate untie hands
katherina strikes her if jest then an rest was so
baptista why how now dame whence grows this insolence
bianca stand aside poor girl she weeps
he unbinds her
go ply thy needle meddle not her
shame thou hilding devilish spirit
why dost thou wrong her did ne'er wrong thee
when did she cross thee bitter word
katherina her silence flouts i'll reveng'd
flies after bianca
exit bianca
katherina what will not suffer nay now see
she treasure she must have husband
must dance bare foot her wedding day
love her lead apes hell
talk not will go sit weep
till can find occasion revenge exit katherina
baptista was ever gentleman thus griev'd as
but who comes here
petruchio hortensio as musician tranio
as lucentio his boy biondello bearing lute books
gremio good morrow neighbour baptista
baptista good morrow neighbour gremio
god save gentlemen
petruchio good sir pray have not daughter
calld katherina fair virtuous
baptista have daughter sir calld katherina
gremio are too blunt go orderly
am gentleman verona sir
hearing her beauty her wit
her affability bashful modesty
her wondrous qualities mild behaviour
am bold show myself forward guest
within house make mine eye witness
report which so oft have heard
an entrance entertainment
do present man mine
cunning music mathematics
instruct her fully those sciences
whereof know she not ignorant
accept him or else do wrong
his name licio born mantua
baptista y'are welcome sir he good sake
but daughter katherine this know
she not turn more grief
petruchio see do not mean part her
baptista mistake not speak but as find
whence are sir what may call name
petruchio petruchio name antonio's son
man well known throughout all italy
baptista know him well are welcome his sake
gremio saving tale petruchio pray
let us are poor petitioners speak too
bacare are marvellous forward
petruchio o pardon signior gremio would fain doing
neighbour this gift very grateful am sure
express kindness myself have been more kindly
beholding than any freely give unto this young
scholar presenting lucentio hath been long studying at
rheims as cunning greek latin other languages as
other music mathematics his name cambio pray accept
his service
baptista thousand thanks signior gremio welcome good cambio
tranio but gentle sir methinks walk stranger
tranio pardon sir boldness mine own
being stranger this city here
do make myself suitor daughter
unto bianca fair virtuous
nor firm resolve unknown
preferment eldest sister
this liberty all request
upon knowledge parentage
may have welcome 'mongst rest woo
toward education daughters
here bestow simple instrument
this small packet greek latin books
if accept them then their worth great
baptista lucentio name whence pray
tranio pisa sir son vincentio
baptista mighty man pisa by report
know him well are very welcome sir
take lute set books
holla within
enter servant
sirrah lead these gentlemen
daughters tell them both
these are their tutors bid them use them well
exit servant leading hortensio carrying lute
lucentio books
will go walk little orchard
then dinner are passing welcome
petruchio signior baptista business asketh haste
every day cannot come woo
knew father well him
left solely heir all his lands goods
which have bettered rather than decreas'd
then tell if get daughter's love
what dowry shall have her wife
baptista after death one half lands
possession twenty thousand crowns
her widowhood she survive
all lands leases whatsoever
let specialities therefore drawn between us
covenants may kept either hand
baptista ay when special thing well obtaind
her love all all
petruchio why nothing tell father
am as peremptory as she proud minded
where two raging fires meet together
though little fire grows great little wind
yet extreme gusts will blow out fire all
so her so she yields
am rough woo not babe
baptista well mayst thou woo happy thy speed
but thou arm'd some unhappy words
petruchio ay proof as mountains are winds
shake not though they blow perpetually
re enter hortensio his head broke
hortensio fear promise if look pale
baptista what will daughter prove good musician
hortensio think she'll sooner prove soldier
iron may hold her but never lutes
baptista why then thou canst not break her lute
hortensio why no she hath broke lute
did but tell her she mistook her frets
bow'd her hand teach her fingering
when most impatient devilish spirit
word she struck head
through instrument pate made way
there stood amazed while
as pillory looking through lute
while she did call rascal fiddler
twangling jack twenty such vile terms
as she had studied misuse so
petruchio now by world lusty wench
love her ten times more than e'er did
baptista well go not so discomfited
proceed practice younger daughter
she's apt learn thankful good turns
signior petruchio will go us
or shall send daughter kate
petruchio pray do exeunt all but petruchio
i'll attend her here
woo her some spirit when she comes
say she rail why then i'll tell her plain
say she frown i'll say she looks as clear
as morning roses newly wash'd dew
say she mute will not speak word
then i'll commend her volubility
say she uttereth piercing eloquence
if she do bid pack i'll give her thanks
as though she bid stay by her week
if she deny wed i'll crave day
when shall ask banns when married
enter katherina
good morrow kate that's name hear
katherina well have heard but something hard hearing
they call katherine do talk
petruchio lie faith are calld plain kate
bonny kate sometimes kate curst
but kate prettiest kate christendom
kate kate hall super dainty kate
dainties are all kates therefore kate
hearing thy mildness prais'd every town
thy virtues spoke thy beauty sounded
yet not so deeply as thee belongs
myself am mov'd woo thee wife
katherina mov'd good time let him mov'd hither
remove hence knew at first
were moveable
petruchio why what's moveable
katherina joind stool
katherina asses are made bear so are
petruchio women are made bear so are
katherina no such jade as if mean
petruchio alas good kate will not burden thee
knowing thee but young light
katherina too light such swain as catch
yet as heavy as weight should
petruchio should should buzz
katherina well ta'en buzzard
katherina ay turtle as he takes buzzard
petruchio come come wasp i' faith are too angry
katherina if waspish best beware sting
petruchio remedy then pluck out
katherina ay if fool could find where lies
petruchio who knows not where wasp does wear his sting
his tail
katherina his tongue
petruchio whose tongue
petruchio what tongue tail nay come again
good kate am gentleman
katherina i'll try she strikes him
petruchio swear i'll cuff if strike again
katherina so may lose arms
if strike are no gentleman
if no gentleman why then no arms
petruchio herald kate o put thy books
katherina what crest coxcomb
katherina no cock mine crow too craven
petruchio nay come kate come must not look so sour
katherina fashion when see crab
petruchio why here's no crab therefore look not sour
katherina there there
petruchio then show
katherina had glass would
petruchio what mean face
katherina well aim'd such young one
katherina yet are wither'd
petruchio 'tis cares
katherina care not
petruchio nay hear kate sooth scape not so
katherina chafe if tarry let go
petruchio no not whit find passing gentle
'twas told were rough coy sullen
now find report very liar
thou art pleasant gamesome passing courteous
thou canst not frown thou canst not look askance
nor bite lip as angry wenches will
nor hast thou pleasure cross talk
but thou mildness entertainst thy wooers
gentle conference soft affable
why does world report kate doth limp
o sland'rous world kate hazel twig
straight slender as brown hue
as hazel nuts sweeter than kernels
katherina go fool whom thou keep'st command
petruchio did ever dian so become grove
as kate this chamber her princely gait
o thou dian let her kate
then let kate chaste dian sportful
katherina where did study all this goodly speech
petruchio extempore from mother wit
katherina witty mother witless else her son
petruchio am not wise
petruchio marry so mean sweet katherine thy bed
therefore setting all this chat aside
thus plain terms father hath consented
shall wife dowry greed
will nill will marry
now kate am husband turn
by this light whereby see thy beauty
thy beauty doth make thee well
thou must married no man but
bring from wild kate kate
conformable as other household kates
re enter baptista gremio tranio
here comes father never make denial
must will have katherine wife
baptista now signior petruchio how speed daughter
petruchio how but well sir how but well
were impossible should speed amiss
baptista why how now daughter katherine dumps
have show'd tender fatherly regard
wish wed one half lunatic
mad cap ruffian swearing jack
thinks oaths face matter out
petruchio father 'tis thus yourself all world
talk'd her have talk'd amiss her
if she curst policy
forshe's not froward but modest as dove
she not hot but temperate as morn
roman lucrece her chastity
conclude have 'greed so well together
upon sunday wedding day
katherina i'll see thee hang'd sunday first
gremio hark petruchio she says she'll see thee hang'd first
tranio this speeding nay then good night our part
petruchio patient gentlemen choose her myself
if she pleas'd what's
'tis bargaind 'twixt us twain being alone
tell 'tis incredible believe
how much she loves o kindest kate
she hung about neck kiss kiss
she vied so fast protesting oath oath
twink she won her love
o are novices 'tis world see
how tame when men women are alone
meacock wretch can make curstest shrew
give thy hand kate will unto venice
provide feast father bid guests
will sure katherine shall fine
baptista know not what say but give hands
god send joy petruchio 'tis match
gremio tranio amen say will witnesses
petruchio father wife gentlemen adieu
will venice sunday comes apace
will have rings things fine array
kiss kate will married sunday
gremio was ever match clapp'd up so suddenly
baptista faith gentlemen now play merchant's part
venture madly desperate mart
tranio 'twas commodity lay fretting by
'twill bring gain or perish seas
baptista gain seek quiet match
gremio no doubt but he hath got quiet catch
but now baptista younger daughter
now day long have looked
tranio am one love bianca more
than words can witness or thoughts can guess
gremio youngling thou canst not love so dear as
tranio greybeard thy love doth freeze
gremio but thine doth fry
skipper stand back 'tis age nourisheth
tranio but youth ladies' eyes flourisheth
baptista content gentlemen will compound this strife
'tis deeds must win prize he both
shall have bianca's love
say signior gremio what can assure her
gremio first as know house within city
richly furnished plate gold
basins ewers lave her dainty hands
hangings all tyrian tapestry
ivory coffers have stuff'd crowns
cypress chests arras counterpoints
costly apparel tents canopies
valance venice gold needle work
pewter brass all things belongs
house or housekeeping then at farm
have hundred milch kine pail
six score fat oxen standing stalls
all things answerable this portion
myself am struck years must confess
if die morrow this hers
if whilst live she will only mine
am father's heir only son
if may have daughter wife
i'll leave her houses three or four as good
within rich pisa's walls as any one
old signior gremio has padua
besides two thousand ducats by year
fruitful land all which shall her jointure
what have pinch'd signior gremio
gremio two thousand ducats by year land
she shall have besides an argosy
now lying marseilles road
what have chok'd an argosy
tranio gremio 'tis known father hath no less
than three great argosies besides two galliasses
twelve tight galleys these will assure her
twice as much whate'er thou off'rest next
gremio nay have off'red all have no more
she can have no more than all have
tranio why then maid mine from all world
by firm promise gremio out vied
baptista must confess offer best
let father make her assurance
she own else must pardon
if should die before him where's her dower
tranio that's but cavil he old young
gremio may not young men die as well as old
baptista well gentlemen
daughter katherine married
now sunday following shall bianca
bride if make this assurance
if not signior gremio
so take leave thank both
gremio adieu good neighbour exit baptista
now fear thee not
sirrah young gamester father were fool
give thee all his waning age
an old italian fox not so kind boy exit
tranio vengeance crafty withered hide
yet have fac'd card ten
'tis head do master good
see no reason but suppos'd lucentio
must get father calld suppos'd vincentio
that's wonder fathers commonly
do get their children but this case wooing
child shall get sire if fail not cunning
act iii scene
padua baptista's house
enter lucentio as cambio hortensio as licio bianca
lucentio fiddler forbear grow too forward sir
have so soon forgot entertainment
her sister katherine welcome'd withal
hortensio but wrangling pedant this
patroness heavenly harmony
then give leave have prerogative
lecture shall have leisure as much
lucentio preposterous ass never read so far
know cause why music was ordaind
was not refresh mind man
after his studies or his usual pain
then give leave read philosophy
while pause serve harmony
hortensio sirrah will not bear these braves thine
bianca why gentlemen do double wrong
arn no breeching scholar schools
i'll not tied hours nor 'pointed times
but learn lessons as please myself
cut off all strife here sit down
take instrument play whiles
his lecture will done ere have tund
hortensio you'll leave his lecture when am tune
lucentio will never tune instrument
bianca where left last
'hic ibat simois hic est sigeia tellus
hic steterat priami regia celsa senis'
bianca construe them
lucentio 'hic ibat' as told before 'simois' am lucentio
'hic est' son unto vincentio pisa 'sigeia tellus' disguised
thus get love 'hic steterat' lucentio
comes wooing 'priami' man tranio 'regia' bearing
port 'celsa senis' might beguile old pantaloon
hortensio madam instrument's tune
lucentio spit hole man tune again
bianca now let see if can construe 'hic ibat simois'
know not 'hic est sigeia tellus' trust not 'hic
steterat priami' take heed he hear us not 'regia' presume not
'celsa senis' despair not
hortensio madam 'tis now tune
lucentio all but bass
hortensio bass right 'tis base knave jars
aside how fiery forward our pedant
pedascule i'll watch better yet
bianca time may believe yet mistrust
lucentio mistrust not sure aeacides
was ajax calld so from his grandfather
bianca must believe master else promise
should arguing still upon doubt
but let rest now licio
good master take not unkindly pray
have been thus pleasant both
empty
lessons make no music three parts
lucentio are so formal sir well must wait
aside watch withal but deceiv'd
our fine musician groweth amorous
hortensio madam before touch instrument
learn order fingering
must begin rudiments art
teach gamut briefer sort
than hath been taught by any trade
there writing fairly drawn
bianca why am past gamut long ago
hortensio yet read gamut hortensio
bianca reads
'gamut am ground all accord
re plead hortensio's passion
b mi bianca take him thy lord
c fa ut loves all affection
e la mi show pity or die'
call this gamut tut not
old fashions please best am not so nice
change true rules odd inventions
enter servant
servant mistress father prays leave books
help dress sister's chamber up
know morrow wedding day
bianca farewell sweet masters both must gone
lucentio faith mistress then have no cause stay
empty
hortensio but have cause pry into this pedant
methinks he looks as though he were love
yet if thy thoughts bianca so humble
cast thy wand'ring eyes every stale
seize thee list if once find thee ranging
hortensio will quit thee by changing exit
scene ii
enter baptista gremio tranio as lucentio katherina bianca
lucentio as cambio attendants
baptista tranio signior lucentio this 'pointed day
katherine petruchio should married
yet hear not our son law
what will said what mockery will
want bridegroom when priest attends
speak ceremonial rites marriage
what says lucentio this shame ours
give hand oppos'd against heart
unto mad brain rudesby full spleen
who woo'd haste means wed at leisure
told he was frantic fool
hiding his bitter jests blunt behaviour
noted merry man
he'll woo thousand 'point day marriage
make friends invited proclaim banns
yet never means wed where he hath woo'd
say 'lo there mad petruchio's wife
if would please him come marry her'
tranio patience good katherine baptista too
upon life petruchio means but well
whatever fortune stays him from his word
though he blunt know him passing wise
though he merry yet withal he's honest
katherina would katherine had never seen him though
exit weeping followed by bianca others
such an injury would vex very saint
much more shrew thy impatient humour
enter biondello
master master news such old news as never heard
baptista new old too how may
biondello why not news hear petruchio's coming
baptista he come
biondello why no sir
baptista what then
baptista when will he here
biondello when he stands where am sees there
tranio but say what thine old news
biondello why petruchio coming new hat an old
jerkin pair old breeches thrice turnd pair boots
have been candle cases one buckled another lac'd an old
rusty sword ta'en out town armoury broken hilt
chapeless two broken points his horse hipp'd an
old motley saddle stirrups no kindred besides possess'd
lampass infected fashions full windgalls sped
spavins rayed yellows past cure fives
stark spoild staggers begnawn bots sway'd
back shoulder shotten near legg'd before
half cheek'd bit head stall sheep's leather which
being restrained keep him from stumbling hath been often
burst now repaired knots one girth six times piec'd
womans crupper velure which hath two letters her
name fairly set down studs here there piec'd
baptista who comes him
biondello o sir his lackey all world caparisond
horse linen stock one leg kersey boot hose
other gart'red red blue list an old hat
humour forty fancies prick'd int feather
monster very monster apparel not christian
footboy or gentlemans lackey
tranio 'tis some odd humour pricks him this fashion
yet oftentimes lie goes but mean apparelld
biondello why sir he comes not
baptista didst thou not say he comes
biondello who petruchio came
baptista ay petruchio came
biondello no sir say his horse comes him his back
baptista why that's all one
biondello nay by saint jamy
hold penny
horse man
yet not many
enter petruchio grumio
petruchio come where these gallants who's at home
baptista are welcome sir
petruchio yet come not well
baptista yet halt not
tranio not so well apparelld
as wish were
petruchio were better should rush thus
how does father gentles methinks frown
wherefore gaze this goodly company
as if they saw some wondrous monument
some comet or unusual prodigy
baptista why sir know this wedding day
first were sad fearing would not come
now sadder come so unprovided
fie doff this habit shame estate
an eye sore our solemn festival
hath all so long detaind from wife
sent hither so unlike yourself
petruchio tedious were tell harsh hear
sufficeth am come keep word
though some part enforced digress
which at more leisure will so excuse
as shall well satisfied withal
but where kate stay too long from her
morning wears 'tis time were at church
go chamber put clothes mine
petruchio not believe thus i'll visit her
baptista but thus trust will not marry her
petruchio good sooth even thus therefore ha' done words
she's married not unto clothes
could repair what she will wear
as can change these poor accoutrements
'twere well kate better myself
but what fool am chat
seal title lovely kiss
exeunt petruchio petruchio
tranio he hath some meaning his mad attire
will persuade him possible
put better ere he go church
baptista i'll after him see event this
exeunt baptista gremio biondello attendents
tranio but her love concerneth us ad
her father's liking which bring pass
am get man whate'er he
skills not much we'll fit him our turn
he shall vincentio pisa
make assurance here padua
greater sums than have promised
so shall quietly enjoy hope
marry sweet bianca consent
lucentio were not fellow schoolmaster
doth watch bianca's steps so narrowly
which once perform'd let all world say no
i'll keep mine own despite all world
tranio by degrees mean look into
watch our vantage this business
we'll over reach greybeard gremio
narrow prying father minola
quaint musician amorous licio
all master's sake lucentio
re enter gremio
gremio as willingly as e'er came from school
tranio bride bridegroom coming home
gremio bridegroom say 'tis groom indeed
grumbling groom girl shall find
tranio curster than she why 'tis impossible
gremio why he's devil devil very fiend
tranio why she's devil devil devils dam
gremio tut she's lamb dove fool him
i'll tell sir lucentio when priest
'ay by gogs wouns' quoth he swore so loud
all amaz'd priest let fall book
as he stoop'd again take up
this mad braind bridegroom took him such cuff
down fell priest book book priest
'now take them up' quoth he 'if any list'
tranio what said wench when he rose again
gremio trembled shook why he stamp'd swore
as if vicar meant cozen him
he calls wine 'a health' quoth he as if
he had been abroad carousing his mates
after storm quaff'd off muscadel
threw sops all sextons face
having no other reason
but his beard grew thin hungerly
seem'd ask him sops as he was drinking
this done he took bride about neck
kiss'd her lips such clamorous smack
seeing this came thence very shame
after know rout coming
such mad marriage never was before
hark hark hear minstrels play music plays
enter petruchio katherina bianca baptista hortensio
grumio train
petruchio gentlemen friends thank pains
know think dine day
have prepar'd great store wedding cheer
therefore here mean take leave
baptista is't possible will away night
petruchio must away day before night come
make no wonder if knew business
would entreat rather go than stay
honest company thank all
have beheld give away myself
this most patient sweet virtuous wife
dine father drink health
tranio let us entreat stay till after dinner
petruchio may not
gremio let entreat
petruchio cannot
katherina let entreat
petruchio am content
katherina are content stay
petruchio am content shall entreat stay
but yet not stay entreat how can
petruchio grumio horse
grumio ay sir they ready oats have eaten horses
katherina nay then
do what thou canst will not go day
no nor morrow not till please myself
door open sir there lies way
may jogging whiles boots are green
i'll not gone till please myself
'tis you'll prove jolly surly groom
petruchio o kate content thee prithee not angry
katherina will angry what hast thou do
father quiet he shall stay leisure
gremio ay marry sir now begins work
katherina gentlemen forward bridal dinner
see woman may made fool
if she had not spirit resist
petruchio they shall go forward kate at thy command
obey bride attend her
carouse full measure her maidenhead
mad merry or go hang yourselves
but bonny kate she must
nay look not big nor stamp nor stare nor fret
will master what mine own
she goods chattels she house
household stuff field barn
horse ox ass any thing
here she stands touch her whoever dare
stops way padua grumio
draw forth thy weapon are beset thieves
rescue thy mistress if thou man
fear not sweet wench they shall not touch thee kate
i'll buckler thee against million
exeunt petruchio katherina grumio
baptista nay let them go couple quiet ones
gremio went they not quickly should die laughing
tranio all mad matches never was
bianca being mad herself she's madly mated
gremio warrant him petruchio kated
baptista neighbours friends though bride bridegroom wants
supply places at table
know there wants no junkets at feast
lucentio shall supply bridegroom's place
let bianca take her sister's room
tranio shall sweet bianca practise how bride
baptista she shall lucentio come gentlemen let's go
act iv scene
petruchio's country house
enter grumio
grumio fie fie all tired jades all mad masters all
foul ways was ever man so beaten was ever man so ray'd was
ever man so weary am sent before make fire they are
coming after warm them now were not little pot soon
hot very lips might freeze teeth tongue roof
mouth heart belly ere should come by fire
considering weather taller man than will take cold
holla ho curtis
enter curtis
curtis who calls so coldly
grumio piece ice if thou doubt thou mayst slide from
shoulder heel no greater run but head
neck fire good curtis
curtis master his wife coming grumio
grumio o ay curtis ay therefore fire fire cast no
curtis she so hot shrew as she's reported
grumio she was good curtis before this frost but thou know'st
winter tames man woman beast hath tam'd old
master new mistress myself fellow curtis
curtis away three inch fool am no beast
grumio am but three inches why thy horn foot so long
am at least but wilt thou make fire or shall complain
thee our mistress whose hand she being now at hand thou
shalt soon feel thy cold comfort being slow thy hot
curtis prithee good grumio tell how goes world
grumio cold world curtis every office but thine
therefore fire do thy duty have thy duty master
mistress are almost frozen death
curtis there's fire ready therefore good grumio news
grumio why 'jack boy ho boy' as much news as thou wilt
curtis come are so full cony catching
grumio why therefore fire have caught extreme cold
where's cook supper ready house trimm'd rushes
their white stockings every officer his wedding garment
jacks fair within jills fair without carpets
laid everything order
curtis all ready therefore pray thee news
grumio first know horse tired master mistress falln
empty
curtis how
grumio out their saddles into dirt thereby hangs
empty
grumio lend thine ear
curtis here
grumio there striking him
curtis this 'tis feel tale not hear tale
grumio therefore 'tis calld sensible tale this cuff
was but knock at car beseech list'ning now begin
imprimis came down foul hill master riding behind
empty
curtis both one horse
curtis why horse
grumio tell thou tale but hadst thou not cross'd thou
shouldst have heard how her horse fell she under her horse
thou shouldst have heard how miry place how she was
bemoild how he left her horse upon her how he beat
because her horse stumbled how she waded through dirt
pluck him off how he swore how she pray'd never pray'd
before how cried how horses ran away how her bridle was
burst how lost crupper many things worthy memory
thy grave
curtis by this reck'ning he more shrew than she
grumio ay thou proudest all shall find
when he comes home but what talk this call forth
nathaniel joseph nicholas philip walter sugarsop
rest let their heads sleekly comb'd their blue coats brush'd
their garters an indifferent knit let them curtsy
their left legs not presume touch hair mastcr's
horse tail till they kiss their hands are they all ready
grumio call them forth
curtis do hear ho must meet master countenance
empty
grumio why she hath face her own
curtis who knows not
grumio thou seems calls company countenance her
curtis call them forth credit her
grumio why she comes borrow nothing them
enter four or five servingmen
philip how now grumio
joseph what grumio
nicholas fellow grumio
nathaniel how now old lad
grumio welcome how now what fellow
thus much greeting now spruce companions all ready
all things neat
nathaniel all things ready how near our master
grumio e'en at hand alighted by this therefore not
enter petruchio katherina
petruchio where these knaves what no man at door
hold stirrup nor take horse
where nathaniel gregory philip
all servants here here sir here sir
petruchio here sir here sir here sir here sir
logger headed unpolish'd grooms
what no attendance no regard no duty
where foolish knave sent before
petruchio peasant swain whoreson malt horse drudge
did not bid thee meet park
bring along these rascal knaves thee
grumio nathaniels coat sir was not fully made
gabriels pumps were all unpink'd i' th' heel
there was no link colour peter's hat
walter's dagger was not come from sheathing
there were none fine but adam ralph gregory
rest were ragged old beggarly
petruchio go rascals go fetch supper
exeunt some servingmen
sings where life late led
where are those
sit down kate welcome soud soud soud soud
re enter servants supper
why when say nay good sweet kate merry
off boots rogues villains when

take mend plucking off other
strikes him

one kate must kiss acquainted

whoreson villain will let fall strikes him
katherina patience pray 'twas fault unwilling
petruchio whoreson beetle headed flap ear'd knave
come kate sit down know have stomach
will give thanks sweet kate or else shall
what's this mutton
first servant ay
petruchio who brought
petruchio 'tis burnt so all meat
what dogs are these where rascal cook
how durst villains bring from dresser
serve thus love not
there take trenchers cups all
throws meat etc at them
heedless joltheads unmanner'd slaves
what do grumble i'll straight
exeunt servants
meat was well if were so contented
petruchio tell thee kate 'twas burnt dried away
expressly am forbid touch
engenders choler planteth anger
better 'twere both us did fast
since ourselves ourselves are choleric
than feed such over roasted flesh
patient morrow 't shall mended
this night we'll fast company
re enter servants severally
nathaniel peter didst ever see
peter he kills her her own humour
re enter curtis
grumio where he
curtis her chamber making sermon continency her
rails swears rates she poor soul
knows not which way stand look speak
sits as one new risen from dream
re enter petruchio
petruchio thus have politicly begun reign
'tis hope end successfully
falcon now sharp passing empty
till she stoop she must not full gorg'd
then she never looks upon her lure
another way have man haggard
make her come know her keeper's call
watch her as watch these kites
she eat no meat day nor none shall eat
last night she slept not nor night she shall not
as meat some undeserved fault
i'll find about making bed
here i'll fling pillow there bolster
this way coverlet another way sheets
ay amid this hurly intend
all done reverend care her
conclusion she shall watch all night
clamour keep her still awake
this way kill wife kindness
thus i'll curb her mad headstrong humour
he knows better how tame shrew
now let him speak 'tis charity show exit
scene ii
padua before baptista's house
enter tranio as lucentio hortensio as licio
tranio 't possible friend licio mistress bianca
tell sir she bears fair hand
hortensio sir satisfy what have said
stand by mark manner his teaching
they stand aside
enter bianca lucentio as cambio
lucentio now mistress profit what read
bianca what master read first resolve
lucentio read profess 'the art love'
bianca may prove sir master art
they retire
hortensio quick proceeders marry now tell pray
durst swear mistress blanca
lov'd none world so well as lucentio
tranio o despiteful love unconstant womankind
tell thee licio this wonderful
hortensio mistake no more am not licio
nor musician as seem
but one scorn live this disguise
makes god such cullion
know sir am calld hortensio
tranio signior hortensio have often heard
entire affection bianca
since mine eyes are witness her lightness
will if so contented
forswear bianca her love ever
hortensio see how they kiss court signior lucentio
here hand here firmly vow
as one unworthy all former favours
have fondly flatter'd her withal
tranio here take unfeigned oath
never marry her though she would entreat
fie her see how beastly she doth court him
hortensio would all world but he had quite forsworn
may surely keep mine oath
will married wealtlly widow
ere three days pass which hath as long lov'd
so farewell signior lucentio
kindness women not their beauteous looks
shall win love so take leave
resolution as swore before exit
tranio mistress bianca bless such grace
as 'longeth lover's blessed case
nay have ta'en napping gentle love
have forsworn hortensio
bianca tranio jest but have both forsworn
lucentio then are rid licio
tranio i' faith he'll have lusty widow now
shall woo'd wedded day
bianca god give him joy
tranio ay he'll tame her
bianca he says so tranio
tranio faith he gone unto taming school
bianca taming school what there such place
tranio ay mistress petruchio master
tame shrew charm her chattering tongue
enter biondello
biondello o master master have watch'd so long
am dog weary but at last spied
an ancient angel coming down hill
will serve turn
tranio what he biondello
biondello master mercatante or pedant
know not what but formal apparel
lucentio what him tranio
tranio if he credulous trust tale
i'll make him glad seem vincentio
give assurance baptista minola
as if he were right vincentio
take love then let alone
exeunt lucentio bianca
enter pedant
pedant god save sir
travel far or are at farthest
pedant sir at farthest week or two
but then up farther as far as rome
so tripoli if god lend life
tranio what countryman pray
pedant mantua
tranio mantua sir marry god forbid
come padua careless life
pedant life sir how pray goes hard
come padua know not cause
ships are stay'd at venice duke
private quarrel 'twixt duke him
hath publish'd proclaim'd openly
'tis marvel but are but newly come
might have heard else proclaim'd about
pedant alas sir worse than so
have bills money by exchange
from florence must here deliver them
this will do this will advise
first tell have ever been at pisa
pedant ay sir pisa have often been
pisa renowned grave citizens
tranio among them know one vincentio
pedant know him not but have heard him
merchant incomparable wealth
tranio he father sir sooth say
count'nance somewhat doth resemble
empty
tranio save life this extremity
this favour will do his sake
think not worst all fortunes
are sir vincentio
his name credit shall undertake
house shall friendly lodg'd
look take upon as should
understand sir so shall stay
if this court'sy sir accept
pedant o sir do will repute ever
patron life liberty
tranio then go make matter good
this by way let understand
father here look'd every day
pass assurance dow'r marriage
'twixt one baptista's daughter here
all these circumstances i'll instruct
scene iii
petruchio's house
enter katherina grumio
grumio no no forsooth dare not life
katherina more wrong more his spite appears
what did he marry famish
beggars come unto father's door
upon entreaty have present alms
if not elsewhere they meet charity
nor never needed should entreat
am starv'd meat giddy lack sleep
oaths kept waking brawling fed
which spites more than all these wants
he does under name perfect love
as who should say if should sleep or eat
'twere deadly sickness or else present death
prithee go get some repast
care not what so wholesome food
katherina 'tis passing good prithee let have
grumio fear too choleric meat
how say fat tripe finely broild
katherina well good grumio fetch
grumio cannot tell fear 'tis choleric
what say piece beef mustard
katherina dish do love feed upon
grumio ay but mustard too hot little
katherina why then beef let mustard rest
or else get no beef grumio
katherina then both or one or anything thou wilt
grumio why then mustard without beef
katherina go get thee gone thou false deluding slave
beats him
feed'st very name meat
sorrow thee all pack
triumph thus upon misery
go get thee gone say

what not word nay then thou lov'st not
all pains sorted no proof

much good do unto thy gentle heart

revel as bravely as best
silken coats caps golden rings

amber bracelets beads all this knav'ry
what hast thou dind tailor stays thy leisure

what news sir

velvet dish fie fie 'tis lewd filthy
why 'tis cockle or walnut shell
knack toy trick baby's cap
away come let have bigger
katherina i'll have no bigger this doth fit time
petruchio when are gentle shall have one too
not till then
hortensio aside will not haste
katherina why sir trust may have leave speak
speak will am no child no babe
betters have endur'd say mind
if cannot best stop ears
tongue will tell anger heart
or else heart concealing will break
even uttermost as please words
petruchio why thou say'st true paltry cap
custard coffin bauble silken pie
love thee well thou lik'st not

will have or will have none exit haberdasher
petruchio thy gown why ay come tailor let us see't
o mercy god what masquing stuff here
what's this sleeve 'tis demi cannon
here's snip nip cut slish slash
censer barber's shop
why what devils name tailor callst thou this
hortensio aside see she's have neither cap nor gown
tailor bid make orderly well
according fashion time
petruchio marry did but if rememb'red
did not bid mar time
go hop over every kennel home
i'll none hence make best
katherina never saw better fashiond gown
more quaint more pleasing nor more commendable
belike mean make puppet
petruchio why true he means make puppet thee
tailor she says worship means make puppet her
petruchio o monstrous arrogance thou liest thou thread thou
empty
thou yard three quarters half yard quarter nail
brav'd mine own house skein thread
away thou rag thou quantity thou remnant
or shall so bemete thee thy yard
as thou shalt think prating whilst thou liv'st
tell thee thou hast marr'd her gown
tailor worship deceiv'd gown made
just as master had direction
grumio gave order how should done
grumio gave him no order gave him stuff
grumio marry sir needle thread
tailor but did not request have cut
grumio thou hast fac'd many things
tailor have
grumio face not thou hast brav'd many men brave not
will neither fac'd nor brav'd say unto thee bid thy
master cut out gown but did not bid him cut pieces
ergo thou liest
tailor why here note fashion testify
grumio note lies ins throat if he say said so
tailor reads 'imprimis loose bodied gown
grumio master if ever said loose bodied gown sew
skirts beat death bottom brown bread
said gown
petruchio proceed
tailor reads 'with small compass'd cape'
grumio confess cape
tailor reads 'with trunk sleeve'
tailor reads 'the sleeves curiously cut'
petruchio ay there's villainy
grumio error i' th' bill sir error i' th' bill commanded
sleeves should cut out sew'd up again i'll
prove upon thee though thy little finger armed thimble
tailor this true say an had thee place where thou
shouldst know
grumio am thee straight take thou bill give thy

petruchio well sir brief gown not
grumio are i' th' right sir 'tis mistress
petruchio go take up unto thy master's use

thy master's use

grumio o sir conceit deeper than think
take up mistress' gown his master's use
o fie fie fie
go take hence gone say no more
hortensio tailor i'll pay thee thy gown morrow
take no unkindness his hasty words
away say commend thy master exit tailor
petruchio well come kate will unto father's
even these honest mean habiliments
our purses shall proud our garments poor
'tis mind makes body rich
as sun breaks through darkest clouds
what jay more precious than lark
because his feathers are more beautiful
or adder better than eel
because his painted skin contents eye
o no good kate neither art thou worse
this poor furniture mean array
if thou account'st shame lay
therefore frolic will hence forthwith
feast sport us at thy father's house
bring our horses unto long lane end
there will mount thither walk foot
let's see think 'tis now some seven o'clock
well may come there by dinner time
katherina dare assure sir 'tis almost two
'twill supper time ere come there
petruchio shall seven ere go horse
look what speak or do or think do
are still crossing sirs let 't alone
shall what o'clock say
hortensio why so this gallant will command sun
empty

good report hear

father deceitful son

scene v
public road
enter petruchio katherina hortensio servants
petruchio come god's name once more toward our father's
good lord how bright goodly shines moon
petruchio say moon shines so bright
katherina know sun shines so bright
petruchio now by mother's son that's myself
shall moon or star or what list
or ere journey father's house
go fetch our horses back again
evermore cross'd cross'd nothing but cross'd
hortensio say as he says or shall never go
katherina forward pray since have come so far
if please call rush candle
henceforth vow shall so
petruchio say moon
katherina know moon
petruchio nay then lie blessed sun
katherina then god bless'd blessed sun
but sun not when say not
moon changes even as mind
what will have nam'd even
hortensio petruchio go thy ways field won
petruchio well forward forward thus bowl should run
not unluckily against bias
but soft company coming here
enter vincentio
vincentio good morrow gentle mistress where away
tell sweet kate tell truly too
hast thou beheld fresher gentlewoman
such war white red within her cheeks
as those two eyes become heavenly face
fair lovely maid once more good day thee
sweet kate embrace her her beauty's sake
hortensio 'a will make man mad make woman him
katherina young budding virgin fair fresh sweet
whither away or where thy abode
happy parents so fair child
happier man whom favourable stars
allots thee his lovely bed fellow
this man old wrinkled faded withered
not maiden as thou sayst he
katherina pardon old father mistaking eyes
have been so bedazzled sun
everything look seemeth green
now perceive thou art reverend father
pardon pray thee mad mistaking
petruchio do good old grandsire withal make known
which way thou travellest if along us
vincentio fair sir merry mistress
strange encounter much amaz'd
name calld vincentio dwelling pisa
bound am padua there visit
son mine which long have not seen
petruchio what his name
vincentio lucentio gentle sir
petruchio happily met happier thy son
now by law as well as reverend age
sister wife this gentlewoman
thy son by this hath married wonder not
nor not grieved she good esteem
her dowry wealthy worthy birth
beside so qualified as may beseem
spouse any noble gentleman
let embrace old vincentio
wander see thy honest son
who will thy arrival full joyous
pleasant travellers break jest
upon company overtake
hortensio do assure thee father so
petruchio come go along see truth hereof
our first merriment hath made thee jealous
exeunt all but hortensio
hortensio well petruchio this has put heart
have widow if she froward
then hast thou taught hortensio untoward exit
padua before lucentio's house
enter biondello lucentio bianca gremio out before
biondello softly swiftly sir priest ready
lucentio fly biondello but they may chance need at
home therefore leave us
biondello nay faith i'll see church back then
come back master's as soon as can
exeunt lucentio bianca biondello
gremio marvel cambio comes not all this while
attendants
petruchio sir here's door this lucentio's house
father's bears more toward market place
thither must here leave sir
vincentio shall not choose but drink before go
think shall command welcome here
by all likelihood some cheer toward knocks
gremio they're busy within were best knock louder
pedant looks out window
vincentio signior lucentio within sir
pedant he's within sir but not spoken withal

merry withal

long as live

out at window

somebody this city under countenance

good shipping but who here mine old master vicentio now

think his name

only son heir lands signior vicentio

petruchio katherine charge thee tell these headstrong women
what duty they do owe their lords husbands
widow come come you're mocking will have no telling
petruchio come say first begin her
petruchio say she shall first begin her
katherina fie fie unknit threatening unkind brow
dart not scornful glances from those eyes
wound thy lord thy king thy governor
blots thy beauty as frosts do bite meads
confounds thy fame as whirlwinds shake fair buds
no sense meet or amiable
woman mov'd fountain troubled
muddy ill seeming thick bereft beauty
will deign sip or touch one drop
thy husband thy lord thy life thy keeper
thy head thy sovereign one cares thee
thy maintenance commits his body
painful labour both by sea land
watch night storms day cold
whilst thou liest warm at home secure safe
craves no other tribute at thy hands
but love fair looks true obedience
such duty as subject owes prince
even such woman oweth her husband
when she froward peevish sullen sour
not obedient his honest will
what she but foul contending rebel
graceless traitor her loving lord
am asham'd women are so simple
offer war where they should kneel peace
or seek rule supremacy sway
why are our bodies soft weak smooth
unapt toll trouble world
but our soft conditions our hearts
should well agree our external parts
come come froward unable worms
mind hath been as big as one yours
heart as great reason haply more
bandy word word frown frown
but now see our lances are but straws
seeming most which indeed least are
then vail stomachs no boot
place hands below husband's foot
token which duty if he please
hand ready may do him ease
petruchio why there's wench come kiss kate
lucentio well go thy ways old lad thou shalt ha't
vincentio 'tis good hearing when children are toward
lucentio but harsh hearing when women are froward
three are married but two are sped
lucentio 'twas won wager though hit white
being winner god give good night
exeunt petruchio katherina
hortensio now go thy ways thou hast tam'd curst shrow
lucentio 'tis wonder by leave she will tam'd so

thus neglecting worldly ends all dedicated

o'er priz'd all popular rate false brother
awak'd an evil nature trust
good parent did beget him
falsehood its contrary as great
as trust was which had indeed no limit
confidence sans bound he being thus lorded
not only what revenue yielded
but what power might else exact one
who having into truth by telling
credit his own lie he did believe
he was indeed duke out o' th' substitution
executing th' outward face royalty
all prerogative hence his ambition growing
dost thou hear

absolute milan poor man library

most ignoble stooping

prospero this blue ey'd hag was hither brought child

thou wast spirit too delicate
act her earthy abhorr'd commands

her most unmitigable rage
into cloven pine within which rift
imprisond thou didst painfully remain
dozen years within which space she died
left thee there where thou didst vent thy groans
as fast as mill wheels strike then was this island
save son she did litter here
freckld whelp hag born not honour'd
human shape

this isle calibans
miranda abhorred slave
which any print goodness wilt not take

took pains make thee speak taught thee each hour

though thou didst learn had int which good natures
could not abide therefore wast thou

are then most humble have no ambition

ferdinand so they are
spirits as dream are all bound up

empty

scene 3
another part island
gonzalo by'r lakin can go no further sir

needs must rest

who am myself attach'd weariness
th' dulling spirits sit down rest

so out hope

resolv'd t' effect

will take throughly

as when they are fresh

top invisible enter several strange shapes

gonzalo marvellous sweet music
sebastian living drollery now will believe
there are unicorns arabia
there one tree phoenix' throne one phoenix
at this hour reigning there

what does else want credit come
i'll sworn 'tis true travellers ne'er did lie
though fools at home condemn 'em
gonzalo if naples
if should say saw such islanders
certes these are people island
who though they are monstrous shape yet note
their manners are more gentle kind than
our human generation shall find
many nay almost any
prospero aside honest lord
thou hast said well some there present
are worse than devils
such shapes such gesture such sound expressing
although they want use tongue kind
excellent dumb discourse
prospero aside praise departing
francisco they vanish'd strangely
sebastian no matter since
they have left their viands behind have stomachs
willt please taste what here
alonso not
who would believe there were mountaineers
dewlapp'd bulls whose throats had hanging at 'em
wallets flesh or there were such men
whose heads stood their breasts which now find
each putter out five one will bring us
good warrant
alonso will stand feed
although last no matter since feel
best past brother lord duke
thunder lightning enter ariel harpy
claps his wings upon table quaint
device banquet vanishes
ariel are three men sin whom destiny
hath instrument this lower world
what int never surfeited sea
hath caus'd belch up this island
where man doth not inhabit 'mongst men
being most unfit live have made mad
their proper selves
alonso sebastian etc draw their swords
fools fellows
are ministers fate elements
whom swords are temper'd may as well
wound loud winds or bemock'd at stabs
kill still closing waters as diminish
one dowle that's plume fellow ministers
are invulnerable if could hurt
will not uplifted but remember
that's business three
from milan did supplant good prospero
expos'd unto sea which hath requit
him his innocent child which foul deed

scene iii
sempronius' house

owe their estates unto him
servant lord

they have all denied him

does he send three humh
shows but little love or judgment him
must his last refuge his friends physicians
thrice give him over must take th' cure upon
has much disgrac'd int angry at him
might have known place see no sense for't
but his occasions might have woo'd first
conscience was first man
e'er received gift from him
i'll requite last no
so may prove an argument laughter
th' rest 'mongst lords thought fool
i'd rather than worth thrice sum
had sent first but mind's sake
i'd such courage do him good but now return
their faint reply this answer join
who bates mine honour shall not know coin exit
servant excellent lordship's goodly villain devil
by't cannot think but end villainies man
will set him clear how fairly this lord strives appear foul
takes virtuous copies wicked those under hot
ardent zeal would set whole realms fire
such nature his politic love
this was lord's best hope now all are fled
save only gods now his friends are dead
doors were ne'er acquainted their wards
many bounteous year must employ'd
this all liberal course allows
who cannot keep his wealth must keep his house exit

he man setting his fate aside
comely virtues

such sober unnoted passion
