act iv scene
without walls athens
enter timon
timon let look back upon thee o thou wall
fence not athens matrons turn incontinent
obedience fail children slaves fools
pluck grave wrinkled senate from bench
minister their steads general filths
convert o' th' instant green virginity
do't parents' eyes bankrupts hold fast
rather than render back out knives
cut trusters' throats bound servants steal
large handed robbers grave masters are
thy mistress o' th' brothel son sixteen
pluck lind crutch from thy old limping sire
beat out his brains piety fear
religion gods peace justice truth
domestic awe night rest neighbourhood
instruction manners mysteries trades
degrees observances customs laws
decline confounding contraries
let confusion live plagues incident men
athens ripe stroke thou cold sciatica
cripple our senators their limbs may halt
as lamely as their manners lust liberty
creep minds marrows our youth
'gainst stream virtue they may strive
drown themselves riot itches blains
sow all th' athenian bosoms their crop
general leprosy breath infect breath
their society as their friendship may
but nakedness thou detestable town
take thou too multiplying bans
timon will woods where he shall find
th' unkindest beast more kinder than mankind

grant as timon grows his hate may grow
whole race mankind high low

athens timons house

am as poor as

dedicated beggar air
his disease all shunnd poverty
walks contempt alone more our fellows

hearing surges threat must all part
into this sea air

'we have seen better days' let each take some
giving them money
nay put out all hands not one word more
thus part rich sorrow parting poor
embrace part several ways
o fierce wretchedness glory brings us
who would not wish from wealth exempt
who would so mock'd glory or live
but dream friendship
have his pomp all what state compounds
but only painted his varnish'd friends
poor honest lord brought low by his own heart
undone by goodness strange unusual blood
when mans worst sin he does too much good
who then dares half so kind again
bounty makes gods does still mar men
rich only wretched thy great fortunes
are made thy chief afflictions alas kind lord
he's flung rage from this ingrateful seat
monstrous friends nor has he him
supply his life or which can command
i'll follow enquire him out
i'll ever serve his mind best will
whilst have gold i'll his steward still exit
scene iii
enter timon woods
timon o blessed breeding sun draw from earth
rotten humidity below thy sister's orb
infect air twinnd brothers one womb
whose procreation residence birth
scarce dividant touch them several fortunes
greater scorns lesser not nature
whom all sores lay siege can bear great fortune
but by contempt nature
senator shall bear contempt hereditary
beggar native honour
pasture lards rother's sides
want makes him lean who dares who dares
purity manhood stand upright

more man plague plague

poor unmanly melancholy sprung
from change fortune why this spade this place
this slave habit these looks care
thy flatterers yet wear silk drink wine lie soft
hug their diseas'd perfumes have forgot
ever timon was shame not these woods
thou flatterer now seek thrive
by which has undone thee hinge thy knee
let his very breath whom thou'lt observe
blow off thy cap praise his most vicious strain
call excellent thou wast told thus

lays her full mess before want why want
first bandit cannot live grass berries water
as beasts birds fishes
timon nor beasts themselves birds fishes
must eat men yet thanks must con
are thieves profess'd work not

limited professions rascal thieves
till high fever seethe blood froth
so scape hanging trust not physician
his antidotes are poison he slays
moe than rob take wealth lives together
do villainy do since protest do't
workmen i'll example thievery
suns thief his great attraction
robs vast sea moons an arrant thief
her pale fire she snatches from sun

feeds breeds by composture stoln
from genral excrement each thing's thief
laws curb whip their rough power
has uncheck'd theft love not yourselves away

break open shops nothing can steal

if ever bassianus caesar's son

justice continence nobility

chosen andronicus surnamed pius
many good great deserts rome
nobler man braver warrior
lives not this day within city walls
he by senate accited home
from weary wars against barbarous goths
his sons terror our foes
ten years are spent since first he undertook
this cause rome chastised arms
our enemies' pride five times he hath returnd
bleeding rome bearing his valiant sons

monument andronici
done sacrifice expiation
slain noblest prisoner goths
now at last laden honour's spoils

but let laws rome determine all
meanwhile am possess'd mine
saturninus 'tis good sir are very short us
but if live we'll as sharp
bassianus lord what have done as best may
answer must shall do life
only thus much give grace know
this noble gentleman lord titus here
opinion honour wrong'd
rescue lavinia
his own hand did slay his youngest son
zeal highly mov'd wrath
controlld he frankly gave
receive him then favour saturnine
hath express'd himself all his deeds
father friend thee rome
'tis thou those have dishonoured
rome righteous heavens judge
how have lov'd honoured saturnine
tamora worthy lord if ever tamora
were gracious those princely eyes thine
then hear speak indifferently all
at suit sweet pardon what past
saturninus what madam dishonoured openly
basely put up without revenge
should author dishonour
but mine honour dare undertake
good lord titus' innocence all
whose fury not dissembled speaks his griefs
then at suit look graciously him
lose not so noble friend vain suppose
nor sour looks afflict his gentle heart
aside saturninus lord ruld by
won at last
are but newly planted throne
lest then people patricians too
upon just survey take titus' part
so supplant ingratitude
which rome reputes heinous sin
yield at entreats then let alone
i'll find day massacre them all
raze their faction their family
cruel father his traitorous sons
make them know what 'tis let queen
kneel streets beg grace vain
come come sweet emperor come andronicus
take up this good old man cheer heart
dies tempest thy angry frown
saturninus rise titus rise empress hath prevaild
titus thank majesty her lord
these words these looks infuse new life
tamora titus am incorporate rome
must advise emperor his good
this day all quarrels die andronicus
let mine honour good lord
have reconcild friends
prince bassianus have pass'd
word promise emperor
will more mild tractable
fear not lords lavinia
by advice all humbled knees
lucius do vow heaven his highness
what did was mildly as might
tend'ring our sister's honour our own
marcus mine honour here do protest
saturninus away talk not trouble us no more
tamora nay nay sweet emperor must all friends
tribune his nephews kneel grace
will not denied sweet heart look back
saturninus marcus thy sake thy brother's here
do remit these young mens heinous faults
stand up
lavinia though left churl
found friend sure as death swore
would not part bachelor from priest
come if emperor's court can feast two brides
are guest lavinia friends
this day shall love day tamora
titus morrow please majesty
horn hound we'll give grace bonjour
saturninus so titus gramercy too
exeunt sound trumpets
act ii scene
rome before palace
enter aaron
aaron now climbeth tamora olympus' top
safe out fortune's shot sits aloft
secure thunder's crack or lightning flash
as when golden sun salutes morn
having gilt ocean his beams
gallops zodiac his glistening coach
overlooks highest peering hills
so tamora
upon her wit doth earthly honour wait
virtue stoops trembles at her frown
then aaron arm thy heart fit thy thoughts
mount aloft thy imperial mistress
hast prisoner held fett'red amorous chains
faster bound aarons charming eyes
than prometheus tied caucasus
away slavish weeds servile thoughts
will bright shine pearl gold
wait upon this new made emperess
wait said wanton this queen
this goddess this semiramis this nymph
this siren will charm rome's saturnine
hullo what storm this
enter chiron demetrius braving
demetrius chiron thy years wants wit thy wits wants edge
manners intrude where am grac'd
may aught thou knowest affected
chiron demetrius thou dost over ween all
so this bear down braves
'tis not difference year or two
makes less gracious or thee more fortunate
serve deserve mistress' grace
sword upon thee shall approve
plead passions lavinia's love
aaron aside clubs clubs these lovers will not keep
empty
demetrius why boy although our mother unadvis'd
gave dancing rapier by side
are so desperate grown threat friends
go have lath glued within sheath
chiron meanwhile sir little skill have
full well shalt thou perceive how much dare
demetrius ay boy grow ye so brave they draw
aaron coming forward why how now lords
so near emperor's palace dare ye draw
maintain such quarrel openly
full well wot ground all this grudge
would not million gold
cause were known them most concerns
so dishonoured court rome
shame put up
demetrius not till have sheath'd
rapier his bosom withal
thrust those reproachful speeches down his throat
he hath breath'd dishonour here
chiron am prepar'd full resolv'd
foul spoken coward thund'rest thy tongue
thy weapon nothing dar'st perform
now by gods warlike goths adore
this pretty brabble will undo us all
why lords think not how dangerous
jet upon prince's right
what lavinia then become so loose
or bassianus so degenerate
her love such quarrels may broach'd
without controlment justice or revenge
young lords beware an should empress know
chiron care not knew she all world
love lavinia more than all world
demetrius youngling learn thou make some meaner choice
lavina thine elder brother's hope
aaron why are ye mad or know ye not rome
how furious impatient they
cannot brook competitors love
tell lords do but plot deaths
by this device
would propose achieve her whom love
aaron achieve her how
demetrius why mak'st thou so strange
she woman therefore may woo'd
she woman therefore may won
she lavinia therefore must lov'd
what man more water glideth by mill
than wots miller easy
cut loaf steal shive know
better than he have worn vulcans badge
aaron aside ay as good as saturninus may
demetrius then why should he despair knows court
words fair looks liberality
what hast not thou full often struck doe
borne her cleanly by keeper's nose
aaron why then seems some certain snatch or so
would serve turns
chiron ay so turn were served
aaron would had hit too
then should not tir'd this ado
why hark ye hark ye are such fools
square this would offend then
both should speed
chiron faith not
demetrius nor so were one
aaron shame friends join jar
'tis policy stratagem must do
what cannot as would achieve
must perforce accomplish as may
take this lucrece was not more chaste
than this lavinia bassianus' love
speedier course than ling'ring languishment
must pursue have found path
lords solemn hunting hand
there will lovely roman ladies troop
forest walks are wide spacious
fitted by kind rape villainy
single thither then this dainty doe
strike her home by force if not by words
this way or not at all stand hope
come come our empress her sacred wit
villainy vengeance consecrate
will acquaint all what intend
she shall file our engines advice
will not suffer square yourselves
emperor's court house fame
palace full tongues eyes ears
woods are ruthless dreadful deaf dull

there serve lust shadowed from heavens eye

cool this heat charm calm these fits
scene ii
forest near rome
enter titus andronicus his three sons lucius quintus martius
making noise hounds horns marcus
titus hunt up morn bright grey
fields are fragrant woods are green
uncouple here let us make bay
wake emperor his lovely bride
rouse prince ring hunter's peal
sons let charge as ours
attend emperor's person carefully
have been troubled sleep this night
but dawning day new comfort hath inspir'd
here cry hounds wind horns peal
then enter saturninus tamora bassianus lavinia
chiron demetrius their attendants
many good morrows majesty
madam as many as good
saturninus have rung lustily lords
somewhat too early new married ladies
bassianus lavinia how say
lavinia say no
have been broad awake two hours more
saturninus come then horse chariots let us have
our sport tamora madam now shall ye see
our roman hunting

climb highest promontory top

makes way run swallows o'er plain

but hope pluck dainty doe ground exeunt
scene iii
lonely part forest
enter aaron alone bag gold
aaron he had wit would think had none
never after inherit
let him thinks so abjectly
know this gold must coin stratagem
which cunningly effected will beget
very excellent piece villainy
so repose sweet gold their unrest
hides gold
have their alms out empress' chest
enter tamora alone moor
when everything does make gleeful boast
birds chant melody every bush
snakes lie rolled cheerful sun
green leaves quiver cooling wind
make chequer'd shadow ground
under their sweet shade aaron let us sit
while babbling echo mocks hounds
replying shrilly well tund horns
as if double hunt were heard at once
after conflict such as was suppos'd
wand'ring prince dido once enjoyed
when happy storm they were surpris'd
curtaind counsel keeping cave
may each wreathed other's arms
our pastimes done possess golden slumber
whiles hounds horns sweet melodious birds
unto us as nurse's song
lullaby bring her babe asleep
saturn dominator over mine
what signifies deadly standing eye
silence cloudy melancholy
fleece woolly hair now uncurls
even as an adder when she doth unroll
do some fatal execution
no madam these are no venereal signs
vengeance heart death hand
blood revenge are hammering head
which never hopes more heaven than rests thee
this day doom bassianus
his philomel must lose her tongue day
thy sons make pillage her chastity
wash their hands bassianus' blood
seest thou this letter take up pray thee
give king this fatal plotted scroll
now question no more are espied
here comes parcel our hopeful booty
enter bassianus lavinia
tamora ah sweet moor sweeter than life
aaron no more great empress bassianus comes
cross him i'll go fetch thy sons
back thy quarrels whatsoe'er they exit
bassianus who have here rome's royal emperess
unfurnish'd her well beseeming troop
or dian habited her
who hath abandoned her holy groves
tamora saucy controller private steps
had pow'r some say dian had
thy temples should planted presently
horns as was actaeons hounds
should drive upon thy new transformed limbs
unmannerly intruder as thou art
lavinia under patience gentle emperess
'tis thought have goodly gift horning
doubted moor
jove shield husband from his hounds day
'tis pity they should take him stag
bassianus believe queen swarth cimmerian
doth make honour his body's hue
spotted detested abominable
why are sequest'red from all train
dismounted from snow white goodly steed
wand'red hither an obscure plot
accompanied but barbarous moor
lavinia being intercepted sport
great reason noble lord rated
sauciness pray let us hence
let her joy her raven coloured love
this valley fits purpose passing well
bassianus king brother shall have notice this
lavinia ay these slips have made him noted long
good king so mightily abused
tamora why have patience endure all this
demetrius how now dear sovereign our gracious mother
why doth highness look so pale wan
tamora have not reason think look pale
these two have 'ticed hither this place
barren detested vale see
trees though summer yet forlorn lean
overcome moss baleful mistletoe
here never shines sun here nothing breeds
unless nightly owl or fatal raven
they told here at dead time night
thousand fiends thousand hissing snakes
ten thousand swelling toads as many urchins
would make such fearful confused cries
as any mortal body hearing
should straight fall mad or else die suddenly
no sooner had they told this hellish tale
but straight they told they would bind here
unto body dismal yew
then they calld foul adulteress
lascivious goth all bitterest terms
ever ear did hear such effect
had not by wondrous fortune come
this vengeance had they executed
revenge as love mother's life
or ye not henceforth calld children
demetrius this witness am thy son
stabs bassianus
also stabs
lavinia ay come semiramis nay barbarous tamora
no name fits thy nature but thy own
tamora give poniard shall know boys
mother's hand shall right mother's wrong
demetrius stay madam here more belongs her
first thrash corn then after burn straw
this minion stood upon her chastity
upon her nuptial vow her loyalty
shall she carry this unto her grave
chiron an if she do would were an eunuch
drag hence her husband some secret hole
make his dead trunk pillow our lust
tamora but when ye have honey desire
let not this wasp outlive us both sting
chiron warrant madam will make sure
come mistress now perforce will enjoy
nice preserved honesty yours
tamora will not hear her speak away her
lavinia sweet lords entreat her hear but word
demetrius listen fair madam let glory
see her tears but heart them
as unrelenting flint drops rain
lavinia when did tiger's young ones teach dam
o do not learn her wrath she taught thee
milk thou suck'dst from her did turn marble
even at thy teat thou hadst thy tyranny
chiron do thou entreat her show womans pity
chiron what wouldst thou have prove myself bastard
lavinia 'tis true raven doth not hatch lark
yet have heard o could find now
lion mov'd pity did endure
have his princely paws par'd all away
some say ravens foster forlorn children
whilst their own birds famish their nests
o though thy hard heart say no
tamora know not what means away her
lavinia o let teach thee father's sake
gave thee life when well he might have slain thee
not obdurate open thy deaf ears
tamora hadst thou person ne'er offended
even his sake am pitiless
remember boys pour'd forth tears vain
save brother from sacrifice
but fierce andronicus would not relent
worse her better lov'd
lavinia o tamora calld gentle queen
thine own hands kill this place
'tis not life have begg'd so long
poor was slain when bassianus died
tamora what beg'st thou then fond woman let go
lavinia 'tis present death beg one thing more
womanhood denies tongue tell
o keep from their worse than killing lust
where never mans eye may behold body
do this charitable murderer
tamora so should rob sweet sons their fee
no let them satisfy their lust thee
demetrius away thou hast stay'd us here too long
lavinia no grace no womanhood ah beastly creature
blot enemy our general name
confusion fall
chiron nay then i'll stop mouth bring thou her husband
demetrius throws body
bassianus into pit then exeunt
demetrius chiron dragging off lavinia
tamora farewell sons see make her sure
ne'er let heart know merry cheer indeed
till all andronici made away
now will hence seek lovely moor
let spleenful sons this trull deflower exit
re enter aaron two
aaron come lords better foot before
straight will bring loathsome pit
where espied panther fast asleep
quintus sight very dull whate'er bodes
martius mine promise were not shame
well could leave our sport sleep awhile
falls into pit
quintus what art thou fallen what subtle hole this
whose mouth covered rude growing briers
as fresh as morning dew distilld flowers
very fatal place seems
speak brother hast thou hurt thee fall
martius o brother dismalst object hurt
ever eye sight made heart lament
aaron aside now will fetch king find them here
he thereby may have likely guess
how these were they made away his brother exit
martius why dost not comfort help out
quintus am surprised an uncouth fear
chilling sweat o'er runs trembling joints
heart suspects more than mine eye can see
martius prove thou hast true divining heart
aaron thou look down into this den
see fearful sight blood death
quintus aaron gone compassionate heart
will not permit mine eyes once behold
thing whereat trembles by surmise
was child fear know not what
martius lord bassianus lies beray'd blood
all heap slaughtered lamb
this detested dark blood drinking pit
quintus if dark how dost thou know 'tis he
martius upon his bloody finger he doth wear
precious ring lightens all this hole
which taper some monument
doth shine upon dead mans earthy cheeks
so pale did shine moon pyramus
when he by night lay bath'd maiden blood
o brother help thy fainting hand
if fear hath made thee faint as hath
out this fell devouring receptacle
as hateful as cocytus' misty mouth
quintus reach thy hand may help thee out
or wanting strength do thee so much good
may pluck'd into swallowing womb
have no strength pluck thee brink
martius nor no strength climb without thy help
quintus thy hand once more will not loose again
till thou art here aloft or below
thou canst not come come thee falls
enter emperor aaron moor
saturninus along i'll see what hole here
what he now leapt into
say who art thou lately didst descend
martius unhappy sons old andronicus
brought hither most unlucky hour
find thy brother bassianus dead
saturninus brother dead know thou dost but jest
he his lady both are at lodge
upon north side this pleasant chase
'tis not an hour since left them there
martius know not where left them all alive
but out alas here have found him dead
attendants titus andronicus lucius
tamora where lord king
saturninus here tamora though griev'd killing grief
tamora where thy brother bassianus
saturninus now bottom dost thou search wound
poor bassianus here lies murdered
tamora then all too late bring this fatal writ
complot this timeless tragedy
wonder greatly mans face can fold
she giveth saturnine letter
saturninus reads 'an if miss meet him handsomely
sweet huntsman bassianus 'tis mean
do thou so much as dig grave him
thou know'st our meaning look thy reward
among nettles at elder tree
which overshades mouth same pit
where decreed bury bassianus
do this purchase us thy lasting friends'
this pit this elder tree
look sirs if can find huntsman out
should have murdered bassianus here
aaron gracious lord here bag gold
saturninus titus two thy whelps fell curs bloody
empty
have here bereft brother his life
sirs drag them from pit unto prison
there let them bide until have devis'd
tamora what are they this pit o wondrous thing
how easily murder discovered
titus high emperor upon feeble knee
beg this boon tears not lightly shed
this fell fault accursed sons
accursed if fault prov'd them
saturninus if prov'd see apparent
who found this letter tamora was
tamora andronicus himself did take up
by fathers' reverend tomb vow
they shall ready at highness' will
answer their suspicion their lives
saturninus thou shalt not bail them see thou follow
some bring murdered body some murderers
let them not speak word guilt plain
by soul were there worse end than death
end upon them should executed
tamora andronicus will entreat king
titus come lucius come stay not talk them exeunt
scene iv
another part forest
enter empress' sons demetrius chiron lavinia
her hands cut off her tongue cut out ravish'd
demetrius so now go tell an if thy tongue can speak
who 'twas cut thy tongue ravish'd thee
chiron write down thy mind bewray thy meaning so
an if thy stumps will let thee play scribe
chiron go home call sweet water wash thy hands
demetrius she hath no tongue call nor hands wash
so let's leave her her silent walks
chiron an 'twere cause should go hang myself
demetrius if thou hadst hands help thee knit cord
exeunt demetrius chiron
wind horns enter marcus from hunting
marcus who this niece flies away so fast
cousin word where husband
if do wake some planet strike down
may slumber an eternal sleep
speak gentle niece what stern ungentle hands
hath lopp'd hew'd made thy body bare
her two branches those sweet ornaments
whose circling shadows kings have sought sleep
might not gain so great happiness
as half thy love why dost not speak
alas crimson river warm blood
doth rise fall between thy rosed lips
coming going thy honey breath
but sure some tereus hath deflowered thee
lest thou shouldst detect him cut thy tongue
ah now thou turnst away thy face shame
notwithstanding all this loss blood
as from conduit three issuing spouts
yet do thy cheeks look red as titans face
blushing encount'red cloud
o knew thy heart knew beast
might rail at him ease mind
sorrow concealed an oven stopp'd
doth burn heart cinders where
fair philomel why she but lost her tongue
tedious sampler sew'd her mind
but lovely niece mean cut from thee
craftier tereus cousin hast thou met
he hath cut those pretty fingers off
o had monster seen those lily hands
tremble aspen leaves upon lute
make silken strings delight kiss them
he would not then have touch'd them his life
or had he heard heavenly harmony
which sweet tongue hath made
he would have dropp'd his knife fell asleep
as cerberus at thracian poet's feet
come let us go make thy father blind
one hour's storm will drown fragrant meads
what will whole months tears thy father's eyes
do not draw back will mourn thee
o could our mourning case thy misery exeunt
act iii scene
rome street
enter judges tribunes senators titus' two sons
martius quintus bound passing stage place execution
titus going before pleading
pity mine age whose youth was spent
dangerous wars whilst securely slept
all blood rome's great quarrel shed
all frosty nights have watch'd
these bitter tears which now see
filling aged wrinkles cheeks
pitiful condemned sons
whose souls are not corrupted as 'tis thought
two twenty sons never wept
andronicus lieth down judges
pass by him prisoners exeunt
these tribunes dust write
heart's deep languor souls sad tears
let tears stanch earth's dry appetite
sons' sweet blood will make shame blush
o earth will befriend thee more rain
shall distil from these two ancient urns
than youthful april shall all his show'rs
winter warm tears i'll melt snow
keep eternal spring time thy face
so thou refuse drink dear sons' blood
enter lucius his weapon drawn
o reverend tribunes o gentle aged men
unbind sons reverse doom death
let say never wept before
tears are now prevailing orators
lucius o noble father lament vain
recount sorrows stone
titus ah lucius thy brothers let plead
grave tribunes once more entreat
lucius gracious lord no tribune hears speak
titus why 'tis no matter man if they did hear
they would not mark if they did mark
they would not pity yet plead must
bootless unto them
therefore tell sorrows stones
yet some sort they are better than tribunes
they will not intercept tale
when do weep they humbly at feet
receive tears seem weep
were they but attired grave weeds
rome could afford no tribunes these
stone soft as wax tribunes more hard than stones
stone silent offendeth not
tribunes their tongues doom men death
but wherefore stand'st thou thy weapon drawn
lucius rescue two brothers from their death
which attempt judges have pronounc'd
everlasting doom banishment
titus o happy man they have befriended thee
why foolish lucius dost thou not perceive
rome but wilderness tigers
tigers must prey rome affords no prey
but mine how happy art thou then
but who comes our brother marcus here
enter marcus lavinia
marcus titus prepare thy aged eyes weep
or if not so thy noble heart break
bring consuming sorrow thine age
titus will consume let see then
marcus this was thy daughter
titus why marcus so she
lucius ay this object kills
speak lavinia what accursed hand
hath made thee handless thy father's sight
what fool hath added water sea
or brought fagot bright burning troy
grief was at height before thou cam'st
now nilus disdaineth bounds
give sword i'll chop off hands too
they have fought rome all vain
they have nurs'd this woe feeding life
they have serv'd effectless use
now all service require them
one will help cut other
'tis well lavinia thou hast no hands
hands do rome service but vain
lucius speak gentle sister who hath martyr'd thee
marcus o delightful engine her thoughts
blabb'd them such pleasing eloquence
torn from forth pretty hollow cage
sweet varied notes enchanting every ear
lucius o say thou her who hath done this deed
marcus o thus found her straying park
seeking hide herself as doth deer
hath receiv'd some unrecuring wound
titus was dear he wounded her
hath hurt more than had he killd dead
now stand as one upon rock
environd wilderness sea
expecting ever when some envious surge
will his brinish bowels swallow him
this way death wretched sons are gone
here stands other son banish'd man
here brother weeping at woes
but which gives soul greatest spurn
dear lavinia dearer than soul
had but seen thy picture this plight
would have madded what shall do
thou hast no hands wipe away thy tears
nor tongue tell who hath martyr'd thee
thy husband he dead his death
thy brothers are condemnd dead by this
look marcus ah son lucius look her
when did name her brothers then fresh tears
stood her cheeks as doth honey dew
upon gath'red lily almost withered
marcus perchance she weeps because they killd her husband
titus if they did kill thy husband then joyful
because law hath ta'en revenge them
no no they would not do so foul deed
witness sorrow their sister makes
gentle lavinia let kiss thy lips
or make some sign how may do thee ease
shall thy good uncle thy brother lucius
thou sit round about some fountain
looking all downwards behold our cheeks
miry slime left them by flood
fountain shall gaze so long
till fresh taste taken from clearness
made brine pit our bitter tears
or shall cut away our hands thine
or shall bite our tongues dumb shows
pass remainder our hateful days
what shall do let us have our tongues
plot some device further misery
lucius sweet father cease tears at grief
see how wretched sister sobs weeps
marcus patience dear niece good titus dry thine eyes
titus ah marcus marcus brother well wot
thy napkin cannot drink tear mine
thou poor man hast drownd thine own
lucius ah lavinia will wipe thy cheeks
titus mark marcus mark understand her signs
had she tongue speak now would she say
his napkin his true tears all bewet
can do no service her sorrowful cheeks
o what sympathy woe this
as far from help as limbo from bliss
enter aaron moor
aaron titus andronicus lord emperor
sends thee this word if thou love thy sons
let marcus lucius or thyself old titus
or any one chop off hand
will send thee hither both thy sons alive
shall ransom their fault
titus o gracious emperor o gentle aaron
did ever raven sing so lark
gives sweet tidings suns uprise
all heart i'll send emperor hand
good aaron wilt thou help chop off
lucius stay father noble hand thine
hath thrown down so many enemies
youth can better spare blood than
therefore mine shall save brothers' lives
marcus which hands hath not defended rome
rear'd aloft bloody battle axe
writing destruction enemy's castle
o none both but are high desert
hand hath been but idle let serve
ransom two nephews from their death
then have kept worthy end
fear they die before their pardon come
marcus hand shall go
lucius by heaven shall not go
titus sirs strive no more such with'red herbs as these
are meet plucking up therefore mine
lucius sweet father if shall thought thy son
let redeem brothers both from death
marcus our father's sake mother's care
now let show brother's love thee
lucius then i'll go fetch an axe
marcus but will use axe
exeunt lucius marcus
titus come hither aaron i'll deceive them both
lend thy hand will give thee mine
aaron aside if calld deceit will honest
never whilst live deceive men so
but i'll deceive another sort
you'll say ere half an hour pass
re enter lucius marcus
titus now stay strife what shall dispatch'd
good aaron give his majesty hand
tell him was hand warded him
from thousand dangers bid him bury
more hath merited let have
as sons say account them
as jewels purchas'd at an easy price
yet dear too because bought mine own
look by by have thy sons thee
aside their heads mean o how this villainy
doth fat very thoughts
let fools do good fair men call grace
aaron will have his soul black his face exit
titus o here lift this one hand up heaven
bow this feeble ruin earth
if any power pities wretched tears
call lavinia what would'st thou kneel
or our sighs we'll breathe welkin dim
stain sun fog as sometime clouds
when they do hug him their melting bosoms
marcus o brother speak possibility
do not break into these deep extremes
titus not sorrow deep having no bottom
then passions bottomless them
marcus but yet let reason govern thy lament
titus if there were reason these miseries
when heaven doth weep doth not earth o'erflow
if winds rage doth not sea wax mad
threat'ning welkin his big swoln face
wilt thou have reason this coil
am sea hark how her sighs do blow
she weeping welkin earth
then must sea moved her sighs
then must earth her continual tears
become deluge overflow'd drownd
but drunkard must vomit them
then give leave losers will have leave
ease their stomachs their bitter tongues
enter messenger two heads hand
messenger worthy andronicus ill art thou repaid
good hand thou sent'st emperor
here are heads thy two noble sons
here's thy hand scorn thee sent back
thy grief their sports thy resolution mock'd
more than remembrance father's death exit
marcus now let hot aetna cool sicily
heart an ever burning hell
these miseries are more than may borne
weep them weep doth ease some deal
but sorrow flouted at double death
lucius ah this sight should make so deep wound
yet detested life not shrink thereat
ever death should let life bear his name
lavinia kisses titus
marcus alas poor heart kiss comfortless
as frozen water starved snake
titus when will this fearful slumber have an end
marcus now farewell flatt'ry die andronicus
thou dost not slumber see thy two sons' heads
thy warlike hand thy mangled daughter here
thy other banish'd son this dear sight
struck pale bloodless thy brother
ah now no more will control thy griefs
rent off thy silver hair thy other hand
gnawing thy teeth this dismal sight
closing up our most wretched eyes
now time storm why art thou still
titus ha ha ha
marcus why dost thou laugh fits not this hour
titus why have not another tear shed
besides this sorrow an enemy
make them blind tributary tears
then which way shall find revenge's cave
these two heads do seem speak
threat shall never come bliss
till all these mischiefs returnd again
even their throats have committed them
come let see what task have do
heavy people circle about
may turn each one
vow made come brother take head
this hand other will bear
lavinia thou shalt employ'd this
bear thou hand sweet wench between thy teeth
as thee boy go get thee from sight
thou art an exile thou must not stay
hie goths raise an army there
if ye love as think do
let's kiss part have much do
lucius farewell andronicus noble father
woefullst man ever liv'd rome
farewell proud rome till lucius come again
he leaves his pledges dearer than his life
farewell lavinia noble sister
o would thou wert as thou tofore hast been
but now nor lucius nor lavinia lives
but oblivion hateful griefs
if lucius live he will requite wrongs
beg at gates tarquin his queen
now will goths raise pow'r
reveng'd rome saturnine exit
scene ii
rome titus' house
banquet
enter titus marcus lavinia boy young lucius
titus so so now sit look eat no more
than will preserve just so much strength us
marcus unknit sorrow wreathen knot
thy niece poor creatures want our hands
cannot passionate our tenfold grief
folded arms this poor right hand mine
left tyrannize upon breast
who when heart all mad misery
beats this hollow prison flesh
then thus thump down
lavinia thou map woe thus dost talk signs
thou canst not strike thus make still
wound sighing girl kill groans
or get some little knife between thy teeth
just against thy heart make thou hole
all tears thy poor eyes let fall
may run into sink soaking
drown lamenting fool sea salt tears
marcus fie brother fie teach her not thus lay
such violent hands upon her tender life
why marcus no man should mad but
what violent hands can she lay her life
ah wherefore dost thou urge name hands
bid aeneas tell tale twice o'er
how troy was burnt he made miserable
o handle not theme talk hands
lest remember still have none
fie fie how franticly square talk
as if should forget had no hands
come let's fall gentle girl eat this
here no drink hark marcus what she says
can interpret all her martyr'd signs
she says she drinks no other drink but tears
brew'd her sorrow mesh'd upon her cheeks
speechless complainer will learn thy thought
thy dumb action will as perfect
as begging hermits their holy prayers
thou shalt not sigh nor hold thy stumps heaven
but these will wrest an alphabet
by still practice learn know thy meaning
boy good grandsire leave these bitter deep laments
make aunt merry some pleasing tale
marcus alas tender boy passion mov'd
doth weep see his grandsire's heaviness
titus peace tender sapling thou art made tears
tears will quickly melt thy life away
marcus strikes dish knife
marcus at have killd lord fly
titus out thee murderer thou killst heart
mine eyes are cloy'd view tyranny
deed death done innocent
becomes not titus' brother get thee gone
see thou art not company
marcus alas lord have but killd fly
titus 'but' how if fly had father mother
how would he hang his slender gilded wings
poor harmless fly
his pretty buzzing melody
came here make us merry thou hast killd him
marcus pardon sir was black ill favour'd fly
empress' moor therefore killd him

then pardon reprehending thee

give thy knife will insult him

there's thyself that's tamora
ah sirrah

act iv scene

sweet poetry tully's orator
marcus canst thou not guess wherefore she plies thee thus

have heard grandsire say full oft
extremity griefs would make men mad
have read hecuba troy
ran mad sorrow made fear
loves as dear as e'er mother did

which made down throw books fly

mother gave

rome palace

all water ocean

although she lave them hourly flood
tell empress from am age

vigour picture youth
this before all world do prefer
this maugre all world will keep safe

fie treacherous hue will betray blushing
close enacts counsels thy heart
here's young lad fram'd another leer

what time threw people's suffrages

scene iv
rome before palace
enter emperor empress her two sons demetrius chiron
lords others emperor brings arrows his hand titus
shot at him
saturninus why lords what wrongs are these was ever seen
troubled confronted thus extent
egal justice us'd such contempt
lords know as know mightful gods
however these disturbers our peace
buzz people's ears there nought hath pass'd
but even law against wilful sons
old andronicus what an if
his sorrows have so overwhelm'd his wits
shall thus afflicted his wreaks
now he writes heaven his redress
see here's 'to jove' this 'to mercury'
this 'to apollo' this 'to god war'
sweet scrolls fly about streets rome
what's this but libelling against senate
blazoning our unjustice every where
goodly humour not lords
as who would say rome no justice were
but if live his feigned ecstasies
but he his shall know justice lives
saturninus' health whom if she sleep
he'll so awake as he fury shall
cut off proud'st conspirator lives
tamora gracious lord lovely saturnine
lord life commander thoughts
calm thee bear faults titus' age
th' effects sorrow his valiant sons
whose loss hath pierc'd him deep scarr'd his heart
than prosecute meanest or best
these contempts aside why thus shall become
high witted tamora gloze all
but titus have touch'd thee quick
thy life blood out if aaron now wise
then all safe anchor port
enter clown
how now good fellow wouldst thou speak us
clown yes forsooth an mistriship emperial
clown 'tis he god saint stephen give godden have
brought letter couple pigeons here
saturninus reads letter
saturninus go take him away hang him presently
clown how much money must have
tamora come sirrah must hang'd
clown hang'd by'r lady then have brought up neck fair
end exit guarded
saturninus despiteful intolerable wrongs
know from whence this same device proceeds
may this borne as if his traitorous sons
died by law murder our brother
have by means been butchered wrongfully
go drag villain hither by hair
nor age nor honour shall shape privilege
this proud mock i'll thy slaughterman
sly frantic wretch holp'st make great
hope thyself should govern rome
what news thee aemilius
aemilius arm lords rome never had more cause
goths have gathered head power
high resolved men bent spoil
they hither march amain under conduct
lucius son old andronicus
who threats course this revenge do
as much as ever coriolanus did
saturninus warlike lucius general goths
as flowers frost or grass beat down storms
ay now begins our sorrows approach
'tis he common people love so much
myself hath often heard them say
when have walked private man
lucius' banishment was wrongfully
they have wish'd lucius were their emperor
tamora why should fear not city strong
saturninus ay but citizens favour lucius
tamora king thy thoughts imperious thy name
sun dimm'd gnats do fly
eagle suffers little birds sing
not careful what they mean thereby
knowing shadow his wings
he can at pleasure stint their melody
even so mayest thou giddy men rome
then cheer thy spirit know thou emperor
will enchant old andronicus
than baits fish or honey stalks sheep
when as one wounded bait
other rotted delicious feed
saturninus but he will not entreat his son us
tamora if tamora entreat him then he will
can smooth fill his aged ears
golden promises were his heart
almost impregnable his old ears deaf
yet should both ear heart obey tongue
say emperor requests parley
warlike lucius appoint meeting
even at his father's house old andronicus
saturninus aemilius do this message honourably
if he stand hostage his safety
bid him demand what pledge will please him best
aemilius bidding shall do effectually exit
tamora now will old andronicus
temper him all art have
now sweet emperor blithe again
bury all thy fear devices
saturninus then go successantly plead him
empty
act v scene
plains near rome
enter lucius an army goths drums colours
lucius approved warriors faithful friends
have received letters from great rome
how desirous our sight they are
therefore great lords as titles witness
imperious impatient wrongs
wherein rome hath done any scath
let him make treble satisfaction
first goth brave slip sprung from great andronicus
whose name was once our terror now our comfort
whose high exploits honourable deeds
ingrateful rome requites foul contempt
stinging bees hottest summer's day
led by their master flow'red fields
aveng'd cursed tamora
all goths as he saith so say all him
lucius humbly thank him thank all
but who comes here led by lusty goth
enter goth leading aaron his child his arms
second goth renowned lucius from our troops stray'd
gaze upon ruinous monastery
upon wasted building suddenly
heard child cry underneath wall
made unto noise when soon heard
crying babe controlld this discourse
'peace tawny slave half half thy dam
did not thy hue bewray whose brat thou art
had nature lent thee but thy mother's look
villain thou mightst have been an emperor
but where bull cow are both milk white
peace villain peace' even thus he rates babe
'for must bear thee trusty goth
who when he knows thou art empress' babe
will hold thee dearly thy mother's sake'
this weapon drawn rush'd upon him
surpris'd him suddenly brought him hither
use as think needful man
lucius o worthy goth this incarnate devil
robb'd andronicus his good hand
here's base fruit her burning lust
say wall ey'd slave whither wouldst thou convey
this growing image thy fiend face
why dost not speak what deaf not word
halter soldiers hang him this tree
by his side his fruit bastardy
aaron touch not boy he royal blood
lucius too sire ever being good
first hang child he may see sprawl
get ladder
ladder brought which aaron made climb
aaron lucius save child
bear from emperess
if thou do this i'll show thee wondrous things
highly may advantage thee hear
if thou wilt not befall what may befall
i'll speak no more but 'vengeance rot all'
lucius say an if please which thou speak'st
aaron an if please thee why assure thee lucius
'twill vex thy soul hear what shall speak
must talk murders rapes massacres
acts black night abominable deeds
complots mischief treason villainies
ruthful hear yet piteously perform'd
this shall all buried death
unless thou swear child shall live
lucius tell thy mind say thy child shall live
lucius who should swear by thou believest no god
granted how canst thou believe an oath
aaron what if do not as indeed do not
yet know thou art religious
hast thing within thee called conscience
twenty popish tricks ceremonies
which have seen thee careful observe
therefore urge thy oath know
an idiot holds his bauble god
i'll urge him therefore thou shalt vow
by same god what god soe'er
thou adorest hast reverence
save boy nourish bring him up
or else will discover nought thee
lucius even by god swear thee will
aaron first know thou begot him empress
lucius o most insatiate luxurious woman
aaron tut lucius this was but deed charity
'twas her two sons murdered bassianus
they cut thy sister's tongue ravish'd her
cut her hands trimm'd her as thou sawest
lucius o detestable villain callst thou trimming
aaron why she was wash'd cut trimm'd 'twas
trim sport them which had doing
lucius o barbarous beastly villains thyself
aaron indeed was their tutor instruct them
codding spirit had they from their mother
bloody mind think they learnd
as true dog as ever fought at head
well let deeds witness worth
traind thy brethren guileful hole
where dead corpse bassianus lay
wrote letter thy father found
hid gold within letter mentiond
confederate queen her two sons
what not done thou hast cause rue
play'd cheater thy father's hand
when had drew myself apart
almost broke heart extreme laughter
pried through crevice wall
when his hand he had his two sons' heads
beheld his tears laugh'd so heartily
both mine eyes were rainy his
when told empress this sport
she swooned almost at pleasing tale
goth what canst thou say all this never blush
aaron ay black dog as saying
lucius art thou not sorry these heinous deeds
aaron ay had not done thousand more
even now curse day yet think
few come within compass curse
wherein did not some notorious ill
as kill man or else devise his death
ravish maid or plot way do
set deadly enmity between two friends
make poor mens cattle break their necks
set fire barns hay stacks night
bid owners quench them their tears
oft have digg'd up dead men from their graves
set them upright at their dear friends' door
even when their sorrows almost was forgot
their skins as bark trees
have knife carved roman letters
tut have done thousand dreadful things
as willingly as one would kill fly
nothing grieves heartily indeed
but cannot do ten thousand more
lucius bring down devil he must not die
so sweet death as hanging presently
aaron if there devils would were devil
live burn everlasting fire
so might have company hell
lucius sirs stop his mouth let him speak no more
enter aemilius
goth lord there messenger from rome
desires admitted presence
lucius let him come near
welcome aemilius what's news from rome
aemilius lord lucius princes goths
roman emperor greets all by
he understands are arms
willing demand hostages
they shall immediately deliver'd
first goth what says our general
lucius aemilius let emperor give his pledges
unto father uncle marcus
will come march away exeunt
scene ii
rome before titus' house
enter tamora her two sons demetrius chiron disguised
will encounter andronicus
say am revenge sent from below
join him right his heinous wrongs
knock at his study where they say he keeps
ruminate strange plots dire revenge
tell him revenge come join him
work confusion his enemies
they knock titus opens his study door above
titus who doth molest contemplation
so sad decrees may fly away
all study no effect
are deceiv'd what mean do
see here bloody lines have set down
what written shall executed
tamora titus am come talk thee
titus no not word how can grace talk
wanting hand give accord
thou hast odds therefore no more
titus am not mad know thee well enough
witness this wretched stump witness these crimson lines
witness these trenches made by grief care
witness tiring day heavy night
witness all sorrow know thee well
our proud empress mighty tamora
not thy coming other hand
tamora know thou sad man am not tamora
she thy enemy thy friend
ease gnawing vulture thy mind
by working wreakful vengeance thy foes
come down welcome this world's light
confer murder death
there's not hollow cave or lurking place
no vast obscurity or misty vale
where bloody murder or detested rape
can couch fear but will find them out
their ears tell them dreadful name
titus art thou revenge art thou sent
torment mine enemies
tamora am therefore come down welcome
titus do some service ere come thee
lo by thy side where rape murder stands
now give some surance thou art revenge
stab them or tear them thy chariot wheels
then i'll come thy waggoner
whirl along thee about globes
hale thy vengeful waggon swift away
find out murderers their guilty caves
when thy car loaden their heads
will dismount by thy waggon wheel
trot servile footman all day long
even from hyperions rising east
until his very downfall sea
day by day i'll do this heavy task
so thou destroy rapine murder there
titus are they thy ministers what are they calld
tamora rape murder therefore called so
'cause they take vengeance such kind men
titus good lord how empress' sons they are
empress but worldly men
have miserable mad mistaking eyes
o sweet revenge now do come thee
if one arm's embracement will content thee
will embrace thee by by
whate'er forge feed his brain sick humours
do uphold maintain speeches
now he firmly takes revenge
being credulous this mad thought
i'll make him send lucius his son
whilst at banquet hold him sure
i'll find some cunning practice out hand
scatter disperse giddy goths
or at least make them his enemies
enter titus below
titus long have been forlorn all thee

how empress her sons are
well are fitted had but moor
could not all hell afford such devil
well wot empress never wags
but her company there moor

but welcome as are what shall do

marcus sad fac'd men people sons rome
by uproars sever'd as flight fowl
o let teach how knit again
this scattered corn into one mutual sheaf
these broken limbs again into one body
lest rome herself bane unto herself
she whom mighty kingdoms curtsy
forlorn desperate castaway
do shameful execution herself
but if frosty signs chaps age
grave witnesses true experience
lucius speak rome's dear friend as erst our ancestor
when his solemn tongue he did discourse
love sick dido's sad attending ear
story baleful burning night
when subtle greeks surpris'd king priam's troy
tell us what sinon hath bewitch'd our ears
or who hath brought fatal engine
gives our troy our rome civil wound
heart not compact flint nor steel
but floods tears will drown oratory
break utt'rance even time
when should move ye attend most
force commiseration
here's rome's young captain let him tell tale
while stand by weep hear him speak
lucius then gracious auditory known
chiron damnd demetrius
were they murd'red our emperor's brother
their fell faults our brothers were beheaded
our father's tears despis'd basely cozend
true hand fought rome's quarrel out
sent her enemies unto grave
lastly myself unkindly banished
gates shut turnd weeping out
beg relief among rome's enemies
who drownd their enmity true tears
op'd their arms embrace as friend
have preserv'd her welfare blood
from her bosom took enemy's point
sheathing steel advent'rous body
alas know am no vaunter
scars can witness dumb although they are
report just full truth
but soft methinks do digress too much
citing worthless praise o pardon
when no friends are by men praise themselves
pointing child an attendant's arms
this was tamora delivered
issue an irreligious moor
chief architect plotter these woes
villain alive titus' house
damnd as he witness this true
now judge what cause had titus revenge
these wrongs unspeakable past patience

poor remainder andronici

nature puts heavy task

sung thee asleep his loving breast thy pillow
many story hath he told thee
bid thee bear his pretty tales mind
talk them when he was dead gone
when they were living warm'd themselves thine
o now sweet boy give them their latest kiss
bid him farewell commit him grave
do them kindness take leave them
boy o grandsire grandsire ev'n all heart

tears will choke if ope mouth
re enter attendants aaron
give sentence execrable wretch
hath been breeder these dire events

if any one relieves or pities him
offence he dies this our doom
some stay see him fast'ned earth
aaron ah why should wrath mute fury dumb
am no baby base prayers
ten thousand worse than ever yet did
would perform if might have will
if one good deed all life did
do repent from very soul
lucius some loving friends convey emperor hence
give him burial his father's grave
father lavinia shall forthwith
closed our household's monument
as ravenous tiger tamora
no mournful bell shall ring her burial
but throw her forth beasts birds prey
her life was beastly devoid pity
being dead let birds her take pity exeunt

ravish'd helen menelaus' queen
wanton paris sleeps that's quarrel

sets all hazard hither am come

conditions as our argument

now good or bad 'tis but chance war

words vows gifts tears love's full sacrifice
he offers another's enterprise
but more troilus thousand fold see
than glass pandar's praise may
yet hold off women are angels wooing
things won are done joy's soul lies doing
men prize thing ungaind more than
she was never yet ever knew
love got so sweet as when desire did sue
therefore this maxim out love teach
achievement command ungaind beseech
then though heart's content firm love doth bear
nothing shall from mine eyes appear exit
act scene 3
grecian camp before agamemnons tent
agamemnon princes
what grief hath set these jaundies o'er cheeks
ample proposition hope makes
all designs begun earth below
fails promis'd largeness checks disasters
grow veins actions highest rear'd
as knots by conflux meeting sap
infects sound pine diverts his grain
tortive errant from his course growth
come short our suppose so far
after seven years' siege yet troy walls stand
sith every action hath gone before
whereof have record trial did draw
bias thwart not answering aim
unbodied figure thought
gave't surmised shape why then princes
do cheeks abash'd behold our works
call them shames which are indeed nought else
find persistive constancy men
fineness which metal not found
fortune's love then bold coward
wise fool artist unread
hard soft seem all affind kin
but wind tempest her frown
distinction broad powerful fan
puffing at all winnows light away
what hath mass or matter by itself
nestor due observance thy godlike seat
great agamemnon nestor shall apply
thy latest words reproof chance
lies true proof men sea being smooth
how many shallow bauble boats dare sail
upon her patient breast making their way
those nobler bulk
but let ruffian boreas once enrage
gentle thetis anon behold
bounding between two moist elements
perseus' horse where's then saucy boat
whose weak untimber'd sides but even now
co rivalld greatness either harbour fled
or made toast neptune even so
doth valour's show valour's worth divide
storms fortune her ray brightness
herd hath more annoyance by breeze
than by tiger but when splitting wind
flies fled under shade why then thing courage
as rous'd rage rage doth sympathise
an accent tund self same key
retorts chiding fortune
ulysses agamemnon
thou great commander nerve bone greece
heart our numbers soul only spirit
whom tempers minds all
should shut up hear what ulysses speaks
which agamemnon most mighty thy place sway
nestor thou most reverend thy stretch'd out life
give both speeches which were such
as agamemnon hand greece
should hold up high brass such again
as venerable nestor hatch'd silver
should bond air strong as axle tree
which heaven rides knit all greekish ears
his experienc'd tongue yet let please both
agamemnon speak prince ithaca be't less expect
matter needless importless burden
divide thy lips than are confident
when rank thersites opes his mastic jaws
shall hear music wit oracle
ulysses troy yet upon his basis had been down
great hector's sword had lack'd master
but these instances
specialty rule hath been neglected
hollow upon this plain so many hollow factions
when general not hive
whom foragers shall all repair
what honey expected degree being vizarded
th' unworthiest shows as fairly mask
heavens themselves planets this centre
observe degree priority place
insisture course proportion season form
office custom all line order
noble eminence enthrond spher'd
amidst other whose med'cinable eye
corrects ill aspects planets evil
posts commandment king
sans check good bad but when planets
evil mixture disorder wander
what plagues what portents what mutiny
what raging sea shaking earth
commotion winds frights changes horrors
unity married calm states
quite from their fixture o when degree shak'd
which ladder all high designs
enterprise sick how could communities
degrees schools brotherhoods cities
peaceful commerce from dividable shores
primogenity due birth
prerogative age crowns sceptres laurels
but by degree stand authentic place
hark what discord follows each thing melts
mere oppugnancy bounded waters
should lift their bosoms higher than shores
make sop all this solid globe
strength should lord imbecility
rude son should strike his father dead
force should right or rather right wrong
between whose endless jar justice resides
should lose their names so should justice too
power into will will into appetite
appetite an universal wolf
so doubly seconded will power
must make perforce an universal prey
last eat up himself great agamemnon
this chaos when degree suffocate
follows choking
this neglection degree
by pace goes backward purpose
by him one step below he by next
next by him beneath so ever step
exampld by first pace sick
his superior grows an envious fever
pale bloodless emulation
'tis this fever keeps troy foot
not her own sinews end tale length
troy our weakness stands not her strength
nestor most wisely hath ulysses here discover'd
agamemnon nature sickness found ulysses
what remedy
ulysses great achilles whom opinion crowns
sinew forehand our host
having his ear full his airy fame
grows dainty his worth his tent
lies mocking our designs him patroclus
upon lazy bed livelong day
breaks scurril jests
which slanderer he imitation calls
he pageants us sometime great agamemnon
thy topless deputation he puts
strutting player whose conceit
lies his hamstring doth think rich
hear wooden dialogue sound
'twixt his stretch'd footing scaffoldage
such pitied o'er wrested seeming
he acts thy greatness when he speaks
which from tongue roaring typhon dropp'd
would seem hyperboles at this fusty stuff
large achilles his press'd bed lolling
from his deep chest laughs out loud applause
cries 'excellent 'tis agamemnon just
now play nestor hem stroke thy beard
as he being drest some oration'
that's done as near as extremest ends
parallels as vulcan his wife
'tis nestor right now play him patroclus
arming answer night alarm'
then forsooth faint defects age
must scene mirth cough spit
palsy fumbling his gorget
shake out rivet at this sport
sir valour dies cries 'o enough patroclus
or give ribs steel shall split all
pleasure spleen' this fashion
severals generals grace exact
achievements plots orders preventions
excitements field or speech truce
success or loss what or not serves
as stuff these two make paradoxes
nestor imitation these twain
who as ulysses says opinion crowns
an imperial voice many are infect

as broad achilles keeps his tent him
makes factious feasts rails our state war
bold as an oracle sets thersites
slave whose gall coins slanders mint
match us comparisons dirt
weaken discredit our exposure
how rank soever rounded danger
ulysses they tax our policy call cowardice
count wisdom as no member war
but hand still mental parts
do contrive how many hands shall strike
when fitness calls them know by measure
their observant toil enemies' weight
why this hath not finger's dignity
they call this bed work mapp'ry closet war
so ram batters down wall

by reason guide his execution

act ii scene 2
troy priam's palace
enter priam hector troilus paris helenus
priam after so many hours lives speeches spent
'deliver helen all damage else
as honour loss time travail expense
wounds friends what else dear consum'd
hot digestion this cormorant war
shall struck off' hector what say to't
hector though no man lesser fears greeks than
as far as toucheth particular
yet dread priam
there no lady more softer bowels
more ready cry out 'who knows what follows'
than hector wound peace surety
surety secure but modest doubt calld
beacon wise tent searches
th' bottom worst let helen go
since first sword was drawn about this question
every tithe soul 'mongst many thousand dismes
hath been as dear as helen mean ours
if have lost so many tenths ours
had our name value one ten
what merit's reason which denies
yielding her up
troilus fie fie brother
weigh worth honour king
so great as our dread father's scale
common ounces will counters sum
past proportion his infinite
buckle waist most fathomless
as fears reasons fie godly shame
helenus no marvel though bite so sharp at reasons
are so empty them should not our father
bear great sway his affairs reasons
because speech hath none tells him so
troilus are dreams slumbers brother priest
fur gloves reason here are reasons
know an enemy intends harm
know sword employ'd perilous
who marvels then when helenus beholds
grecian his sword if he do set
very wings reason his heels
fly chidden mercury from jove
or star disorb'd nay if talk reason
let's shut our gates sleep manhood honour
should have hare hearts would they but fat their thoughts
this cramm'd reason reason respect
make livers pale lustihood deject
keeping
troilus what's aught but as 'tis valued
hector but value dwells not particular will
holds his estimate dignity
as well wherein 'tis precious itself
as prizer 'tis mad idolatry
make service greater than god
will dotes attributive
what infectiously itself affects
troilus take day wife election
led conduct will
will enkindled by mine eyes ears
two traded pilots 'twixt dangerous shores
will judgment how may avoid
although will distaste what elected
wife chose there can no evasion
blench from this stand firm by honour
turn not back silks upon merchant
do not throw unrespective sieve
because now are full was thought meet
paris should do some vengeance greeks
breath full consent benied his sails
seas winds old wranglers took truce
did him service he touch'd ports desir'd
an old aunt whom greeks held captive
he brought grecian queen whose youth freshness
wrinkles apollo's makes stale morning
she worth keeping why she pearl
whose price hath launch'd above thousand ships
turnd crownd kings merchants
if you'll avouch 'twas wisdom paris went
as must needs all cried 'go go'
if you'll confess he brought home worthy prize
as must needs all clapp'd hands
cried 'inestimable' why do now
issue proper wisdoms rate
beggar estimation which priz'd
richer than sea land o theft most base
have stoln what do fear keep
but thieves unworthy thing so stoln
their country did them disgrace
fear warrant our native place
cassandra within cry troyans cry
priam what noise what shriek this
troilus 'tis our mad sister do know her voice
hector cassandra
enter cassandra raving
cassandra cry troyans cry lend ten thousand eyes
will fill them prophetic tears
hector peace sister peace
cassandra virgins boys mid age wrinkled eld
soft infancy nothing canst but cry
add clamours let us pay betimes
moiety mass moan come
troy must not nor goodly ilion stand
our firebrand brother paris burns us all
cry troyans cry helen woe
cry cry troy burns or else let helen go exit
hector now youthful troilus do not these high strains
divination our sister work
some touches remorse or blood
so madly hot no discourse reason
nor fear bad success bad cause
troilus why brother hector
may not think justness each act
such no other than event doth form
nor once deject courage our minds
because cassandra's mad her brain sick raptures
cannot distaste goodness quarrel
which hath our several honours all engag'd
make gracious private part
am no more touch'd than all priam's sons
such things as might offend weakest spleen
fight maintain
paris else might world convince levity
as well undertakings as counsels
but attest gods full consent
gave wings propension cut
all fears attending so dire project
what alas can these single arms
what propugnation one mans valour
this quarrel would excite yet protest
were alone pass difficulties
had as ample power as have will
paris should ne'er retract what he hath done
nor faint pursuit
priam paris speak
one besotted sweet delights
have honey still but these gall
so valiant no praise at all
pleasures such beauty brings
but would have soil her fair rape
wip'd off honourable keeping her
what treason were ransack'd queen
disgrace great worths shame
now deliver her possession up
terms base compulsion can
so degenerate strain as this
should once set footing generous bosoms
without heart dare or sword draw
when helen defended nor none so noble
whose life were ill bestow'd or death unfam'd
where helen subject then say
well may fight her whom know well
world's large spaces cannot parallel
hector paris troilus have both said well
cause question now hand
have gloz'd but superficially not much
unfit hear moral philosophy
reasons allege do more conduce
hot passion distemp'red blood
than make up free determination
'twixt right wrong pleasure revenge
have ears more deaf than adders voice
any true decision nature craves
all dues rend'red their owners now
what nearer debt all humanity
nature corrupted through affection
great minds partial indulgence
their benumbed wills resist same
there law each well order'd nation
curb those raging appetites are
most disobedient refractory
if helen then wife sparta's king
as known she these moral laws
nature nations speak aloud
doing wrong extenuates not wrong
but makes much more heavy hector's opinion
this way truth yet ne'er less
spritely brethren propend
resolution keep helen still
'tis cause hath no mean dependence
upon our joint several dignities
troilus why there touch'd life our design
were not glory more affected
would not wish drop troyan blood
spent more her defence but worthy hector
she theme honour renown
spur valiant magnanimous deeds
whose present courage may beat down our foes
fame time come canonize us
presume brave hector would not lose
so rich advantage promis'd glory
as smiles upon forehead this action
hector am yours
valiant offspring great priamus
have roisting challenge sent amongst
dull factious nobles greeks
will strike amazement their drowsy spirits
was advertis'd their great general slept
whilst emulation army crept
this presume will wake him exeunt

here comes patroclus
nestor no achilles him
ulysses elephant hath joints but none courtesy his legs
patroclus achilles bids say he much sorry
if any thing more than sport pleasure
did move greatness this noble state
call upon him he hopes no other
but health digestion sake
an after dinner's breath
agamemnon hear patroclus
are too well acquainted these answers
but his evasion wing'd thus swift scorn
much attribute he hath much reason
why ascribe him yet all his virtues
not virtuously his own part beheld
do our eyes begin lose their gloss
yea fair fruit an unwholesome dish
are rot untasted go tell him
come speak him shall not sin
if do say think him over proud
under honest self assumption greater
here tend savage strangeness he puts
disguise holy strength their command
underwrite an observing kind
his humorous predominance yea watch
his pettish lunes his ebbs his flows as if
passage whole carriage this action
rode his tide go tell him this ad
if he overhold his price so much
we'll none him but let him an engine
bring action hither this cannot go war
stirring dwarf do allowance give
before sleeping giant tell him so
patroclus shall bring his answer presently exit
agamemnon second voice we'll not satisfied
come speak him ulysses enter
exit ulysses
ajax what he more than another
agamemnon no more than what he thinks he
man than am

agamemnon no noble ajax are as strong as valiant as wise

what pride

fairer he proud eats up himself pride his own glass

re enter ulysses
ajax do hate proud man as do hate engend'ring toads
nestor aside yet he loves himself is't not strange

agamemnon what's his excuse
ulysses he doth rely none
but carries stream his dispose
without observance or respect any
agamemnon why will he not upon our fair request
untent his person share air us
ulysses things small as nothing request's sake only
he makes important possess'd he greatness
speaks not himself but pride
quarrels at self breath imagind worth
holds his blood such swoln hot discourse
'twixt his mental his active parts
kingdom'd achilles commotion rages
he so plaguy proud death tokens
cry 'no recovery'
agamemnon let ajax go him
dear lord go greet him his tent
'tis said he holds well will led
at request little from himself
ulysses o agamemnon let not so
we'll consecrate steps ajax makes
when they go from achilles shall proud lord
never suffers matter world
enter his thoughts save such as doth revolve
ruminate himself shall he worshipp'd
hold an idol more than he
no this thrice worthy right valiant lord
shall not so stale his palm nobly acquir'd

are without him as place riches favour

cannot make boast have which he hath

as when his virtues shining upon others
heat them they retort heat again
first giver
beauty borne here face
bearer knows not but commends itself
others' eyes nor doth eye itself
most pure spirit sense behold itself
not going from itself but eye eye opposed
salutes each other each other's form
speculation turns not itself
till hath travelld mirror'd there
where may see itself this not strange at all
familiar but at author's drift
who his circumstance expressly proves
no man lord anything
though him there much consisting
till he communicate his parts others
nor doth he himself know them aught
till he behold them formed th' applause
where th' are extended who an arch reverb'rate
voice again or gate steel
his figure his heat was much rapt this
apprehended here immediately
th' unknown ajax heavens what man there
very horse has he knows not what
nature what things there are
most abject regard dear use
what things again most dear esteem
poor worth now shall see morrow
an act very chance doth throw upon him
while some men leave do
how some men creep skittish fortune's hall
whiles others play idiots her eyes
how one man eats into another's pride
while pride fasting his wantonness
see these grecian lords why even already
they clap lubber ajax shoulder
as if his foot were brave hector's breast
great troy shrinking
as misers do by beggars neither gave
good word nor look what are deeds forgot

wherein he puts alms oblivion
great siz'd monster ingratitudes
those scraps are good deeds past which are devour'd
as fast as they are made forgot as soon
as done perseverance dear lord
keeps honour bright have done hang
monumental mock'ry take instant way
honour travels strait so narrow
where one but goes abreast keep then path
emulation hath thousand sons
one by one pursue if give way
or hedge aside from direct forthright
an ent'red tide they all rush by
leave hindmost
or gallant horse falln first rank
o'er run trampled then what they do present
though less than yours past must o'ertop yours
time fashionable host
slightly shakes his parting guest by th' hand
his arms out stretch'd as he would fly
grasps corner welcome ever smiles

remuneration thing was
beauty wit
love friendship charity are subjects all
envious calumniating time
one touch nature makes whole world kin
all one consent praise new born gawds
though they are made moulded things past
give dust little gilt
more laud than gilt o'er dusted
present eye praises present object
then marvel not thou great complete man
since things motion sooner catch eye
than what stirs not cry went once thee
still might yet may again
if thou wouldst not entomb thyself alive
case thy reputation thy tent
whose glorious deeds but these fields late
made emulous missions 'mongst gods themselves
drave great mars faction

reasons are more potent heroical

one priam's daughters

there mystery whom relation
durst never meddle soul state
which hath an operation more divine
than breath or pen can give expressure

act iv scene 1
troy street

witness process speech wherein
told how diomed whole week by days
did haunt field
aeneas health valiant sir

as heart can think or courage execute
our bloods are now calm so long health
but when contention occasion meet
by jove i'll play hunter thy life
all force pursuit policy
aeneas thou shalt hunt lion will fly

every joint wound morrow

diomedeswe do long know each other worse

bitter disposition time

who thoughts deserves fair helen best
myself or menelaus
diomedes both alike
he merits well have her doth seek her
not making any scruple her soilure
such hell pain world charge
as well keep her defend her
not palating taste her dishonour
such costly loss wealth friends
lees dregs flat tamed piece
lecher out whorish loins
are pleas'd breed out inheritors
both merits pois'd each weighs nor less nor more
but he as he heavier whore
paris are too bitter country woman
diomedes she's bitter her country hear paris
every false drop her bawdy veins
grecians life hath sunk every scruple
troyan hath been slain since she could speak
she hath not given so many good words breath
as her greeks troyans suff'red death
paris fair diomed do as chapmen do
dispraise thing desire buy
but silence hold this virtue well
we'll not commend what intend sell
here lies our way exeunt
act iv scene 2

act v scene 3

rob behalf charity
cassandra purpose makes strong vow
unarm sweet hector
hector hold still say
mine honour keeps weather fate
life every man holds dear but dear man
holds honour far more precious dear than life
enter troilus
how now young man meanst thou fight day
andromache cassandra call father persuade
exit cassandra
am day i' th' vein chivalry
let grow thy sinews till their knots strong
tempt not yet brushes war
unarm thee go doubt thou not brave boy
i'll stand day thee troy
troilus brother have vice mercy
which better fits lion than man
hector what vice good troilus
chide
even fan wind fair sword
bid them rise live
hector o 'tis fair play
troilus fools play by heaven hector
hector how now how now
troilus th' love all gods
let's leave hermit pity our mother
when have our armours buckled
venom'd vengeance ride upon our swords
hector fie savage fie
troilus hector then 'tis wars
hector troilus would not have fight day
troilus who should withhold
not fate obedience nor hand mars
beck'ning fiery truncheon retire
not priamus hecuba knees
their eyes o'ergalled recourse tears
nor brother true sword drawn
but by ruin
re enter cassandra priam
cassandra lay hold upon him priam hold him fast
he thy crutch now if thou lose thy stay
thou him leaning all troy thee
fall all together
priam come hector come go back
thy wife hath dreamt thy mother hath had visions
cassandra doth foresee myself
tell thee this day ominous
therefore come back
hector aeneas field
do stand engag'd many greeks
even faith valour appear
this morning them
priam ay but thou shalt not go
hector must not break faith
know dutiful therefore dear sir
take course by consent voice
which do here forbid royal priam
cassandra o priam yield not him
andromache do not dear father
hector andromache am offended
upon love bear get
exit andromache
troilus this foolish dreaming superstitious girl
makes all these bodements
look how thou diest look how thy eye turns pale
look how thy wounds do bleed at many vents
hark how troy roars how hecuba cries out
how poor andromache shrills her dolours forth
behold distraction frenzy amazement
witless antics one another meet
all cry hector hector's dead o hector
troilus away away
cassandra farewell yet soft hector take leave
hector are amaz'd liege at her exclaim
go cheer town we'll forth fight
do deeds worth praise tell them at night
priam farewell gods safety stand about thee
exeunt severally priam hector alarums
troilus they are at hark proud diomed believe
come lose arm or win sleeve
enter pandarus
pandarus do hear lord do hear
pandarus here's letter come from yond poor girl
troilus let read
pandarus whoreson tisick whoreson rascally tisick so troubles
foolish fortune this girl what one thing
what another shall leave one o' th's days have
rheum mine eyes too such an ache bones
unless man were curs'd cannot tell what think ont what
says she there

tearing letter
go wind wind there turn change together
love words errors still she feeds
but edifies another her deeds exeunt severally

plain between troy grecian camp

act v scene 5
another part plain
enter diomedes servant

present fair steed lady cressid
fellow commend service her beauty

enter agamemnon
agamemnon renew renew fierce polydamus
hath beat down enon bastard margarelon
hath doreus prisoner
stands colossus wise waving his beam
upon pashed corses kings
epistrophus cedius polixenes slain
patroclus ta'en or slain palamedes
sore hurt bruis'd dreadful sagittary
appals our numbers haste diomed
reinforcement or perish all
enter nestor
nestor go bear patroclus' body achilles
bid snail pac'd ajax arm shame
there thousand hectors field
now here he fights galathe his horse
there they fly or die scaled sculls
before belching whale then he yonder
there strawy greeks ripe his edge
fall down before him mower's swath
here there everywhere he leaves takes
dexterity so obeying appetite
what he will he does does so much
proof calld impossibility
enter ulysses
achilles arming weeping cursing vowing vengeance
patroclus' wounds have rous'd his drowsy blood
together his mangled myrmidons
noseless handless hack'd chipp'd come
him crying hector ajax hath lost friend
foams at mouth he arm'd at
roaring troilus who hath done day
mad fantastic execution
engaging redeeming himself
as if luck very spite cunning
bade him win all

happy arms are out use

till when go seek thy fortune exit
would have been much more fresher man
had expected thee

how now brother

another part plain

act v scene 9
