act v scene 10
enter aeneas paris antenor deiphobus
aeneas stand ho yet are masters field
never go home here starve out night
enter troilus
troilus hector slain
all hector gods forbid
troilus he's dead at murderer's horse's tail
beastly sort dragg'd through shameful field
frown heavens effect rage speed
say at once let brief plagues mercy
linger not our sure destructions
aeneas lord do discomfort all host
troilus understand not tell so
do not speak flight fear death
but dare all imminence gods men
address their dangers hector gone
who shall tell priam so or hecuba
let him will screech owl aye calld
there word will priam turn stone
make wells niobes maids wives
cold statues youth word
scare troy out itself but march away
hector dead there no more say
stay yet vile abominable tents
thus proudly pight upon our phrygian plains
let titan rise as early as he dare
i'll through through thou great siz'd coward
i'll haunt thee wicked conscience still
mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts
strike free march troy comfort go
hope revenge shall hide our inward woe
enter pandarus
pandarus but hear hear
troilus hence broker lackey ignominy shame
pursue thy life live aye thy name
exeunt all but pandarus
poor agent despis'd traitors bawds how earnestly are
set work how ill requited why should our endeavour
so lov'd performance so loathed what verse what
instance let see
full merrily humble bee doth sing
till he hath lost his honey his sting
being once subdu'd armed trail
sweet honey sweet notes together fail
good traders flesh set this painted
eyes half out weep out at pandar's fall
or if cannot weep yet give some groans
though not yet aching bones
brethren sisters hold door trade
some two months hence will shall here made
should now but fear this
some galled goose winchester would hiss
till then i'll sweat seek about eases
at time bequeath diseases exit
empty
twelfth night or what will
by william shakespeare

act scene
duke's palace
enter orsino duke illyria curio other lords musicians attending
duke if music food love play
give excess surfeiting
appetite may sicken so die
strain again had dying fall
o came o'er ear sweet sound
stealing giving odour enough no more
'tis not so sweet now as was before
o spirit love how quick fresh art thou
notwithstanding thy capacity
receiveth as sea nought enters there
what validity pitch soe'er
but falls into abatement low price
even minute so full shapes fancy
alone high fantastical
duke what curio
curio hart
duke why so do noblest have
o when mine eyes did see olivia first
methought she purg'd air pestilence
instant was turnd into hart
desires fell cruel hounds
e'er since pursue
enter valentine
valentine so please lord might not admitted
but from her handmaid do return this answer
element itself till seven years' heat
shall not behold her face at ample view
but cloistress she will veiled walk
water once day her chamber round
eye offending brine all this season
brother's dead love which she would keep fresh
lasting her sad remembrance
pay this debt love but brother
how will she love when rich golden shaft
hath killd flock all affections else
live her when liver brain heart
these sovereign thrones are all supplied filld
her sweet perfections one self king
away before sweet beds flow'rs
love thoughts lie rich when canopied bow'rs
empty
sea coast
enter viola captain sailors
viola what country friends this
captain this illyria lady
viola what should do illyria
brother he elysium
perchance he not drownd what think sailors
captain perchance yourself were saved
viola o poor brother so perchance may he
assure yourself after our ship did split
when those poor number saved
hung our driving boat saw brother
most provident peril bind himself
courage hope both teaching him practice
strong mast liv'd upon sea
where arion dolphins back
saw him hold acquaintance waves
so long as could see
mine own escape unfoldeth hope
whereto thy speech serves authority
him know'st thou this country
captain ay madam well was bred born
not three hours' travel from this very place
viola who governs here
captain noble duke nature as name
viola what his name
captain orsino
he was bachelor then
captain so now or was so very late
but month ago went from hence
then 'twas fresh murmur as know
what great ones do less will prattle
he did seek love fair olivia
viola what's she
captain virtuous maid daughter count
died some twelvemonth since then leaving her
who shortly also died whose dear love
they say she hath abjur'd company
sight men
viola o serv'd lady
might not delivered world
till had made mine own occasion mellow
what estate
captain were hard compass
because she will admit no kind suit
viola there fair behaviour thee captain
though nature beauteous wall
doth oft close pollution yet thee
will believe thou hast mind suits
this thy fair outward character
prithee i'll pay thee bounteously
conceal what am aid
such disguise as haply shall become
form intent i'll serve this duke
may worth thy pains can sing
speak him many sorts music
will allow very worth his service
what else may hap time will commit
only shape thou silence wit
captain his eunuch mute i'll
when tongue blabs then let mine eyes not see
viola thank thee lead exeunt

believe does harm wit

morrow sir toby

scene iv
enter valentine viola mans attire
valentine if duke continue these favours towards cesario
are much advanc'd he hath known but three
days already are no stranger

question continuance his love he inconstant sir
his favours
valentine no believe
enter duke curio attendants
duke who saw cesario ho
viola attendance lord here
duke stand awhile aloof cesario
thou know'st no less but all have unclasp'd
thee book even secret soul
therefore good youth address thy gait unto her
not denied access stand at her doors
tell them there thy fixed foot shall grow
till thou have audience
if she so abandond her sorrow
as spoke she never will admit
duke clamorous leap all civil bounds
rather than make unprofited return
viola say do speak her lord what then
duke o then unfold passion love
surprise her discourse dear faith
shall become thee well act woes
she will attend better thy youth
viola think not so lord
duke dear lad believe
they shall yet belie thy happy years
say thou art man diana's lip
not more smooth rubious thy small pipe
as maidens organ shrill sound
all semblative womans part
know thy constellation right apt
this affair some four or five attend him
when least company prosper well this
thou shalt live as freely as thy lord
call his fortunes thine
viola i'll do best
woo lady aside yet barful strife
whoe'er woo myself would his wife

olivia's house
enter maria clown

fear no colours

empty

fools let them use their talents

away let summer bear out

gaskins fall

as any illyria

enter olivia malvolio
clown wit ant thy will put into good fooling those wits
think they have thee do very oft prove fools am
quinapalus 'better witty fool than foolish wit' god bless
thee lady
olivia take fool away
clown do not hear fellows take away lady
olivia go y'are dry fool i'll no more besides
grow dishonest
clown two faults madonna drink good counsel will amend
give dry fool drink then fool not dry bid
dishonest man mend himself if he mend he no longer
that's mended but patch'd virtue transgresses but
patch'd sin sin amends but patch'd virtue
if this simple syllogism will serve so if will not
what remedy as there no true cuckold but calamity so
beauty's flower lady bade take away fool therefore
say again take her away

infirmity decays wise doth ever make better fool

increasing folly sir toby will sworn am no fox

rascal saw him put down other day an ordinary fool
has no more brain than stone look now he's out

he gagg'd protest take these wise men crow so at
these set kind fools no better than fools' zanies

questions out part good gentle one give modest

viola no profound heart yet by very fangs malice

what yours bestow not yours reserve but this from

show heart message
viola alas took great pains study 'tis poetical
olivia more feigned pray keep
heard were saucy at gates allow'd approach
rather wonder at than hear if not mad
gone if have reason brief 'tis not time moon
make one so skipping dialogue

some mollification giant sweet lady

full peace as matter

viola answer by method first his heart
olivia o have read heresy have no more say
olivia have any commission from lord negotiate
face are now out text but will draw curtain
show picture unveiling look sir such one
was this present is't not well done
viola excellently done if god did all
olivia 'tis grain sir 'twill endure wind weather
viola 'tis beauty truly blent whose red white
nature's own sweet cunning hand laid
lady are cruellst she alive
leave world no copy
olivia o sir will not so hard hearted will give out
divers schedules beauty shall inventoried every
particle utensil labelld will as item two lips
indifferent red item two grey eyes lids them item one

love without retention or restraint
all his dedication his sake
did expose myself pure his love

sebastian spirit am indeed
but am dimension grossly clad
which from womb did participate
were woman as rest goes even
should tears let fall upon cheek
say 'thrice welcome drowned viola'
viola father had mole upon his brow
sebastian so had mine
had numb'red thirteen years
sebastian o record lively soul
he finished indeed his mortal act
day made sister thirteen years
viola if nothing lets make us happy both
but this masculine usurp'd attire
do not embrace till each circumstance
place time fortune do cohere jump
am viola which confirm
where lie maiden weeds by whose gentle help
was preserv'd serve this noble count
all occurrence fortune since
hath been between this lady this lord
sebastian olivia so comes lady have been mistook
but nature her bias drew
would have been contracted maid
nor are therein by life deceiv'd
are betroth'd both maid man
if this so as yet glass seems true
shall have share this most happy wreck
viola boy thou hast said thousand times
thou never shouldst love woman
viola all those sayings will overswear
all those swearings keep as true soul
as doth orbed continent fire
severs day from night
duke give thy hand
viola captain did bring first shore
hath maid's garments he upon some action
now durance at malvolio's suit
gentleman follower lady's

they say poor gentleman he's much distract

most extracting frenzy mine own

must not now deny hand

can say none this well grant then
tell modesty honour
why have given such clear lights favour
bade come smiling cross garter'd
put yellow stockings frown
acting this an obedient hope
why have suffer'd imprisond
kept dark house visited by priest
made most notorious geck gul
e'er invention play'd tell why

though confess much character

now do bethink was she
such forms which here were presuppos'd
upon thee letter prithee content
this practice hath most shrewdly pass'd upon thee
but when know grounds authors
thou shalt both plaintiff judge
thine own cause
fabian good madam hear speak
let no quarrel nor no brawl come
taint condition this present hour
most freely confess myself toby
set this device against malvolio here
upon some stubborn uncourteous parts
had conceiv'd against him maria writ
letter at sir toby's great importance
recompense whereof he hath married her
how sportful malice was follow'd
may rather pluck laughter than revenge
if injuries justly weigh'd

empty

he hath not told us captain yet

act scene
verona an open place
enter valentine proteus
valentine cease persuade loving proteus
were't not affection chains thy tender days
sweet glances thy honour'd love
rather would entreat thy company
see wonders world abroad
than living dully sluggardiz'd at home
wear out thy youth shapeless idleness
but since thou lov'st love still thrive therein
even as would when love begin
proteus wilt thou gone sweet valentine adieu
some rare noteworthy object thy travel
wish partaker thy happiness
when thou dost meet good hap thy danger
if ever danger do environ thee
commend thy grievance holy prayers
will thy headsman valentine
valentine love book pray success
proteus upon some book love i'll pray thee
valentine that's some shallow story deep love
proteus that's deep story deeper love
he was more than over shoes love
valentine 'tis true are over boots love
yet never swum hellespont
proteus over boots nay give not boots
valentine no will not boots thee not
proteus what
valentine love where scorn bought groans
coy looks heart sore sighs one fading moment's mirth
if haply won perhaps hapless gain
if lost why then grievous labour won
however but folly bought wit
or else wit by folly vanquished
proteus so by circumstance call fool
valentine so by circumstance fear you'll prove
proteus 'tis love cavil at am not love
valentine love master he masters
he so yoked by fool
proteus yet writers say as sweetest bud
eating canker dwells so eating love
inhabits finest wits all
valentine writers say as most forward bud
eaten by canker ere blow
even so by love young tender wit
turnd folly blasting bud
losing his verdure even prime
all fair effects future hopes
art votary fond desire
once more adieu father at road
expects coming there see shipp'd
proteus thither will bring thee valentine
valentine sweet proteus no now let us take our leave
milan let hear from thee by letters
thy success love what news else
betideth here absence thy friend
likewise will visit thee mine
valentine as much at home so farewell
exit valentine
proteus he after honour hunts after love
he leaves his friends dignify them more
leave myself friends all love
thou julia thou hast metamorphis'd
made neglect studies lose time
war good counsel set world at nought
made wit musing weak heart sick thought
speed sir proteus save saw master
proteus but now he parted hence embark milan
speed twenty one then he shipp'd already
have play'd sheep losing him
proteus indeed sheep doth very often stray
an if shepherd awhile away
speed conclude master shepherd then
sheep
proteus do
proteus silly answer fitting well sheep
speed this proves still sheep
proteus true thy master shepherd
speed nay can deny by circumstance
proteus shall go hard but i'll prove by another
speed shepherd seeks sheep not sheep
shepherd but seek master master seeks not
therefore am no sheep
proteus sheep fodder follow shepherd shepherd
thy master wages follows not thee therefore thou art
empty
speed such another proof will make cry 'baa'
proteus but dost thou hear gav'st thou letter julia
speed ay sir lost mutton gave letter her lac'd
mutton she lac'd mutton gave lost mutton nothing
labour
proteus here's too small pasture such store muttons
speed if ground overcharg'd were best stick her
speed nay sir less than pound shall serve carrying
empty
proteus mistake mean pound pinfold
speed from pound pin fold over over
'tis threefold too little carrying letter lover
proteus but what said she
speed nodding ay
proteus nod ay why that's 'noddy'
speed mistook sir say she did nod ask if she
proteus set together 'noddy'
speed now have taken pains set together take
pains
proteus no no shall have bearing letter
speed well perceive must fain bear
proteus why sir how do bear
speed marry sir letter very orderly having nothing but
word 'noddy' pains
proteus beshrew but have quick wit
proteus come come open matter brief what said she
speed open purse money matter may both
at once delivered
proteus well sir here pains what said she
speed truly sir think you'll hardly win her
proteus why couldst thou perceive so much from her
speed sir could perceive nothing at all from her no not so
much as ducat delivering letter being so hard
brought mind fear she'll prove as hard
hard as steel
proteus what said she nothing
speed no not so much as 'take this thy pains' testify
bounty thank have testernd requital
whereof henceforth carry letters yourself so sir
i'll commend master
proteus go go gone save ship from wreck
which cannot perish having thee aboard
being destind drier death shore exit speed
fear julia would not deign lines
receiving them from such worthless post exit
scene ii
verona garden julia's house
enter julia lucetta
julia but say lucetta now are alone
wouldst thou then counsel fall love
lucetta ay madam so stumble not unheedfully
julia all fair resort gentlemen
thy opinion which worthiest love
lucetta please repeat their names i'll show mind
according shallow simple skill

lucetta as knight well spoken neat fine
but were he never should mine
julia what think'st thou rich mercatio
lucetta well his wealth but himself so so
julia what think'st thou gentle proteus
julia how now what means this passion at his name
lucetta pardon dear madam 'tis passing shame
unworthy body as am
should censure thus lovely gentlemen
julia why not proteus as all rest
lucetta then thus many good think him best
julia reason
lucetta have no other but womans reason
think him so because think him so
lucetta ay if thought love not cast away
julia why he all rest hath never mov'd
lucetta yet he all rest think best loves ye
julia his little speaking shows his love but small
lucetta fire that's closest kept burns most all
julia they do not love do not show their love
lucetta o they love least let men know their love

lucetta contents will show

he would have given but being way
did name receive pardon fault pray

dare presume harbour wanton lines
whisper conspire against youth
now trust 'tis an office great worth
there take paper see returnd
or else return no more into sight
lucetta plead love deserves more fee than hate
julia will ye gone
lucetta may ruminate exit
julia yet would had o'erlook'd letter
were shame call her back again
pray her fault which chid her
what fool she knows am maid
since maids modesty say 'no'
which they would have profferer construe 'ay'
fie fie how wayward this foolish love
testy babe will scratch nurse
presently all humbled kiss rod
how churlishly chid lucetta hence
when willingly would have had her here
how angerly taught brow frown
when inward joy enforc'd heart smile
ask remission folly past
what ho lucetta

here coil protestation tears letter

would fing'ring them anger

julia nay would were so ang'red same
o hateful hands tear such loving words
injurious wasps feed such sweet honey
kill bees yield stings
look here writ 'kind julia' unkind julia
as revenge thy ingratitude
throw thy name against bruising stones
trampling contemptuously thy disdain
here writ 'love wounded proteus'
poor wounded name bosomas bed
shall lodge thee till thy wound throughly heald
thus search sovereign kiss
but twice or thrice was 'proteus' written down
till have found each letter letter
except mine own name some whirlwind bear
unto ragged fearful hanging rock
throw thence into raging sea
lo here one line his name twice writ
'poor forlorn proteus passionate proteus
sweet julia' i'll tear away
yet will not sith so prettily
he couples his complaining names
now kiss embrace contend do what will

lucetta madam

scene iii
verona antonio's house
enter antonio panthino
antonio tell panthino what sad talk was
wherewith brother held cloister
panthino 'twas his nephew proteus son
panthino he wond'red lordship
would suffer him spend his youth at home
while other men slender reputation
put forth their sons seek preferment out
some wars try their fortune there
some discover islands far away
some studious universities
any or all these exercises
he said proteus son was meet
let him spend his time no more at home
which would great impeachment his age
having known no travel his youth
antonio nor need'st thou much importune
whereon this month have been hammering
have consider'd well his loss time
how he cannot perfect man
not being tried tutor'd world
experience by industry achiev'd
then tell whither were best send him
panthino think lordship not ignorant
how his companion youthful valentine
attends emperor his royal court
antonio know well
panthino 'twere good think lordship sent him thither
there shall he practise tilts tournaments
hear sweet discourse converse noblemen
eye every exercise
antonio thy counsel well hast thou advis'd
thou mayst perceive how well
execution shall make known
even speediest expedition
will dispatch him emperor's court
panthino morrow may please don alphonso
other gentlemen good esteem
are journeying salute emperor
commend their service his will
enter proteus
good time now will break him
proteus sweet love sweet lines sweet life
here her hand agent her heart
here her oath love her honour's pawn
o our fathers would applaud our loves
seal our happiness their consents
o heavenly julia

commendations sent from valentine
deliver'd by friend came from him
antonio lend letter let see what news
proteus there no news lord but he writes
how happily he lives how well belov'd
daily graced by emperor
wishing him partner his fortune
antonio how stand affected his wish
proteus as one relying lordship's will
antonio will something sorted his wish
muse not thus suddenly proceed
what will will there an end
am resolv'd thou shalt spend some time
valentinus emperor's court
what maintenance he from his friends receives
exhibition thou shalt have from
morrow readiness go
excuse not am peremptory
please deliberate day or two
antonio look what thou want'st shall sent after thee
no more stay morrow thou must go
come panthino shall employ'd
hasten his expedition
exeunt antonio panthino
proteus thus have shunnd fire fear burning
drench'd sea where am drownd
fear'd show father julia's letter
vantage mine own excuse
hath he excepted most against love
o how this spring love resembleth
uncertain glory an april day
which now shows all beauty sun
by an by cloud takes all away
re enter panthino
panthino sir proteus father calls
he haste therefore pray go
yet thousand times answers 'no' exeunt

scene iii
verona street
enter launce leading dog

kind launces have this very fault have receiv'd
proportion prodigious son am going sir

sourest natured dog lives mother weeping father
wailing sister crying our maid howling our cat wringing her
cruel hearted cur shed one tear he stone very pebble
stone has no more pity him than dog jew would have
wept have seen our parting why grandam having no eyes
look wept herself blind at parting nay i'll show
manner this shoe father no this left shoe
father no no left shoe mother nay cannot so
neither yes so so hath worser sole this
shoe hole mother this father

this hat nan our maid am dog no dog himself

valentine so do

empty

silvia fine volley words gentlemen quickly shot off

borrows his wit from ladyship's looks spends what he
borrows kindly company

wit bankrupt

think no other treasure give followers
appears by their bare liveries they live by bare words
enter duke
duke now daughter silvia are hard beset
sir valentine father good health
what say letter from friends
much good news
valentine lord will thankful
any happy messenger from thence
duke know ye don antonio countryman
valentine ay good lord know gentleman
worth worthy estimation
duke hath he not son
valentine ay good lord son well deserves
honour regard such father
duke know him well
valentine knew him as myself from our infancy
have convers'd spent our hours together
though myself have been an idle truant
omitting sweet benefit time
clothe mine age angel perfection
made use fair advantage his days
his years but young but his experience old
his head unmellowed but his judgment ripe
word far behind his worth
comes all praises now bestow
he complete feature mind
all good grace grace gentleman
duke beshrew sir but if he make this good
he as worthy an empress' love
well sir this gentleman come
commendation from great potentates
here he means spend his time awhile
think 'tis no unwelcome news
valentine should have wish'd thing had been he
duke welcome him then according his worth
silvia speak sir thurio
valentine need not cite him
will send him hither presently exit duke
had come along but his mistresss
did hold his eyes lock'd her crystal looks
silvia belike now she hath enfranchis'd them
upon some other pawn fealty
valentine nay sure think she holds them prisoners still
silvia nay then he should blind being blind
how could he see his way seek out
valentine why lady love hath twenty pair eyes
thurio they say love hath not an eye at all
upon homely object love can wink exit thurio
enter proteus
silvia have done have done here comes gentleman
valentine welcome dear proteus mistress beseech
confirm his welcome some special favour
silvia his worth warrant his welcome hither
if this he oft have wish'd hear from
valentine mistress sweet lady entertain him
fellow servant ladyship
proteus not so sweet lady but too mean servant
have look such worthy mistress
valentine leave off discourse disability
sweet lady entertain him servant
proteus duty will boast nothing else
silvia duty never yet did want his meed
servant are welcome worthless mistress
proteus i'll die him says so but yourself
silvia are welcome

proteus left them all health
valentine how does lady how thrives love
proteus tales love were wont weary
know joy not love discourse
valentine ay proteus but life alter'd now
have done penance contemning love
whose high imperious thoughts have punish'd
bitter fasts penitential groans
revenge contempt love
love hath chas'd sleep from enthralled eyes
made them watchers mine own heart's sorrow
o gentle proteus love's mighty lord
hath so humbled as confess
there no woe his correction
nor his service no such joy earth
now no discourse except love
now can break fast dine sup sleep
proteus enough read fortune eye
was this idol worship so
valentine even she she not heavenly saint
proteus no but she an earthly paragon
valentine call her divine
proteus will not flatter her
valentine o flatter love delights praises
proteus when was sick gave bitter pills
must minister
yet let her principality
sovereign all creatures earth
proteus except mistress
valentine sweet except not any
except thou wilt except against love
proteus have not reason prefer mine own
valentine will help thee prefer her too
she shall dignified this high honour
bear lady's train lest base earth
so great favour growing proud
disdain root summer swelling flow'r
make rough winter everlastingly
proteus why valentine what braggardism this
valentine pardon proteus all can nothing
her whose worth makes other worthies nothing
she alone
proteus then let her alone
valentine not world why man she mine own
as twenty seas if all their sand were pearl
water nectar rocks pure gold
forgive do not dream thee
because thou seest dote upon love
foolish rival her father likes
only his possessions are so huge
gone her along must after
love thou know'st full jealousy
proteus but she loves
all cunning manner our flight
determind how must climb her window
ladder made cords all means
plotted 'greed happiness
good proteus go chamber
these affairs aid thy counsel
proteus go before shall enquire forth
must unto road disembark
some necessaries needs must use
valentine will make haste
proteus will exit valentine
even as one heat another heat expels
or as one nail by strength drives out another
so remembrance former love
by newer object quite forgotten
mind or valentinus' praise
her true perfection or false transgression
makes reasonless reason thus
did love now love thaw'd
which waxen image 'gainst fire
bears no impression thing was
methinks zeal valentine cold
love him not as was wont
o but love his lady too too much
that's reason love him so little
how shall dote her more advice
thus without advice begin love her
hath dazzled reasons light
but when look her perfections
there no reason but shall blind
if can check erring love will
if not compass her i'll use skill exit

milan duke's palace

provokes this threefold perjury

o sweet suggesting love if thou hast sinnd
teach thy tempted subject excuse
at first did adore twinkling star
unheedful vows may heedfully broken
he wants wit wants resolved will
learn his wit t' exchange bad better
fie fie unreverend tongue call her bad

twenty thousand soul confirming oaths

scene vii
verona julia's house
enter julia lucetta
julia counsel lucetta gentle girl assist
ev'n kind love do conjure thee
who art table wherein all thoughts
lesson tell some good mean
how honour may undertake
journey loving proteus
lucetta alas way wearisome long
julia true devoted pilgrim not weary
measure kingdoms his feeble steps
much less shall she hath love's wings fly
when flight made one so dear
such divine perfection as sir proteus
julia o know'st thou not his looks are souls food
pity dearth have pined
by longing food so long time
didst thou but know inly touch love
thou wouldst as soon go kindle fire snow
as seek quench fire love words
lucetta do not seek quench love's hot fire
but qualify fire's extreme rage
lest should burn above bounds reason
current gentle murmur glides
thou know'st being stopp'd impatiently doth rage
but when his fair course not hindered
he makes sweet music th' enamelld stones
giving gentle kiss every sedge
he overtaketh his pilgrimage
so by many winding nooks he strays
willing sport wild ocean
then let go hinder not course
make pastime each weary step
till last step have brought love
there i'll rest as after much turmoil
blessed soul doth elysium
lucetta but what habit will go along
julia not woman would prevent
loose encounters lascivious men
gentle lucetta fit such weeds
as may beseem some well reputed page
julia no girl i'll knit up silken strings
twenty odd conceited true love knots
fantastic may become youth
greater time than shall show
lucetta what fashion madam shall make breeches
julia fits as well as 'tell good lord
what compass will wear farthingale'
why ev'n what fashion thou best likes lucetta
lucetta must needs have them codpiece madam
lucetta round hose madam now's not worth pin
unless have codpiece stick pins
julia lucetta as thou lov'st let have
what thou think'st meet most mannerly
but tell wench how will world repute
undertaking so unstaid journey
fear will make scandaliz'd
lucetta if think so then stay at home go not
julia nay will not
if proteus journey when come
no matter who's displeas'd when are gone
fear he will scarce pleas'd withal
julia least lucetta fear
thousand oaths an ocean his tears
instances infinite love
warrant welcome proteus
lucetta all these are servants deceitful men
julia base men use them so base effect
his words are bonds his oaths are oracles
his love sincere his thoughts immaculate
his tears pure messengers sent from his heart
his heart as far from fraud as heaven from earth
lucetta pray heav'n he prove so when come him
julia now as thou lov'st do him not wrong
bear hard opinion his truth
only deserve love by loving him
presently go chamber
furnish upon longing journey
all mine leave at thy dispose
goods lands reputation
only lieu thereof dispatch hence
come answer not but presently
am impatient tarriance exeunt
act iii scene
milan duke's palace

have some secrets confer about exit thurio
now tell proteus what's will

duty pricks utter
which else no worldly good should draw from
know worthy prince sir valentine friend
myself am one made privy plot
know have determind bestow her
thurio whom gentle daughter hates
should she thus stoln away from
would much vexation age
thus duty's sake rather chose
cross friend his intended drift
than by concealing heap head
pack sorrows which would press down

which requite command while live
this love theirs myself have often seen
haply when they have judg'd fast asleep
oftentimes have purpos'd forbid
sir valentine her company court
but fearing lest jealous aim might err
so unworthily disgrace man
rashness ever yet have shunnd
which thyself hast now disclos'd

knowing tender youth soon suggested

full virtue bounty worth qualities

upon advice hath drawn love from her

should have been cherish'd by her childlike duty
now am full resolv'd take wife
turn her out who will take her
then let her beauty her wedding dow'r
possessions she esteems not
duke there lady verona here
whom affect but she nice coy
nought esteems aged eloquence
now therefore would have thee tutor
long agone have forgot court
besides fashion time chang'd
how which way may bestow myself
regarded her sun bright eye
valentine win her gifts if she respect not words
more than quick words do move womans mind
duke but she did scorn present sent her

send her another never give her o'er
scorn at first makes after love more
if she do frown 'tis not hate
but rather beget more love
if she do chide 'tis not have gone
why fools are mad if left alone
'get gone' she doth not mean 'away'
flatter praise commend extol their graces
though ne'er so black say they have angels' faces
man hath tongue say no man
if his tongue he cannot win woman
duke but she mean promis'd by her friends
unto youthful gentleman worth
kept severely from resort men
no man hath access by day her
duke ay but doors lock'd keys kept safe
no man hath recourse her by night
valentine what lets but one may enter at her window
duke her chamber aloft far from ground
built so shelving one cannot climb
without apparent hazard his life

cast up pair anchoring hooks
would serve scale another hero's tow'r

advise where may have such ladder
valentine when would use pray sir tell

longs everything he can come by

pray thee let feel thy cloak upon
what letter this same what's here 'to silvia'
here an engine fit proceeding
'my thoughts do harbour silvia nightly
slaves they are send them flying

himself would lodge where senseless they are lying
herald thoughts thy pure bosom rest them

do curse grace such grace hath blest them
because myself do want servants' fortune
curse myself they are sent by
what's here
'silvia this night will enfranchise thee'
'tis so here's ladder purpose
why phaethon thou art merops' son
wilt thou aspire guide heavenly car
thy daring folly burn world
wilt thou reach stars because they shine thee
go base intruder over weening slave
bestow thy fawning smiles equal mates
privilege thy departure hence
thank this more than all favours
which all too much have bestow'd thee
but if thou linger territories
longer than swiftest expedition
will give thee time leave our royal court
by heaven wrath shall far exceed love
ever bore daughter or thyself
gone will not hear thy vain excuse

die banish'd from myself

self from self deadly banishment

foster'd illumind cherish'd kept alive

cannot soon revolt change mind

may discover such integrity

valentine verona
first outlaw whence came
valentine from milan

second outlaw what offence
valentine which now torments rehearse
killd man whose death much repent
but yet slew him manfully fight
without false vantage or base treachery

or else often had been miserable

practising steal away lady
an heir near allied unto duke

who mood stabb'd unto heart

but purpose cite our faults
partly seeing are beautified
goodly shape by own report
linguist man such perfection
as do our quality much want
second outlaw indeed because are banish'd man
therefore above rest parley
are content our general
make virtue necessity
live as do this wilderness
say 'ay' captain us all
we'll do thee homage ruld by thee
love thee as our commander our king

valentine take offer will live
provided do no outrages
silly women or poor passengers

which ourselves all rest at thy dispose exeunt

return return make thy love amends
by this pale queen night swear
am so far from granting thy request
despise thee thy wrongful suit
even this time spend talking thee
proteus grant sweet love did love lady
but she dead
julia aside 'twere false if should speak
am sure she not buried
silvia say she yet valentine thy friend
survives whom thyself art witness
am betroth'd art thou not asham'd
wrong him thy importunacy
silvia so suppose am his grave
assure thyself love buried
proteus sweet lady let rake from earth
silvia go thy lady's grave call hers thence
or at least hers sepulchre thine
julia aside he heard not
proteus madam if heart so obdurate
vouchsafe yet picture love
picture hanging chamber
since substance perfect self
else devoted am but shadow
shadow will make true love
julia aside if 'twere substance would sure deceive
make but shadow as am
silvia am very loath idol sir
but since falsehood shall become well
worship shadows adore false shapes
send morning i'll send
proteus as wretches have o'ernight
wait execution morn
exeunt proteus silvia
julia host will go
host by halidom was fast asleep
julia pray where lies sir proteus
host marry at house trust think 'tis almost day
julia not so but hath been longest night
e'er watch'd most heaviest exeunt
under silvia's window
enter eglamour
eglamour this hour madam silvia
entreated call know her mind
there's some great matter she'd employ
madam madam
enter silvia above at her window
silvia who calls
eglamour servant friend
silvia sir eglamour thousand times good morrow
eglamour as many worthy lady yourself
according ladyship's impose
am thus early come know what service
pleasure command
silvia o eglamour thou art gentleman
think not flatter swear do not
valiant wise remorseful well accomplish'd
thou art not ignorant what dear good will
nor how father would enforce marry
vain thurio whom very soul abhors
thyself hast lov'd have heard thee say
no grief did ever come so near thy heart
as when thy lady thy true love died
upon whose grave thou vow'dst pure chastity
sir eglamour would valentine
mantua where hear he makes abode
ways are dangerous pass
upon whose faith honour repose
urge not father's anger eglamour
but think upon grief lady's grief
justice flying hence
keep from most unholy match
which heaven fortune still rewards plagues
do desire thee even from heart
as full sorrows as sea sands
bear company go
may venture depart alone
eglamour madam pity much grievances
which since know they virtuously are plac'd
give consent go along
recking as little what betideth
as much wish all good befortune
when will go
silvia this evening coming
eglamour where shall meet
where intend holy confession
eglamour will not fail ladyship good morrow gentle lady
silvia good morrow kind sir eglamour exeunt
scene iv
under silvia's window
enter launce his dog
launce when mans servant shall play cur him look
goes hard one brought up puppy one sav'd
from drowning when three or four his blind brothers
precisely 'thus would teach dog' was sent deliver him
as present mistress silvia from master came no
sooner into dining chamber but he steps her trencher
steals her capons leg o 'tis foul thing when cur
cannot keep himself all companies would have as one should
say one takes upon him dog indeed as
were dog at all things if had not had more wit than he
take fault upon he did think verily he had been
hang'd for't sure as live he had suffer'd for't shall
gentleman dogs under duke's table he had not been
there bless mark pissing while but all chamber smelt
him 'out dog' says one 'what cur that' says
another 'whip him out' says third 'hang him up' says
duke having been acquainted smell before knew
was crab goes fellow whips dogs
'friend' quoth 'you mean whip dog' 'ay marry do i'
quoth he 'you do him more wrong' quoth twas did
thing wot of' he makes no more ado but whips out
i'll sworn have sat stock puddings he hath
stoln otherwise he had been executed have stood
pillory geese he hath killd otherwise he had suffer'd
for't thou think'st not this now nay remember trick
serv'd when took leave madam silvia did not bid
thee still mark do as do when didst thou see heave
up leg make water against gentlewomans farthingale
didst thou ever see do such trick
enter proteus julia boy's clothes
will employ thee some service presently

can some discretion do business

but chiefly thy face thy behaviour
which if augury deceive not
witness good bringing up fortune truth
therefore know thou this entertain thee
deliver madam silvia
she lov'd well deliver'd

she dead belike

julia cannot choose
but pity her
julia because methinks she lov'd as well
as do love lady silvia

thinking makes cry 'alas'

alas poor proteus thou hast entertaind
fox shepherd thy lambs
alas poor fool why do pity him
his very heart despiseth
because he loves her he despiseth
because love him must pity him
this ring gave him when he parted from
now am unhappy messenger
plead which would not obtain
carry which would have refus'd
praise his faith which would have disprais'd
am master's true confirmed love
but cannot true servant master
unless prove false traitor myself
yet will woo him but yet so coldly
as heaven knows would not have him speed
gentlewoman good day pray mean
bring where speak madam silvia
silvia what would her if she
julia if she do entreat patience
hear speak message am sent
silvia from whom

silvia o he sends picture
julia ay madam
go give master this tell him from
one julia his changing thoughts forget
would better fit his chamber than this shadow
julia madam please peruse this letter
pardon madam have unadvis'd
deliver'd paper should not
this letter ladyship
silvia pray thee let look again
julia may not good madam pardon
will not look upon master's lines
know they are stuff'd protestations
full new found oaths which he wul break
as easily as do tear his paper
julia madam he sends ladyship this ring
silvia more shame him he sends
have heard him say thousand times
his julia gave him at his departure
though his false finger have profand ring
julia she thanks
silvia what say'st thou
julia thank madam tender her
poor gentlewoman master wrongs her much
silvia dost thou know her
julia almost as well as do know myself
think upon her woes do protest
have wept hundred several times
silvia belike she thinks proteus hath forsook her
silvia she not passing fair
julia she hath been fairer madam than she
when she did think master lov'd her well
she judgment was as fair as
but since she did neglect her looking glass
threw her sun expelling mask away
air hath starv'd roses her cheeks
pinch'd lily tincture her face
now she become as black as
julia about stature at pentecost
when all our pageants delight were play'd
our youth got play womans part
was trimm'd madam julia's gown
which served as fit by all mens judgments
as if garment had been made
therefore know she about height
at time made her weep good
did play lamentable part
theseus' perjury unjust flight
which so lively acted tears
poor mistress moved therewithal
wept bitterly would might dead
if thought felt not her very sorrow
silvia she beholding thee gentle youth
alas poor lady desolate left
weep myself think upon thy words
here youth there purse give thee this
farewell exit silvia attendants
julia she shall thank for't if e'er know her
virtuous gentlewoman mild beautiful
hope master's suit will but cold
since she respects mistress' love so much
alas how love can trifle itself
here her picture let see think
if had such tire this face mine
were full as lovely as this hers
unless flatter myself too much
her hair auburn mine perfect yellow
if all difference his love
i'll get such colour'd periwig
her eyes are grey as glass so are mine
ay but her forehead's low mine's as high
what should he respects her
but can make respective myself
if this fond love were not blinded god
'tis thy rival o thou senseless form
thou shalt worshipp'd kiss'd lov'd ador'd
were there sense his idolatry
substance should statue thy stead
i'll use thee kindly thy mistress' sake
us'd so or else by jove vow
should have scratch'd out unseeing eyes
make master out love thee exit
act v scene

scene ii
milan duke's palace

had rather wink than look them

at patrick's cell this even there she was not
these likelihoods confirm her flight from hence
therefore pray stand not discourse
but mount presently meet

flies her fortune when follows her

scene iv
another part forest
enter valentine
valentine how use doth breed habit man
better brook than flourishing peopled towns
here can sit alone unseen any
nightingale's complaining notes
tune distresses record woes
o thou dost inhabit breast
leave not mansion so long tenantless
lest growing ruinous building fall
leave no memory what was
repair thy presence silvia
what halloing what stir this day
these are mates make their wills their law
have some unhappy passenger chase
they love well yet have much do
keep them from uncivil outrages
withdraw thee valentine who's this comes here

would have forc'd honour love

less than this am sure cannot give

love lend patience forbear awhile
silvia o miserable unhappy am

silvia by thy approach thou mak'st most unhappy
julia aside when he approacheth presence
silvia had been seized by hungry lion
would have been breakfast beast
rather than have false proteus rescue
o heaven judge how love valentine
whose life's as tender as soul
full as much more there cannot
do detest false perjur'd proteus

would not undergo one calm look
o 'tis curse love still approv'd
when women cannot love where they're belov'd
silvia when proteus cannot love where he's belov'd
read over julia's heart thy first best love
whose dear sake thou didst then rend thy faith
into thousand oaths all those oaths
descended into perjury love
that's far worse than none better have none
than plural faith which too much by one
thou counterfeit thy true friend
proteus love
who respects friend
silvia all men but proteus

can no way change milder form
i'll woo soldier at arms' end

proteus i'll force thee yield desire

thou friend an ill fashion
proteus valentine
valentine thou common friend that's without faith or love
such friend now treacherous man
thou hast beguild hopes nought but mine eye
could have persuaded now dare not say
who should trusted when one's own right hand
perjured bosom proteus
am sorry must never trust thee more
but count world stranger thy sake
private wound deepest o time most accurst
'mongst all foes friend should worst
proteus shame guilt confounds

sufficient ransom offence
as e'er did commit

once again do receive thee honest
who by repentance not satisfied

love may appear plain free
all was mine silvia give thee

how oft hast thou perjury cleft root

thou asham'd have took upon
disguise love
lesser blot modesty finds
women change their shapes than men their minds
proteus than men their minds 'tis true o heaven were man
but constant he were perfect one error
fills him faults makes him run through all th' sins

what silvia's face but may spy
more fresh julia's constant eye

yet should perpetuity

than can put us to't

friend polixenes which had been done
swift command though death
reward did threaten encourage him
not doing being done he most humane
filld honour kingly guest
unclasp'd practice quit his fortunes here
which knew great certain hazard
all incertainties himself commended
no richer than his honour how he glisters
thorough rust how his piety
re enter paulina
paulina woe while
o cut lace lest heart cracking
break too
first lord what fit this good lady
paulina what studied torments tyrant hast
what wheels racks fires what flaying boiling
leads or oils what old or newer torture
must receive whose every word deserves
together working thy jealousies
fancies too weak boys too green idle
girls nine o think what they have done
then run mad indeed stark mad all
thy by gone fooleries were but spices
thou betray'dst polixenes 'twas nothing
did but show thee fool inconstant
damnable ingrateful nor was't much
thou wouldst have poisond good camillo's honour
more monstrous standing by whereof reckon
casting forth crows thy baby daughter
or none or little though devil
would have shed water out fire ere done't
nor is't directly laid thee death
young prince whose honourable thoughts
thoughts high one so tender cleft heart
could conceive gross foolish sire
blemish'd his gracious dam this not no
when have said cry 'woe' queen queen
sweet'st dear'st creature's dead vengeance
for't not dropp'd down yet
first lord higher pow'rs forbid
paulina say she's dead i'll swear't if word nor oath
prevail not go see if can bring
tincture or lustre her lip her eye
heat outwardly or breath within i'll serve
as would do gods but o thou tyrant
than all thy woes can stir therefore betake thee
nothing but despair thousand knees
ten thousand years together naked fasting
upon barren mountain still winter
storm perpetual could not move gods
look way thou wert
leontes go go
thou canst not speak too much have deserv'd
all tongues talk their bitt'rest
howe'er business goes have made fault
i' th' boldness speech
paulina am sorry for't
all faults make when shall come know them
do repent alas have show'd too much
rashness woman he touch'd
th' noble heart what's gone what's past help
should past grief do not receive affliction
at petition beseech rather
what should forget now good liege
sir royal sir forgive foolish woman
love bore queen lo fool again
i'll speak her no more nor children
i'll not remember own lord
who lost too take patience
i'll say nothing
leontes thou didst speak but well
when most truth which receive much better
dead bodies queen son
one grave shall both upon them shall
causes their death appear unto
our shame perpetual once day i'll visit
chapel where they lie tears shed there
shall recreation so long as nature
will bear up this exercise so long
daily vow use come lead
these sorrows exeunt

appear'd last night ne'er was dream
so waking comes creature
sometimes her head one side some another
never saw vessel sorrow
so filld so becoming pure white robes

she melted into air affrighted much
did time collect myself thought

will squar'd by this do believe

act iv scene
enter time chorus
time please some try all both joy terror
good bad makes unfolds error
now take upon name time

o'erthrow law one self born hour

times brought them so shall do

as had slept between leontes leaving

he shuts up himself imagine

what her adheres which follows after
th' argument time this allow
if ever have spent time worse ere now

scene ii
bohemia palace polixenes
enter polixenes camillo
sickness denying thee anything death grant this
camillo fifteen years since saw country though have
most part been aired abroad desire lay bones
there besides penitent king master hath sent
whose feeling sorrows might some allay or o'erween
think so which another spur departure
polixenes as thou lov'st camillo wipe not out rest thy
services by leaving now need have thee thine own
goodness hath made better not have had thee than thus want
sufficiently manage must either stay execute them thyself or
take away thee very services thou hast done which if
have not enough considered as too much cannot more
thankful thee shall study profit therein
heaping friendships fatal country sicilia prithee
speak no more whose very naming punishes remembrance
penitent as thou callst him reconciled king
brother whose loss his most precious queen children are
even now afresh lamented say when saw'st thou
not being gracious than they are losing them when they have
approved their virtues
camillo sir three days since saw prince what his
happier affairs may are unknown but have missingly
noted he late much retired from court less frequent
his princely exercises than formerly he hath appeared
polixenes have considered so much camillo some care
so far have eyes under service which look upon his
removedness from whom have this intelligence he
from very nothing beyond imagination his
neighbours grown into an unspeakable estate
camillo have heard sir such man who hath daughter
most rare note report her extended more than can
thought begin from such cottage
polixenes that's likewise part intelligence but fear
angle plucks our son thither thou shalt accompany us
place where will not appearing what are have some
question shepherd from whose simplicity think not
present partner this business lay aside thoughts
empty

scene iv
bohemia shepherd's cottage
enter florizel perdita
florizel these unusual weeds each part
do give life no shepherdess but flora
peering aprils front this sheep shearing
as meeting petty gods
perdita sir gracious lord
chide at extremes not becomes
o pardon name them high self
gracious mark o' th' land have obscur'd
swains wearing poor lowly maid
most goddess prank'd up but our feasts
every mess have folly feeders
digest custom should blush
see so attir'd swoon think
florizel bless time
when good falcon made her flight across
thy father's ground
perdita now jove afford cause
difference forges dread greatness
hath not been us'd fear even now tremble
think father by some accident
should pass this way as did o fates
how would he look see his work so noble
should these borrowed flaunts behold
sternness his presence
florizel apprehend
nothing but jollity gods themselves
humbling their deities love have taken
shapes beasts upon them jupiter
became bull bellow'd green neptune
ram bleated fire rob'd god
golden apollo poor humble swain
were never piece beauty rarer
nor way so chaste since desires
run not before mine honour nor lusts
burn hotter than faith
perdita o but sir
resolution cannot hold when 'tis
oppos'd as must by th' pow'r king
one these two must necessities
which then will speak must change this purpose
florizel thou dearest perdita
these forc'd thoughts prithee darken not
mirth o' th' feast or i'll thine fair
or not father's cannot
mine own nor anything any if
not thine this am most constant
though destiny say no merry gentle
strangle such thoughts as these any thing
behold while guests are coming
celebration nuptial which
two have sworn shall come
perdita o lady fortune
stand auspicious

address yourself entertain them sprightly
let's red mirth

clown mopsa dorcas others
this day she was both pantler butler cook

as if were feasted one not
hostess meeting pray bid
way make us better friends more known

which are mistress o' th' feast come
bid us welcome sheep shearing
as good flock shall prosper

father's will should take
hostess ship o' th' day camillo

there's rosemary rue these keep
seeming savour all winter long
grace remembrance both
welcome our shearing
polixenes shepherdess
fair one are well fit our ages
flow'rs winter

not yet summer's death nor birth
are our carnations streak'd gillyvors
which some call nature's bastards kind
our rustic gardens barren care not
get slips them
polixenes wherefore gentle maiden
do neglect them
perdita have heard said
there an art which their piedness shares
great creating nature
yet nature made better by no mean
but nature makes mean so over art
which say adds nature an art
nature makes see sweet maid marry
gentler scion wildest stock
make conceive bark baser kind
by bud nobler race this an art
which does mend nature change rather but
art itself nature

do not call them bastards

no more than were painted would wish
this youth should say 'twere well only therefore

hot lavender mints savory marjoram

middle summer think they are given
men middle age y'are very welcome
camillo should leave grazing were flock
only live by gazing

you'd so lean blasts january

come before swallow dares take

at nuptial his son guest
not father grown incapable

he has his health ampler strength indeed

something unfilial reason son

acknowledg'd thou sceptre's heir
thus affects sheep hook thou old traitor
am sorry by hanging thee can but

excellent witchcraft who force must know
royal fool thou cop'st
shepherd o heart
polixenes i'll have thy beauty scratch'd briers made
more homely than thy state thee fond boy
thou no more shalt see this knack as never
mean thou shalt we'll bar thee from succession
not hold thee our blood no not our kin
farre than deucalion off mark thou words
follow us court thou churl this time
though full our displeasure yet free thee
from dead blow enchantment
worthy enough herdsman yea him too
makes himself but our honour therein
these rural latches his entrance open
or hoop his body more thy embraces
will devise death as cruel thee
as thou art tender to't exit
perdita even here undone
was not much afeard once or twice
was about speak tell him plainly
self same sun shines upon his court

see life as lively mock'd as ever
still sleep mock'd death behold say 'tis well

standing statue

comes not something near

thou art hermione or rather thou art she
thy not chiding she was as tender
as infancy grace but yet paulina
hermione was not so much wrinkled nothing
so aged as this seems
polixenes o not by much
paulina so much more our carver's excellence
which lets go by some sixteen years makes her
leontes as now she might have done
so much good comfort as
now piercing soul o thus she stood
even such life majesty warm life
as now coldly stands when first woo'd her
am asham'd does not stone rebuke
being more stone than o royal piece
there's magic thy majesty which has
evils conjur'd remembrance
standing stone thee
perdita give leave
do not say 'tis superstition
kneel then implore her blessing lady
dear queen ended when but began
give hand yours kiss
paulina o patience
statue but newly fix'd colour's
not dry
which sixteen winters cannot blow away
so many summers dry scarce any joy
did ever so long live no sorrow
but killd itself much sooner
polixenes dear brother
let him was cause this have pow'r
take off so much grief from as he
will piece up himself
paulina indeed lord
would thus have wrought stone mine
i'd not have show'd
leontes do not draw curtain
paulina no longer shall gaze ont lest fancy
may think anon moves
leontes let let
would were dead but methinks already
what was he did make see lord
would not deem breath'd those veins
polixenes masterly done
very life seems warm upon her lip
leontes fixture her eye has motion int
as are mock'd art
paulina i'll draw curtain
lord's almost so far transported
he'll think anon lives
leontes o sweet paulina
make think so twenty years together
pleasure madness let 't alone
paulina am sorry sir have thus far stirr'd but
could afflict farther
leontes do paulina
this affliction has taste as sweet
as any cordial comfort still methinks
there an air comes from her what fine chisel
could ever yet cut breath let no man mock
will kiss her
ruddiness upon her lip wet
you'll mar if kiss stain own
oily painting shall draw curtain
leontes no not these twenty years
perdita so long could
stand by looker
paulina either forbear
quit presently chapel or resolve
more amazement if can behold
take by hand but then you'll think
which protest against am assisted
by wicked powers
leontes what can make her do
am content look what speak
am content hear 'tis as easy
make her speak as move
paulina requir'd
do awake faith then all stand still
am about let them depart
leontes proceed
no foot shall stir
paulina music awake her strike music
'tis time descend stone no more approach
strike all look upon marvel come
i'll fill grave up stir nay come away
bequeath death numbness from him
dear life redeems perceive she stirs
start not her actions shall holy as
hear spell lawful do not shun her
until see her die again then
kill her double nay present hand
when she was young woo'd her now age
she become suitor
leontes o she's warm
if this magic let an art
lawful as eating
camillo she hangs about his neck
if she pertain life let her speak too
polixenes ay make manifest where she has liv'd
or how stoln from dead
paulina she living
were but told should hooted at
an old tale but appears she lives
though yet she speak not mark little while
please interpose fair madam kneel
our perdita found
hermione gods look down
from sacred vials pour graces
upon daughter's head tell mine own
where hast thou been preserv'd where liv'd how found
thy father's court thou shalt hear
knowing by paulina oracle
gave hope thou wast being have preserv'd
myself see issue
lest they desire upon this push trouble
joys relation go together
precious winners all exultation
partake every one an old turtle
will wing some wither'd bough there
mate that's never found again
lament till am lost
leontes o peace paulina
thou shouldst husband take by consent
made betweens by vows thou hast found mine
but how questiond saw her
as thought dead have vain said many
prayer upon her grave i'll not seek far
him partly know his mind find thee
an honourable husband come camillo
take her by hand whose worth honesty
richly noted here justified
by us pair kings let's from this place
e'er put between holy looks
ill suspicion this son law
son unto king whom heavens directing
troth plight daughter good paulina
lead us from hence where may leisurely
each one demand answer his part
perform'd this wide gap time since first
were dissever'd hastily lead away exeunt
end
lover's complaint
by william shakespeare
from off hill whose concave womb reworded
plaintful story from sist'ring vale
spirits t'attend this double voice accorded
down laid list sad tuned tale
ere long espied fickle maid full pale
tearing papers breaking rings atwain
storming her world sorrow's wind rain
which fortified her visage from sun
whereon thought might think sometime saw
carcase beauty spent done
time had not scythed all youth begun
nor youth all quit but spite heavens fell rage
some beauty peeped through lattice seared age
oft did she heave her napkin her eyne
which had conceited characters
laund'ring silken figures brine
often reading what contents bears
as often shrieking undistinguished woe
clamours all size both high low
sometimes her levelled eyes their carriage ride
as they did batt'ry spheres intend
sometime diverted their poor balls are tied
th' orbed earth sometimes they do extend
their view right anon their gazes lend
every place at once nowhere fixed
her hair nor loose nor tied formal plat
proclaimed her careless hand pride
some untucked descended her sheaved hat
hanging her pale pined cheek beside
some her threaden fillet still did bide
true bondage would not break from thence
though slackly braided loose negligence
thousand favours from maund she drew
amber crystal beaded jet
upon whose weeping margent she was set
usury applying wet wet
or monarchs' hands lets not bounty fall
where want cries some but where excess begs all
folded schedules had she many one
which she perused sighed tore gave flood
cracked many ring posied gold bone
bidding them find their sepulchres mud
found yet moe letters sadly penned blood
enswathed sealed curious secrecy
these often bathed she her fluxive eyes
often kissed often 'gan tear
cried 'o false blood thou register lies
what unapproved witness dost thou bear
ink would have seemed more black damned here
this said top rage lines she rents
big discontents so breaking their contents
reverend man grazed his cattle nigh
court city had let go by
swiftest hours observed as they flew
towards this afflicted fancy fastly drew
privileged by age desires know
brief grounds motives her woe
so slides he down upon his grained bat
comely distant sits he by her side
when he again desires her being sat
her grievance his hearing divide
which may her suffering ecstasy assuage
'tis promised charity age
'father' she says 'though behold
injury many blasting hour
let not tell judgement am old
not age but sorrow over hath power
might as yet have been spreading flower
fresh myself if had self applied
love myself no love beside
youthful suit was gain grace
o one by nature's outwards so commended
maidens' eyes stuck over all his face
love lacked dwelling made him her place
when his fair parts she did abide
she was new lodged newly deified
'his browny locks did hang crooked curls
every light occasion wind
upon his lips their silken parcels hurls
each eye saw him did enchant mind
his visage was little drawn
what largeness thinks paradise was sawn
'small show man was yet upon his chin
his phoenix down began but appear
unshorn velvet termless skin
whose bare out bragged web seemed wear
yet showed his visage by cost more dear
nice affections wavering stood doubt
'his qualities were beauteous as his form
maiden tongued he was thereof free
yet if men moved him was he such storm
as oft 'twixt may april see
when winds breathe sweet unruly though they
his rudeness so his authorized youth
did livery falseness pride truth
'well could he ride often men would say
horse his mettle from his rider takes
what rounds what bounds what course what stop he makes
controversy hence question takes
whether horse by him became his deed
or he his manage by th' well doing steed
'but quickly this side verdict went
his real habitude gave life grace
appertainings ornament
accomplished himself not his case
all aids themselves made fairer by their place
pierced not his grace but were all graced by him
'so tip his subduing tongue
all kind arguments question deep
all replication prompt reason strong
his advantage still did wake sleep
make weeper laugh laugher weep
he had dialect different skill
catching all passions his craft will
'that he did general bosom reign
dwell him thoughts or remain
personal duty following where he haunted
consents bewitched ere he desire have granted
dialogued him what he would say
asked their own wills made their wills obey
'many there were did his picture get
serve their eyes put their mind
fools th' imagination set
goodly objects which abroad they find
labouring moe pleasures bestow them
than true gouty landlord which doth owe them
'so many have never touched his hand
sweetly supposed them mistress his heart
woeful self did freedom stand
was own fee simple not part
what his art youth youth art
threw affections his charmed power
reserved stalk gave him all flower
demand him nor being desired yielded
finding myself honour so forbid
safest distance mine honour shielded
experience many bulwarks builded
proofs new bleeding which remained foil
this false jewel his amorous spoil
'but ah who ever shunned by precedent
destined ill she must herself assay
or forced examples 'gainst her own content
counsel may stop awhile what will not stay
when rage advice often seen
by blunting us make our wills more keen
'nor gives satisfaction our blood
must curb upon others' proof
forbod sweets seems so good
fear harms preach our behoof
o appetite from judgement stand aloof
one palate hath needs will taste
'for further could say this mans untrue
knew patterns his foul beguiling
heard where his plants others' orchards grew
saw how deceits were gilded his smiling
knew vows were ever brokers defiling
thought characters words merely but art
bastards his foul adulterate heart
'and long upon these terms held city
till thus he 'gan besiege gentle maid
not holy vows afraid
that's ye sworn none was ever said
feasts love have been called unto
till now did ne'er invite nor never woo
'all offences abroad see
are errors blood none mind
love made them not acture they may
where neither party nor true nor kind
they sought their shame so their shame did find
by how much their reproach contains
'among many mine eyes have seen
not one whose flame heart so much as warmed
or affection put th' smallest teen
or any leisures ever charmed
harm have done them but ne'er was harmed
kept hearts liveries but mine own was free
reigned commanding his monarchy
'look here what tributes wounded fancies sent
figuring they their passions likewise lent
grief blushes aptly understood
bloodless white encrimsoned mood
effects terror dear modesty
encamped hearts but fighting outwardly
'and lo behold these talents their hair
twisted metal amorously empleached
have receiv'd from many several fair
their kind acceptance weepingly beseeched
deep brained sonnets did amplify
each stone's dear nature worth quality
'the diamond why 'twas beautiful hard
whereto his invised properties did tend
deep green em'rald whose fresh regard
weak sights their sickly radiance do amend
heaven hued sapphire opal blend
objects manifold each several stone
wit well blazoned smiled or made some moan
pensived subdued desires tender
nature hath charged hoard them not
but yield them up where myself must render
origin ender
these force must oblations
since their altar enpatron
'o then advance yours phraseless hand
whose white weighs down airy scale praise
take all these similes own command
what minister obeys
works under audit comes
their distract parcels combined sums
'lo this device was sent from nun
or sister sanctified holiest note
which late her noble suit court did shun
whose rarest havings made blossoms dote
she was sought by spirits richest coat
but kept cold distance did thence remove
'but o sweet what labour is't leave
thing have not mast'ring what not strives
playing place which did no form receive
playing patient sports unconstrained gyves
she her fame so herself contrives
scars battle scapeth by flight
makes her absence valiant not her might
'o pardon boast true
accident which brought her eye
now she would caged cloister fly
religious love put out religions eye
not tempted would she immured
now tempt all liberty procured
'how mighty then are o hear tell
broken bosoms belong
have emptied all their fountains well
mine pour ocean all among
strong o'er them o'er being strong
as compound love physic cold breast
'my parts had pow'r charm sacred nun
who disciplined ay dieted grace
believed her eyes when they t'assail begun
all vows consecrations giving place
o most potential love vow bond nor space
thee hath neither sting knot nor confine
thou art all all things else are thine
'when thou impressest what are precepts worth
how coldly those impediments stand forth
wealth filial fear law kindred fame
love's arms are peace 'gainst rule 'gainst sense 'gainst shame
sweetens suff'ring pangs bears
aloes all forces shocks fears
'now all these hearts do mine depend
feeling break bleeding groans they pine
supplicant their sighs extend
leave batt'ry make 'gainst mine
credent soul strong bonded oath
shall prefer undertake troth
'this said his wat'ry eyes he did dismount
whose sights till then were levelled face
each cheek river running from fount
brinish current downward flowed apace
o how channel stream gave grace
who glazed crystal gate glowing roses
flame through water which their hue encloses
small orb one particular tear
but inundation eyes
what rocky heart water will not wear
what breast so cold not warmed here
o cleft effect cold modesty hot wrath
both fire from hence chill extincture hath
'for lo his passion but an art craft
even there resolved reason into tears
there white stole chastity daffed
appear him as he appears
all melting though our drops this diff'rence bore
his poisoned mine did him restore
'in him plenitude subtle matter
applied cautels all strange forms receives
burning blushes or weeping water
or swooning paleness he takes leaves
either's aptness as best deceives
blush at speeches rank weep at woes
'that not heart which his level came
could scape hail his all hurting aim
showing fair nature both kind tame
veiled them did win whom he would maim
against thing he sought he would exclaim
when he most burned heart wished luxury
he preached pure maid praised cold chastity
'thus merely garment grace
naked concealed fiend he covered
which cherubin above them hovered
who young simple would not so lovered
ay fell yet do question make
what should do again such sake
'o infected moisture his eye
o false fire which his cheek so glowed
o forced thunder from his heart did fly
o sad breath his spongy lungs bestowed
o all borrowed motion seeming owed
new pervert reconciled maid'
end
